analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag bya dang // mdo bshad pa dang dgos pa dang // yang dag sbyin rgyun ma chad brjod //

analyzed: gang dag rnams kyis 'chad du bcug rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de'i byin rlabs dang bskul ba dag gis de bshad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gis blangs nas bdag la rnam phye ba //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thogs med kyis so //

original: de dag rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po la stsogs pa ji skad smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po la stsogs pa ji skad smos pa rnams so //
translated: the noble Vajra Heart and so on, as mentioned.🔽And in this supreme teaching,🔽means

original: chos mchog 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo chen po la ste /🔽'di'i mchog nyid 'di ni thog mar spyad pa ste /
analyzed: chos mchog 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo chen po la ste / 'di'i mchog nyid 'di ni thog mar spyad pa ste /
translated: in the Great Sutra of the Tenth Stage.🔽Its supremacy is taught by the example of the later letters, beginning with

original: zhes bya ba la stsogs pa'i yi ge'i phyi mo'i dpes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la stsogs pa'i yi ge'i phyi mo'i dpes ston to //
translated: This is the first practice.

original: spyi bo sa la gtugs te zhes bya ba ni spyi bo thur du phab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyi bo sa la gtugs te zhes bya ba ni spyi bo thur du phab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase touching one's head to the ground means to lower one's head to the ground.

original: 'di dag la ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag la ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done with them?

original: phyag 'tshal nas mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase having paid homage means having made offerings.

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba ston pa na chos gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos smra ba rdo rje'i snying por smos te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang chos bla mar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba ston pa na chos gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos smra ba rdo rje'i snying por smos te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang chos bla mar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: When paying homage to the Three Jewels, the Dharma is mentioned first in the phrase to the Dharma-preacher Vajragarbha in order to indicate that the Dharma is primary. The Lord Buddhas also honor the Dharma as primary.

original: ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done with them?

original: de'i don / gnas par bya phyir bshad sbyar bya bar 'bad //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i don / gnas par bya phyir bshad sbyar bya bar 'bad // ces bya ba smras te /
translated: The verse continues: In order to preserve the meaning of the Dharma, I will compose this commentary.

original: gong du bshad pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase in order to preserve the meaning of the Dharma refers to the meaning of the above-mentioned Dharma categories.

original: bshad sbyar ni tshig mang pos rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad sbyar ni tshig mang pos rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: A commentary is an explanation with many words.

original: bdag dang gzhan don sgrub phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan don sgrub phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase in order to accomplish the aims of self and other indicates the purpose.

original: sa'i bsdus pa ni mdor bsdus te bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i bsdus pa ni mdor bsdus te bsnyad pa ste /
translated: The summary is the brief explanation.

original: @2b bde blag tu go bar bya ba'i phyir sa dang pos don ji snyed cig ston pa de dag btus nas thog mar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @2b bde blag tu go bar bya ba'i phyir sa dang pos don ji snyed cig ston pa de dag btus nas thog mar bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to make it easy to understand, the meaning of the first chapter is summarized and taught at the beginning.

original: gleng gzhi ni gang du gang dag la ston pa ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni gang du gang dag la ston pa ste /
translated: The setting is where and for whom the teaching is given.

original: gnas dang gdul ba rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas dang gdul ba rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is the place and the disciples, respectively.

original: 'dir ram 'di dag la gleng bas na gleng gzhi ste ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'dir ram 'di dag la gleng bas na gleng gzhi ste ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: It is the setting because it is set forth here or for these, or because it is set forth by the teacher.

original: zhes bya ba nas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: That is taught by “Thus have I heard at one time” up to “entered into meditative equipoise.”

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: Meditative equipoise is meditative stabilization.

original: dmigs pa la sems phyin ci ma log par gtod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems phyin ci ma log par gtod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the unmistaken placement of the mind on the object of meditation.

original: de yang de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya ba nas byin gyi rlabs kyi bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya ba nas byin gyi rlabs kyi bar gyis bstan to //
translated: That is taught by “Then the bodhisattva Vajra Heart” up to “blessing.”

original: byin gyi rlabs ni byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs ni byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: Blessing is the act of blessing.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par bya ba'i phyir lus dang sems la mthu nye bar sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par bya ba'i phyir lus dang sems la mthu nye bar sgrub pa ste /
translated: It is the establishment of power in the body and mind in order to accomplish the desired aim.

original: mthu lhag par bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthu lhag par bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the generation of superior power.

original: de yang rnams pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang rnams pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: That is taught in three parts:

original: gsung dang thugs dang skus so //
analyzed: gsung dang thugs dang skus so //
translated: by speech, mind, and body.

original: de la gsung gi ni rigs kyi bu khyod kyis chos rnams kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bcu tshan gyis bstan to //🔽thugs kyi ni de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid nye bar sgrub pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de la gsung gi ni rigs kyi bu khyod kyis chos rnams kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bcu tshan gyis bstan to // thugs kyi ni de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid nye bar sgrub pa mdzad de /
translated: Among them, the speech is taught by the ten statements beginning with “Son of noble family, you will become skilled in the opening of the door of Dharma, the Dharma discourse called…”🔽The mind is taught by the ten statements beginning with “Then those buddha bhagavāns established the bodhisattva Vajra Heart in the attainment of the body that is not overcome by others…”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bcu tshan gyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bcu tshan gyis bstan to //
translated: The body is taught by the ten statements beginning with “Then those buddha bhagavāns established the bodhisattva Vajra Heart in the attainment of the body that is not overcome by others…”

original: sku'i ni de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams de dag na bzhugs bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus phyag g-yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: sku'i ni de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams de dag na bzhugs bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus phyag g-yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The body of the Buddha Bhagavats, while dwelling there, by the power of their magic, with their right hands, etc.

original: ldang ba ni rnam par ldang ba ste /
analyzed: ldang ba ni rnam par ldang ba ste /
translated: Rising is emerging.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya ba byas nas des bskyed pa'i sems nus pa can dmigs pa dang 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya ba byas nas des bskyed pa'i sems nus pa can dmigs pa dang 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having performed the action of meditative equipoise, the mind generated by that is separated from the object, that is the meaning of the expression.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la reg ma thag tu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la reg ma thag tu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, those Buddha Bhagavats, as soon as they touched the Bodhisattva Vajra garbha, up to

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smas pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smas pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: they spoke to those Bodhisattvas.

original: bstan pa ni mdor bstan pa steng 'og nas 'byung ba'i don rnams ming tsam gyis bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni mdor bstan pa steng 'og nas 'byung ba'i don rnams ming tsam gyis bsnyad pa ste /
translated: Teaching is the brief teaching, the explanation of the meanings that will occur below and above by mere name.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras @3a * //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras @3a * //
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones!

original: dag byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di ni shin tu rnam par nges pa ste /
analyzed: dag byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di ni shin tu rnam par nges pa ste /
translated: This Bodhisattva vow is extremely certain.

original: zhes bya ba nas bskul ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas bskul ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with “thus” and ending with “exhortation”.

original: bskul ba ni 'chol ba ste ji ltar 'dod pa'i don mnyam pa'i phyir lhag par don du gnyer zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskul ba ni 'chol ba ste ji ltar 'dod pa'i don mnyam pa'i phyir lhag par don du gnyer zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Exhortation is request. Because the meaning is equal to what is desired, it means “to strive for”.

original: de yang de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba nas bshad pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba nas bshad pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with “then the Bodhisattva Vimuktisena” and ending with “explained”.

original: de yang yang dag par 'dzin pa ni rgyal ba'i sras po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par 'dzin pa ni rgyal ba'i sras po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the correct holders are the Victor’s sons Vimuktisena and so forth.

original: rgyal ba rnams ni bskul ba yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams ni bskul ba yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The Victors are to be known as the exhortors.

original: de yang 'od zer stug por reg pa de las tshig 'thon po de dag gis bcol to //
analyzed: de yang 'od zer stug por reg pa de las tshig 'thon po de dag gis bcol to //
translated: Moreover, they are exhorted by the words that come from that contact with the thick light rays.

original: bshad pa ni nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: Explanation is the teaching.

original: sa ming tsam bstan pa rnams gtan la phab ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sa ming tsam bstan pa rnams gtan la phab ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the mere names of the stages is settled and explained.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold.

original: gnas pa dang ni nges tshig dang // de bzhin rab tu gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ni nges tshig dang // de bzhin rab tu gnas pa nyid //
translated: 1. Abiding, and the etymological definition, and likewise, the state of being well-established,

original: sa bshad pa la mdor na ni //
analyzed: sa bshad pa la mdor na ni //
translated: 2. the explanation of the stages, in brief,

original: 'di ni nges par bstan bya yin //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par bstan bya yin //
translated: this is what should be taught.

original: de la gnas pa ni ci 'dra ba dag cig / gang gi phyir gzhi gang gis gang zhig bskyed pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni ci 'dra ba dag cig / gang gi phyir gzhi gang gis gang zhig bskyed pas gnas pa ste /
translated: Here, what is the abiding? By what is what generated, and through what is what generated?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / gnas dang gang gi phyir dang ni //🔽gzhi ni gang zhig yin pa dang // ci 'dra yang dag bskyed pa yis //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas dang gang gi phyir dang ni // gzhi ni gang zhig yin pa dang // ci 'dra yang dag bskyed pa yis //
translated: The abiding is that which is the abiding, and the reason,🔽and the basis, and what is generated, and what is like.

original: gnas 'gyur de ni gnas pa yin //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bstsags pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas 'gyur de ni gnas pa yin // dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bstsags pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The abiding is that which is the abiding, and the reason, and the basis, and what is generated, and what is like.

original: grangs bzhin du bcu tshan bzhi po 'di dag bsdus so //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du bcu tshan bzhi po 'di dag bsdus so //
translated: From having accumulated the roots of virtue up to having attained the perfection of the supreme mind of enlightenment, these four sets of ten are included in order.

original: de la ci 'dra ba dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de la ci 'dra ba dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Here, what is like is taught by having accumulated the roots of virtue and so on.

original: gang gi phyir ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par 'dod par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par 'dod par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The reason is taught by having attained the perfection of the supreme mind of enlightenment and so on.

original: gzhi gang gis ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gzhi gang gis ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The basis is indicated by the words “because it is preceded by great compassion,” and so on.

original: gang zhig bskyed pas ni sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang zhig bskyed pas ni sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The generation is indicated by the words “as soon as the thought of awakening has been produced,” and so on.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni gtan la phab pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni gtan la phab pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The verbal definition is the definitive statement.

original: don dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the statement that is consistent with the meaning.🔽The first stage is called the Joyful One

original: mchog dga' mang phyir rgyal rnams kyis //
analyzed: mchog dga' mang phyir rgyal rnams kyis //
translated: because of the many superior joys of the victors.

original: sa ni rab tu dga' bshad pa //🔽ci 'dra ba yis dmigs gang la //
analyzed: sa ni rab tu dga' bshad pa // ci 'dra ba yis dmigs gang la //
translated: The verbal definition is considered

original: de ni nges pa'i tshig tu 'dod //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i tshig tu 'dod //
translated: to be the meaning of the term and the referent.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @3b mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @3b mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: “O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva stage called the Joyful One has many superior joys.”

original: bcu tshan gsum po 'di dag dang / 'jig pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa yang bsdus par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bcu tshan gsum po 'di dag dang / 'jig pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa yang bsdus par shes par bya ste /
translated: The three sets of ten and the transcendence of the five fears are also included in this.

original: bdag ni 'jig pa dang sdang ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes mchog tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no//
analyzed: bdag ni 'jig pa dang sdang ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes mchog tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no//
translated: One should generate supreme joy.

original: rab tu gnas pa ni mchog tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa ni mchog tu gnas pa ste /
translated: Supremely abiding means abiding in the supreme.

original: gang dag dang ldan nas 'di la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dang ldan nas 'di la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: When one possesses these, one abides in the supreme.

original: de yang sa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang sa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because one goes to the end of the stage.

original: gnas pa ni sa thob pa tsam yin pas gnas pa bas rab tu gnas par khyad zhugs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni sa thob pa tsam yin pas gnas pa bas rab tu gnas par khyad zhugs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Abiding is merely attaining the stage, so it should be understood that abiding in the supreme is superior to mere abiding.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sa dang po'i //🔽rab gnas dad dbang la sogs pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sa dang po'i // rab gnas dad dbang la sogs pa //
translated: The first stage of the victors🔽is explained by three sets of ten,

original: bcu tshan gsum gyis rab bshad pas //
analyzed: bcu tshan gsum gyis rab bshad pas //
translated: such as supreme abiding and the power of faith.

original: de ni de bzhin nges par gzung //🔽de dad pa'i dbang dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nges par gzung // de dad pa'i dbang dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: It should be understood as it is.

original: bcu tshan gsum po 'di dag bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu tshan gsum po 'di dag bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: From the power of faith up to the power of knowledge, these three sets of ten should be understood as included.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying pos ma bshad pa'i sngon rol du tshigs su bcad pa bcu tshan gsungs pa ni 'khor dad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying pos ma bshad pa'i sngon rol du tshigs su bcad pa bcu tshan gsungs pa ni 'khor dad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The ten verses spoken prior to the explanation of the noble Vajra Essence are for the purpose of inspiring faith in the retinue.

original: bshad pa rtsom pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa dang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa rtsom pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa dang shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is the beginning of the explanation, it is to be explained and understood.

original: khyad par ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni bye brag ste /
translated: Distinction means difference.

original: yon tan lhag par gsal ba 'am /
analyzed: yon tan lhag par gsal ba 'am /
translated: It is the manifestation of superior qualities,

original: gang gis na nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis na nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad 'jug pa'o //
translated: by which it is distinguished from the Hearers and so forth.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste 'dun pa'i khyad par dang ; sgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste 'dun pa'i khyad par dang ; sgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ro //
translated: Moreover, it is threefold: distinction of aspiration, distinction of practice, and distinction of the benefit of the result.

original: de de la 'dun pa ni don du gnyer ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / smon pa ste /
analyzed: de de la 'dun pa ni don du gnyer ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / smon pa ste /
translated: Aspiration is the desire, the wish, and the prayer for that.

original: smon lam bcu mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam bcu mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the ten prayers.

original: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: Practice is tenfold.

original: sa bcu yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sa bcu yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic of the Dharma that purifies the ten stages.

original: de yang dad pa dang snying rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang dad pa dang snying rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Moreover, it is taught by faith, compassion, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The benefit of the result is fourfold:

original: las su rung ba nyid dang / 'jug pa dang / rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / smon pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid dang / 'jug pa dang / rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / smon pa shes pa'o //
translated: serviceability, engagement, taking up the evolutionary development of living beings, and knowing the vow.

original: de la las su rung ba nyid ni gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes bstan to //
analyzed: de la las su rung ba nyid ni gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes bstan to //
translated: Among them, serviceability is taught by the example of refined gold.

original: 'jug pa ni ded dpon gyi dpes bstan to //🔽rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni /🔽'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni ded dpon gyi dpes bstan to // rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni / 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Engagement is taught by the example of a caravan leader.🔽Taking up the evolutionary development of living beings is taught by the example of a great king.

original: smon pa shes pa ni de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //🔽'di'i bsdus @4a * //
analyzed: smon pa shes pa ni de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to // 'di'i bsdus @4a * //
translated: Knowing the vow is taught by the example of a great king of physicians.

original: pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary of this chapter is:

original: mdor bsdu na ni bdun pa dang // sgrub pa dang ni rnam smin gyi //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni bdun pa dang // sgrub pa dang ni rnam smin gyi //
translated: In brief, the seventh, the practice, and the evolutionary development,

original: nyan thos dang ni rang rgyal las //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ni rang rgyal las //
translated: are superior to the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis bsngags par bshad //🔽de la 'dun pa ji skad du //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis bsngags par bshad // de la 'dun pa ji skad du //
translated: It is praised in three ways.🔽Aspiration is explained as

original: bshad pa'i smon lam yin zhes bya //🔽sgrub pa'i khyad par dad la sogs //
analyzed: bshad pa'i smon lam yin zhes bya // sgrub pa'i khyad par dad la sogs //
translated: the wish for the above.🔽The special practice is explained

original: bcu po dag gis bshad pa yin //🔽rgyu bzhi dag gis 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: bcu po dag gis bshad pa yin // rgyu bzhi dag gis 'bras bu yi //
translated: as the ten such as faith.🔽The benefits of the result are considered

original: phan yon khyad par dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: phan yon khyad par dag tu 'dod //
translated: special due to four causes.🔽Because of suitability, engagement,🔽complete attainment of the result,

original: las rung nyid dang 'jug pa dang // rnam smin yongs su 'dzin pa dang // bzhi pa smon lam nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: las rung nyid dang 'jug pa dang // rnam smin yongs su 'dzin pa dang // bzhi pa smon lam nyid kyi phyir //
translated: and aspiration,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni shes par bya //
translated: it should be understood as having four aspects.

original: sa le sbram dang chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: sa le sbram dang chos mthun phyir //
translated: Because of similarity to gold,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis las rung bshad //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis las rung bshad //
translated: the victors have explained suitability.

original: ded dpon dang ni chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: ded dpon dang ni chos mthun phyir //
translated: Because of similarity to a captain,

original: de dag gis ni 'jug pa gsungs //🔽mkhas pa rnam smin yongs 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'jug pa gsungs // mkhas pa rnam smin yongs 'dzin pa //
translated: they have taught engagement.🔽The wise should know complete attainment of the result

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
translated: to be twofold.

original: bdag nyid chen po nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of greatness,🔽it is like the lord of the Rose Apple Land.

original: 'dzam gling dbang phyug la sogs dang // gnyis pa rgyu mthun rgya che ba ;
analyzed: 'dzam gling dbang phyug la sogs dang // gnyis pa rgyu mthun rgya che ba ;
translated: The second is the vast natural outflow.

original: ; ser sna 'dul la sogs pa gang //
analyzed: ; ser sna 'dul la sogs pa gang //
translated: 2. The second stage is called Stainless because it is free of the stain of immorality.🔽3. The third stage is called Luminous because the light of wisdom arises from the practice of the transcendent aids to enlightenment.

original: ting 'dzin rab sgom bcas shes bya //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rab sgom bcas shes bya //
translated: 4. The fourth stage is called Radiant because the fire of wisdom burns the underbrush of the afflictions.🔽5. The fifth stage is called Hard to Conquer because it is difficult for the pride of the self and the afflictions to conquer it.

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽smon pa shes zhes bya ba ni //🔽smon lam stobs can yin pas na //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // smon pa shes zhes bya ba ni // smon lam stobs can yin pas na //
translated: 6. The sixth stage is called Face to Face because one directly faces the door to the peacefulness of the noble stages.

original: de yi khyad par rnam 'phrul phyir //🔽chos ni brgyad po 'di dag gis //
analyzed: de yi khyad par rnam 'phrul phyir // chos ni brgyad po 'di dag gis //
translated: 7. The seventh stage is called Far-reaching because the wisdom of the bodhisattva who is in it reaches to the end of the realm of space.

original: sa yi dang po yang dag gsungs //🔽'di man chad du 'di dag rgyas par bshad dgos pas de brtsam par bya'o //🔽'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di dpe la yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa yi dang po yang dag gsungs // 'di man chad du 'di dag rgyas par bshad dgos pas de brtsam par bya'o // 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di dpe la yang 'byung ste /
translated: 8. The eighth stage is called Immovable because it is unmoved by the signs of construction or by the signs of the passions.

original: dper na rnam thos ltar phyug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽lung 'bogs pa la yang 'byung ste /🔽'di skad du thon cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //🔽dris pa nges par bya ba la yang 'byung ste /🔽'di skad bdag gis thos so //
analyzed: dper na rnam thos ltar phyug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o // lung 'bogs pa la yang 'byung ste / 'di skad du thon cig ces bya ba lta bu'o // dris pa nges par bya ba la yang 'byung ste / 'di skad bdag gis thos so //
translated: 9. The ninth stage is called Excellent Wisdom because it is the stage of the excellence of the wisdom of skillful methods.

original: 'di skad du 'chad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'chad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: 10. The tenth stage is called Cloud of Teaching because it is obscured by great compassion and it rains the rain of Dharma on the dry earth of the afflictions of beings.

original: tshig gi lan la yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshig gi lan la yang 'byung ste /
translated: It also occurs in the answer to a question.

original: de ni de lta yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni de lta yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like saying, “It is just so.”

original: 'di ni dam 'cha' ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dam 'cha' ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be seen as a promise.

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin du bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpas de bzhin du 'chad do zhes khas 'ches pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin du bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpas de bzhin du 'chad do zhes khas 'ches pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are gathering together request, “Please explain just as you have heard it,” and the bodhisattva promises, “I will explain just like that.”

original: rnam par bcad nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par bcad nas sbyar ro //
translated: Having promised, he connects it by way of elimination.

original: dam bcas nas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs @4b pas smras so //
analyzed: dam bcas nas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs @4b pas smras so //
translated: Having promised, he says, “I heard this,” and so on.

original: yang na dris pa nges par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na dris pa nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: Or it is to be ascertained by way of a question.

original: dris pa nges par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dris pa nges par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ascertain the question,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes smos so //
translated: he says, “Thus have I heard.”

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “I” means

original: bdag nyid kyi yin gyis gzhan las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yin gyis gzhan las ma yin pa'o //
translated: it is of myself and not of another.

original: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos bzung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos bzung ba'o //
translated: “Heard” means apprehended by the ear faculty.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na rgyun chags par ro //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na rgyun chags par ro //
translated: At one time means at one time in a continuous series.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni 'di la skal ba yod pas na bcom ldan 'das te /🔽nyon mongs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir rang dbang nyid dang / ye shes kyi mes legs par yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs bzang ba nyid dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni 'di la skal ba yod pas na bcom ldan 'das te / nyon mongs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir rang dbang nyid dang / ye shes kyi mes legs par yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs bzang ba nyid dang /
translated: Blessed One means that he is a blessed one because he has good fortune.

original: yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir grags pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dpal dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phrin las nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir bdag nyid chen po tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir grags pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dpal dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phrin las nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir bdag nyid chen po tshogs pa ste /
translated: He is independent because he is not subject to the control of the afflictions, he is well disciplined because he is well refined by the fire of transcendent wisdom, he is well proportioned because he is endowed with the thirty two marks of a great being, he is famous because he is endowed with all good qualities, he is glorious because he is the foremost of all beings, and he is a great being because he is never deficient in the activity of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de dag 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de dag 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is a blessed one because he possesses these qualities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is he a blessed one?

original: skal ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan drug po ji skad bshad pa rnams kyi rnam grangs kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan drug po ji skad bshad pa rnams kyi rnam grangs kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said:🔽Self-mastery, serenity,🔽a good figure, fame,

original: smras pa / rang dbang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che tshogs pa //
analyzed: smras pa / rang dbang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che tshogs pa //
translated: glory, and greatness of retinue

original: drug la skal ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: drug la skal ba zhes bshad do //
translated: are the six kinds of good fortune.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon te zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yun ring po ma lon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon te zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yun ring po ma lon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not long after his full enlightenment means that a long time had not elapsed after his full enlightenment.

original: 'di nyid bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir zhag bdun pa gnyis pa'i tshe zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir zhag bdun pa gnyis pa'i tshe zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to specify this, it says: in the second week.

original: zhag bdun pa gnyis pa srid pa ni gdul ba'i dbang du rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa gnyis pa srid pa ni gdul ba'i dbang du rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second week of existence is blessed by his magical power in order to convert those to be converted.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rgya cher rol pa'i mdo chen po las /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rgya cher rol pa'i mdo chen po las /
translated: Otherwise, in the Great Sutra of the Play in Full,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun pa dang po'i tshe ni byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs bzhin du dga' ba'i zas bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun pa dang po'i tshe ni byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs bzhin du dga' ba'i zas bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas so //
translated: In the first week, the Bhagavat, while remaining in the Bodhi tree, remained in the samadhi called “Array of the Food of Joy.”

original: gnyis pa'i tshe ni spyan gnyis mi 'dzums par byang chub kyi shing la gzigs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i tshe ni spyan gnyis mi 'dzums par byang chub kyi shing la gzigs so //
translated: In the second week, he looked at the Bodhi tree without blinking.🔽In the third week, he walked far, from the trichiliocosm

original: gsum pa'i tshe ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas bzung ste /🔽'chag pa rgyang ring du bcags so //🔽bzhi pa'i tshe ni shar gyi rgya mtsho dang / nub @5a * //🔽kyi rgya mtsho nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i tshe ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas bzung ste / 'chag pa rgyang ring du bcags so // bzhi pa'i tshe ni shar gyi rgya mtsho dang / nub @5a * // kyi rgya mtsho nas bzung ste /
translated: up to the world of Brahma.🔽In the fourth week, he walked a short distance, from the eastern ocean

original: 'chag pa rgyang thung dur bcags so //
analyzed: 'chag pa rgyang thung dur bcags so //
translated: up to the western ocean.

original: lnga pa'i tshe ni btang bzung gi gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: lnga pa'i tshe ni btang bzung gi gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: In the fifth week, he stayed in the abode of Mahesvara.

original: drug pa'i tshe ni ri rdzi shing n+ya gro dha'i nang na bzhugs so //
analyzed: drug pa'i tshe ni ri rdzi shing n+ya gro dha'i nang na bzhugs so //
translated: In the sixth week, he stayed in the middle of the nyagrodha tree.

original: bdun pa'i tshe ni shing rgyal po'i zas zhes bya ba'i drung na bzhugs so zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa dang ; /'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du byang chub kyi snying po dang nye ba na bzhugs so zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: bdun pa'i tshe ni shing rgyal po'i zas zhes bya ba'i drung na bzhugs so zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa dang ; /'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du byang chub kyi snying po dang nye ba na bzhugs so zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro
translated: and the assertion of some Vinaya masters that the Bhagavan resided for forty nine days near the site of enlightenment after first attaining complete buddhahood.

original: // gdul ba'i bye brag gis ni de dag gnyi ga nas yang snang bas mi 'gal te /
analyzed: // gdul ba'i bye brag gis ni de dag gnyi ga nas yang snang bas mi 'gal te /
translated: But they are not contradictory, because they appear in different contexts.

original: de ltar na zhag bdun pa gnyis pa srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na zhag bdun pa gnyis pa srid do //
translated: Thus the second seven day period is possible.

original: 'di dag la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba'i rab kyi phul du phyin pa thob pa dang sprul pa'i bde ba la dbang byed pa yod pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba'i rab kyi phul du phyin pa thob pa dang sprul pa'i bde ba la dbang byed pa yod pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams so //
translated: They are called Paranirmitavasavartins because they have the highest virtue of the desire realm and they control the pleasure of emanations.

original: lha de rnams kyi nang na zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang gsal bar byed pas lha rnams te /
analyzed: lha de rnams kyi nang na zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang gsal bar byed pas lha rnams te /
translated: Among those gods means among the gods who delight and shine.

original: dga' ba dang yid bde ba mang ba'i phyir dga' bar byed la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang yid bde ba mang ba'i phyir dga' bar byed la /
translated: They delight because they have much joy and mental satisfaction.

original: 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir gsal bar byed do //
translated: They shine because they possess light.

original: lha de dag rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rnams kyis bstod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lha de dag rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rnams kyis bstod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: Since those gods possess magical power, they are praised by humans.

original: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni bzhugs shing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni bzhugs shing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Abiding means dwelling.

original: dbang bsgyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha thams cad dang bde ba'i longs spyod rnams la dbang bsgyur bas na dbang bsgyur te de'i 'o //
analyzed: dbang bsgyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha thams cad dang bde ba'i longs spyod rnams la dbang bsgyur bas na dbang bsgyur te de'i 'o //
translated: They are called the rulers because they rule over all the gods who enjoy desire realm objects and over the enjoyments of pleasure.

original: lha rnams kyi 'am lha rnams nang na rgyal po yin pas lha'i rgyal po ste rje bo yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi 'am lha rnams nang na rgyal po yin pas lha'i rgyal po ste rje bo yin no //
translated: They are the king of the gods because they are the lord of the gods.

original: de'i gzhal med khang zhes bya ba ni de la lha rnams kyi dngos po sna tshogs dang mdzes par byed pa dag gcod par byed pas na gzhal med khang ste ngo bo sna tshogs su shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gzhal med khang zhes bya ba ni de la lha rnams kyi dngos po sna tshogs dang mdzes par byed pa dag gcod par byed pas na gzhal med khang ste ngo bo sna tshogs su shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The palace of that god is called a celestial palace because it is a place where the gods cut off various things and make them beautiful.

original: nor bu rin po che'i snying po can gyi khang bzangs de na zhes bya ba ni 'di ni snying por nor bu rin po che dag yod pas nor bu rin po che'i snying po can te /🔽'di na nor bu rin po che dag yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i snying po can gyi khang bzangs de na zhes bya ba ni 'di ni snying por nor bu rin po che dag yod pas nor bu rin po che'i snying po can te / 'di na nor bu rin po che dag yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The palace is the essence of precious jewels because it is made of precious jewels.🔽It is a palace because it is a place where the gods are delighted by seeing it.

original: yang na gzhal med khang de'i nang dang / gces dgu nor bu rin po che dag las byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽khang bzangs de na zhes bya ba ni de mthong bas lha rnams dang bar 'gyur bas khang bzangs so //🔽yongs su dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na gzhal med khang de'i nang dang / gces dgu nor bu rin po che dag las byas pa'i phyir ro // khang bzangs de na zhes bya ba ni de mthong bas lha rnams dang bar 'gyur bas khang bzangs so // yongs su dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, the celestial palace is made of precious jewels.🔽The palace is a place where the gods are delighted by seeing it.

original: khang bzangs de na'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs de na'o //
translated: It is a palace because it is a place where the gods are delighted by seeing it.🔽It is a palace because it is a place where the gods are delighted by seeing it.🔽It is a palace because it is a place where the gods are delighted by seeing it.

original: @5b dang por zhes bya ba ni gnas de nas dang por zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de lta ma yin na rol pa bsgrags pa'i ting nge 'dzin las de bzhin gshegs pa dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas byang chub kyi snying po mchog dam pa la bzhugs shing skyil mo krung ma bshig par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'dus
analyzed: @5b dang por zhes bya ba ni gnas de nas dang por zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de lta ma yin na rol pa bsgrags pa'i ting nge 'dzin las de bzhin gshegs pa dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas byang chub kyi snying po mchog dam pa la bzhugs shing skyil mo krung ma bshig par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'dus
translated: First means that he first went to that place.🔽Otherwise, it would contradict the statement in the Sūtra on the Trance of the Heroic One:

original: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol ba btab ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, after first attaining complete enlightenment, remained on the sublime, supreme site of enlightenment, and without changing his cross legged posture, was requested by bodhisattvas gathered from the worlds of the ten directions and by the gods of the immaculate heavens to explain the trance of the heroic one.

original: rol pa bsgrags pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad nas nang du yang dag 'jog gces su 'dzin pa rnams gdul ba'i don du nang du yang dag gzhag pa'i phyir /🔽dbang po'i brag phug tu gshegs so zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rol pa bsgrags pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad nas nang du yang dag 'jog gces su 'dzin pa rnams gdul ba'i don du nang du yang dag gzhag pa'i phyir /🔽dbang po'i brag phug tu gshegs so zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in order to tame those who cherish meditative equipoise, he went to the cave of the sense faculties in order to enter meditative equipoise.

original: gnas kyi sgo nas ni dang po nyid la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gnas kyi sgo nas ni dang po nyid la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the first case, from the point of view of place.

original: rgya cher rol ba'i gzhung yang rdzu 'phrul gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis gnyi gar snang bas mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rgya cher rol ba'i gzhung yang rdzu 'phrul gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis gnyi gar snang bas mi 'gal te /
translated: And there is no contradiction in the second case, from the point of view of the text of the Lalita Vistara, because the Buddha, by the power of his supernormal knowledge, appeared in both places.

original: 'di ni dang por zhes bya ba 'di'i lan yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dang por zhes bya ba 'di'i lan yang yin no //
translated: This is also the answer to the question, “Why did he first turn the wheel of the Dharma in the Deer Park?”

original: yul de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang bsgyur gyi khang pa yin pa'i phyir dang / khang bzangs yin pa'i phyir mchog nyid do //
analyzed: yul de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang bsgyur gyi khang pa yin pa'i phyir dang / khang bzangs yin pa'i phyir mchog nyid do //
translated: The place is supreme because it is the abode of the gods, because it is the palace of the lord of the gods, and because it is the palace of the gods.

original: de'i 'bras bu 'dir mngon par grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu 'dir mngon par grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The result is established here, because the result is established in this place.

original: rgyu dang rgyu can gnyis yul so so ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu can gnyis yul so so ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This shows that the cause and the result are not in different places.

original: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: It is like the seed and the sprout.

original: de la mdo 'di mnyan pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid gang yin pa de rdo rje'i gdan du thob pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mdo 'di mnyan pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid gang yin pa de rdo rje'i gdan du thob pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is Buddhahood, which is attained on the Diamond Throne, because it is seen in the stages of listening, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i gnas pas gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rgya cher rol ba'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun pa dang po'i tshe /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i gnas pas gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rgya cher rol ba'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun pa dang po'i tshe /
translated: Because he abides by the process of dependent origination.🔽How does this not contradict the extensive play sutra, which states that the Bhagavan abides in the first week,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs bzhin du dga' ba'i zas bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs bzhin du dga' ba'i zas bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: while seated at the site of awakening, by means of the concentration of the array of the food of joy?

original: 'gal ba med de rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas gnas pa ni dga' ba'i zas bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med de rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas gnas pa ni dga' ba'i zas bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction, because abiding by the process of dependent origination is a synonym for the concentration of the array of the food of joy.

original: yang na rnam grangs nyid ma yin yang gdul ba'i bye brag gis rdzu 'phrul gyis de ltar snang ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na rnam grangs nyid ma yin yang gdul ba'i bye brag gis rdzu 'phrul gyis de ltar snang ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, even if it is not a synonym, there is no fault in that it appears to disciples in that way through his miraculous powers.

original: der kun dga' bas na chos nyid kun dga' yin te /
analyzed: der kun dga' bas na chos nyid kun dga' yin te /
translated: Or else, it is called joy because it delights,

original: shing aa mra'i kun dga'i ra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing aa mra'i kun dga'i ra ba bzhin no //
translated: like an orchard of mango trees.

original: dgyes zhes bya ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i dgyes pa ste /
analyzed: dgyes zhes bya ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i dgyes pa ste /
translated: Delight is uncontaminated joy.

original: rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag @6a * //🔽par bstar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag @6a * // par bstar ba'o //
translated: and the joy and bliss of liberation are fully present.🔽He is said to abide in that state, having attained perfect buddhahood for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang de gzhag ste de gnas so zhes de'i che ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang de gzhag ste de gnas so zhes de'i che ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The greatness of the Buddha is expressed in this way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni grangs mang ba dang / yon tan che ba'i phyir chen po ste de dang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni grangs mang ba dang / yon tan che ba'i phyir chen po ste de dang ngo //
translated: The great assembly of bodhisattvas is great because of its great number and its great qualities.

original: byang chub ces bya ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / de spangs pas ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / de spangs pas ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their propensities, and the purity and nonobstruction of the gnosis that results from that abandonment.

original: spangs pa dang / ye shes 'di ni byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: spangs pa dang / ye shes 'di ni byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: This abandonment and gnosis is called enlightenment.

original: de la mos pa dang zhugs pa'i sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa dang zhugs pa'i sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is one who aspires to and engages in that enlightenment.

original: de dag gi tshogs ni dge 'dun te /
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs ni dge 'dun te /
translated: The assembly of those bodhisattvas is the Sangha.

original: de na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs pa de dang thabs cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs pa de dang thabs cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase together with a great multitude of bodhisattvas means along with.

original: de dag smos pa ni theg pa chen po bstan pa de dag gi ched yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe 'di na nyan thos rnams mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don la mngon par mi brtson pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag smos pa ni theg pa chen po bstan pa de dag gi ched yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe 'di na nyan thos rnams mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don la mngon par mi brtson pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are mentioned because the teaching of the Great Vehicle is for their sake, and because at that time the disciples did not exist there, and because they did not come from other world-realms, since they do not strive for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lha'i bu'i gzugs su 'dug pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' smos pa kho nas bsdus so //
analyzed: de na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lha'i bu'i gzugs su 'dug pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' smos pa kho nas bsdus so //
translated: Those bodhisattvas who were in the form of sons of gods are included in the mention of bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan dag kyang yod mod kyi gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ma smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yod mod kyi gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ma smos so //
translated: Others do exist, but they are not mentioned because they are not principal.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas yang dag par lhags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas yang dag par lhags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase gathered from the buddha-fields means gathered from the buddha-fields and come together.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba thugs rje chen po can sems can thams cad la phan pa dang brtson pa dag chos ston par mdzad na ci'i phyir de dag bor nas chos
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba thugs rje chen po can sems can thams cad la phan pa dang brtson pa dag chos ston par mdzad na ci'i phyir de dag bor nas chos
translated: When in those buddhafields the buddhas, the bhagavats, who have unobstructed wisdom, great compassion, and strive to benefit all sentient beings, teach the Dharma, why do you abandon them and seek the Dharma from me?

original: mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhing 'dir 'ong zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhing 'dir 'ong zhe na /
translated: When the buddhas in those buddha fields are buddhas who have unobstructed gnosis, great compassion, and strive to benefit all sentient beings, why do they abandon them and come to this buddha field to listen to the Dharma?

original: smras pa sems can sngon smin par byas pa 'dir skyes pa chos nyan par 'os pa rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang / 'di la 'khod pa gus pa dang mi ldan pa rnams gang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dir 'ong na /
analyzed: smras pa sems can sngon smin par byas pa 'dir skyes pa chos nyan par 'os pa rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang / 'di la 'khod pa gus pa dang mi ldan pa rnams gang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dir 'ong na /
translated: He said, “In order to guide those sentient beings who were previously ripened and born here, who are worthy to listen to the Dharma, and in order to generate respect in those who are not respectful, thinking, ‘If those who come here to listen to the Dharma from other world systems

original: ci'i phyir bdag cag 'di na 'khod pa rnams kyis chos mnyan pa'i phyir gus par mi 'dong zhes gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag cag 'di na 'khod pa rnams kyis chos mnyan pa'i phyir gus par mi 'dong zhes gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: why don’t we who are here go respectfully to listen to the Dharma?’”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha and so on means that he is the principal one.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la @6b sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la @6b sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said that they are like this.

original: rdo rje'i snying po ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'chad pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'chad pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin no //
translated: Vajra garbha is the principal one because he explains the categories of the Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the bodhisattvas explained?

original: spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang /
analyzed: spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang /
translated: In order to generate enthusiasm, because the bodhisattvas also think

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis chos nyid zab mo 'di 'chad do snyam du skal ba mnyam pa'i sgrub pas gnas skabs de 'thob par spro ba skyed par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis chos nyid zab mo 'di 'chad do snyam du skal ba mnyam pa'i sgrub pas gnas skabs de 'thob par spro ba skyed par byed pa 'am /
translated: This profound reality is explained through the buddhas blessing and they generate enthusiasm for attaining that state through the practice of having the same fortune as the buddhas,

original: bdag cag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi phrin las su bskos so snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi phrin las su bskos so snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: or they think We have been appointed by the buddhas to the activity of the buddhas.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi choms pa dang 'joms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi choms pa dang / de dag 'joms par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi choms pa dang 'joms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi choms pa dang / de dag 'joms par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is a Dharma teaching that cannot be overcome by any of the afflictions and that overcomes them.

original: gzhan dag kyang de lta bu yin mod kyi de dag kyang 'di kho na'i nang du 'dus pas na 'di 'ba' zhig brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de lta bu yin mod kyi de dag kyang 'di kho na'i nang du 'dus pas na 'di 'ba' zhig brjod de /
translated: Other teachings are also like this, but since they are included in this one, only this is mentioned.

original: nang du 'dus par ni yi ge phyi mo'i dpes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: nang du 'dus par ni yi ge phyi mo'i dpes kyang 'chad do //
translated: It is also explained that they are included by the example of the later letters.🔽Because its essence is like a vajra.

original: snying po rdo rje dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni snying po'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: snying po rdo rje dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni snying po'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The roots of virtue are called the essence.

original: de dag kyang 'di thos pa las nges par skyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di thos pa las nges par skyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: And they are produced only from hearing this.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i snying po dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rdo rje dang 'dra bas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i snying po dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rdo rje dang 'dra bas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “because its essence is like a vajra” is a compound.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyus mi shigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngan song du nges pa'i las ngag gis mi shigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i rgyus mi shigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngan song du nges pa'i las ngag gis mi shigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that it is not destroyed by the karma that is certain to lead to lower realms.

original: ming 'di ni chos nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi 'dod rgyal ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ming 'di ni chos nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi 'dod rgyal ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This name is distinguished by reality and not by whim.

original: gzhan dag kyang de lta bu yin mod kyi 'on kyang thun mong ma yin pa brjod par 'dod dang de 'di kho na rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de lta bu yin mod kyi 'on kyang thun mong ma yin pa brjod par 'dod dang de 'di kho na rnam par gnas te /
translated: Others are also like this, but the uncommon is what is intended to be expressed.

original: dper na 'gro ba na ba las nga'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba na ba las nga'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when going, it is said, “I am.”

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba la de nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di ni bkra shis pa la sogs pa'i don la 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba la de nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di ni bkra shis pa la sogs pa'i don la 'byung ste /
translated: Then again, this word then occurs in the sense of auspiciousness and so on.

original: re zhig bkra shis pa la 'byung ba ni de nas rigs pa'i lam dang mthun pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig bkra shis pa la 'byung ba ni de nas rigs pa'i lam dang mthun pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It occurs in the sense of auspiciousness, as in Then one should engage in the path that accords with reasoning.

original: da dri ba la ni khyod kyis byas sam 'on te byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: da dri ba la ni khyod kyis byas sam 'on te byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the question is like Did you do it? or Are you doing it?.

original: skabs la ni da ni sgra rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: skabs la ni da ni sgra rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The context is like Now, the explanation of sound.

original: mjug thogs la ni khrus byas te de nas bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽dam 'cha' ba la ni khyod nga'i slob ma yin nam zhes dris na legs so zhes khas @7a * //
analyzed: mjug thogs la ni khrus byas te de nas bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o // dam 'cha' ba la ni khyod nga'i slob ma yin nam zhes dris na legs so zhes khas @7a * //
translated: The immediate sequence is like Having bathed, then one should eat.

original: 'che ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'che ba lta bu'o //
translated: The promise is like If you are asked if you are my student, you should say 'yes.'

original: bsdu ba la ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba la ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The collection is like Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: 'dir ni mjug thogs la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni mjug thogs la blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should look at the immediate sequence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dir lhags te ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dir lhags te ;
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra garbha, having come here together with the Bodhisattvas assembled from various Buddha-fields,

original: de nas mjug thogs su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas mjug thogs su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: immediately entered into meditation.

original: 'di zhes bya ba dang / yang zhes bya ba dang nyid ces bya ba 'di dag ni tshig kha bskang ba'i phrad du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba dang / yang zhes bya ba dang nyid ces bya ba 'di dag ni tshig kha bskang ba'i phrad du byas pa ste /
translated: The words this, also, and just are called connective particles that complete a sentence.

original: dper na gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa de bzang po 'di spyod do zhes bya ba dang / gang tshul khrims bsrung ba de yang mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de nyid ni thams cad du mchod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa de bzang po 'di spyod do zhes bya ba dang / gang tshul khrims bsrung ba de yang mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de nyid ni thams cad du mchod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, Whoever is omniscient, that good person practices this, or Whoever guards morality, that person is also wise, or Just that person is worshipped everywhere.

original: 'di yang tshig gi kha bskang ba kho na la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang tshig gi kha bskang ba kho na la blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be seen as just completing a sentence,

original: don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other meaning.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dus de nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dus de nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time means from that time.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the power of the Buddha means by the Buddha's blessing.

original: theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pos rab tu snang bas na theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pos rab tu snang bas na theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba ste /
translated: The Mahāyāna-prabhāsa is the Mahāyāna-prabhāsa because it shines with the Mahāyāna.

original: theg pa chen po la brten nas mchog dang / bsngags par snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la brten nas mchog dang / bsngags par snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gam /
translated: The word “appears” is understood to mean “is praised” or “is supreme” in the Mahāyāna.

original: yang na 'dis theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'dis theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is because this appears as the Mahāyāna.🔽This is the meaning of the words “appears as the Mahāyāna” and “is praised” or “is supreme.”

original: 'dis theg pa chen po mchog dang bsngags par snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba 'di ni smad pa la sogs pa la 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dis theg pa chen po mchog dang bsngags par snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba 'di ni smad pa la sogs pa la 'byung ste /
translated: This is used in the case of disparagement, etc.

original: re zhig smad pa la ni blun po yang smra'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig smad pa la ni blun po yang smra'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of disparagement, it is like saying, “Even fools speak.”

original: dri ba la ni de su yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dri ba la ni de su yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of a question, it is like saying, “Who is that?”

original: mi shi ba la ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi shi ba la ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of death, it is like saying, “He will die.”

original: mi bzod pa la ni nga la sngo 'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa la ni nga la sngo 'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of intolerance, it is like saying, “Do you hate me?”

original: ming la ni nag pa zhes bya ba 'am zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming la ni nag pa zhes bya ba 'am zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of a name, it is like saying, “Is it called ‘black’?”

original: grangs la ni stong zhes bya ba 'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: grangs la ni stong zhes bya ba 'am zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of a number, it is like saying, “Is it one thousand?”

original: mi rtag pa ston pa la ni du'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ston pa la ni du'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of teaching impermanence, it is like saying, “It is impermanent.”

original: 'dir ni ming la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ming la blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should look at the name.

original: theg pa chen po snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called the Illumination of the Great Vehicle.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: Samādhi is meditative concentration.

original: dmigs pa la sems phyin ci ma log pa'i rim gyis 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems phyin ci ma log pa'i rim gyis 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the mind is held on the object without error.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs zin zhes bya ba'i don te phyin ci ma @7b log pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su song zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs zin zhes bya ba'i don te phyin ci ma @7b log pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su song zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who enter that samādhi are said to have entered it. The meaning is that they have entered it. It is explained that they have gone to samādhi without error.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
translated: In order to teach that it is not the domain of logicians, what is it like?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pas de'i phyir 'di ni de'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pas de'i phyir 'di ni de'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because this Dharma discourse is explained through the power of the blessing of meditative concentration, therefore it is not their domain.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams kyang dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig shes par 'dong na de smon nas snyoms par zhugs pa dang / smon pa'i shes pas de bzhin du shes na 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag gis zhal bstan te zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang grangs mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi pha rol
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams kyang dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig shes par 'dong na de smon nas snyoms par zhugs pa dang / smon pa'i shes pas de bzhin du shes na 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to // de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag gis zhal bstan te zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang grangs mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi pha rol
translated: Thus, if even the śrāvakas, who are not objects of the sense faculties, are known, then what need is there to mention the knowledge of those who enter meditative equipoise through aspiration and have the knowledge of aspiration?

original: nas de dang grangs mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhal bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nas de dang grangs mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhal bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement “the tathāgatas, as numerous as the atoms in one hundred thousand buddhafields, reveal their faces” means that the tathāgatas, as numerous as the atoms in one hundred thousand buddhafields in the ten directions, reveal their faces from world systems that are as numerous as those atoms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi smon lam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs kyi sngon rol du sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan 'di zhes bya ba sha stag gis byin gyis rlob par gyur cig ces smon lam btab ste
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi smon lam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs kyi sngon rol du sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan 'di zhes bya ba sha stag gis byin gyis rlob par gyur cig ces smon lam btab ste
translated: For the sake of the Buddha’s aspiration means that he made the aspiration, “May Shakyamuni, who is called Vairochana, bless this sutra prior to the blessing, and may he be blessed by all those who have the name Vairochana.”

original: / thugs bskyed pa gang yin pa'i thugs mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / thugs bskyed pa gang yin pa'i thugs mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “because of the formation of his mind” means because of the formation of the mind that made that aspiration.

original: sangs rgyas mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang na re zhig mtshan mthun pa kho na yang 'di ltar tshad med na mtshan gzhan du gsol ba shin tu tshad med par lta ji ste mi 'gyur snyam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang na re zhig mtshan mthun pa kho na yang 'di ltar tshad med na mtshan gzhan du gsol ba shin tu tshad med par lta ji ste mi 'gyur snyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in order to show the multitude of buddhas” means that if the multitude of buddhas with the same name are immeasurable, how much more immeasurable must be the multitude of buddhas with different names?

original: sangs rgyas mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa yang snang ste de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su skong bas sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa yang snang ste de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su skong bas sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The purpose of teaching many buddhas is also evident, because in dependence on them, bodhisattvas complete the immeasurable collection of enlightenment and approach buddhahood.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa de dag kyang grangs dang yon tan gyis tshad med pa yin pas gnyi ga ltar tshad med pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' gang dag phyag byed pa de dag bsod nams nye🔽bar stsogs pa tshad med pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa de dag kyang grangs dang yon tan gyis tshad med pa yin pas gnyi ga ltar tshad med pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' gang dag phyag byed pa de dag bsod nams nye bar stsogs pa tshad med pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the bhagavat buddhas who dwell in other world systems are immeasurable in number and qualities, the bodhisattvas who pay homage to them in both ways possess immeasurable merit.

original: de bzhin du gal te res 'ga' zhig bag med pa byed na de'i 'og tu de dag rjes su dran par byas shing de dag nyid mngon sum du gyur pa dang 'dra bar @8a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te res 'ga' zhig bag med pa byed na de'i 'og tu de dag rjes su dran par byas shing de dag nyid mngon sum du gyur pa dang 'dra bar @8a * //
translated: Similarly, if they sometimes act carelessly, they later recollect those buddhas and, as if they were present,

original: byas nas gus par phyir 'chags par byed cing phyis sdom pa byed na /
analyzed: byas nas gus par phyir 'chags par byed cing phyis sdom pa byed na /
translated: Having done so, he respectfully confesses and later takes up the vow.

original: des na shes rab dang thugs brtse ba nyid kyis tshad med pa la de ltar byas pas bsod nams tshad med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shes rab dang thugs brtse ba nyid kyis tshad med pa la de ltar byas pas bsod nams tshad med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through wisdom and compassion, he accumulates immeasurable merit by doing so.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa sku dang shes rab kyang tshad med thugs brtse ba nam mkha' dang mnyam pa de dag gi sku dang shes rab dang / thugs brtse ba sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams kyang nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis tshad med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa sku dang shes rab kyang tshad med thugs brtse ba nam mkha' dang mnyam pa de dag gi sku dang shes rab dang / thugs brtse ba sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams kyang nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis tshad med pa'i phyir /
translated: The immeasurable merit of the Blessed Buddhas is immeasurable in terms of body and wisdom, and their compassion is equal to space. Because their bodies, wisdom, and compassion extend to all sentient beings, and because the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable, being equal to space,

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang bar byed de /
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang bar byed de /
translated: he rejoices in all merit.

original: des na yang bsod nams tshad med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yang bsod nams tshad med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he accumulates immeasurable merit.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas gang dag dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de dag ji srid du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar ma bskul ba de srid du chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas gang dag dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de dag ji srid du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar ma bskul ba de srid du chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddhas who first attained complete enlightenment do not turn the wheel of the Dharma until they are requested to do so by the gods.
