original: des kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that, they accumulate immeasurable merit.

original: de'i phyir gang dag mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag sems can la phan par bya ba'i don du bzhugs par gsol ba 'debs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag sems can la phan par bya ba'i don du bzhugs par gsol ba 'debs te /
translated: Therefore, those who wish to attain nirvana are requested to remain for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'di las kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that, they accumulate immeasurable merit.

original: de ltar tshad med pa rnam pa lnga nye bar stsogs pa'i bsod nams sems can tshad med pa dag la yongs su sngo bar byed de des kyang tshad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshad med pa rnam pa lnga nye bar stsogs pa'i bsod nams sems can tshad med pa dag la yongs su sngo bar byed de des kyang tshad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the merit of the five kinds of immeasurable things is transferred to immeasurable sentient beings, and by that, it becomes immeasurable.

original: de yang de dag gis tshad med pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang de dag gis tshad med pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: And that is the attainment of immeasurable good qualities by them.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: They dedicate it to the attainment of buddhahood itself.

original: de las kyang bsod nams tshad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang bsod nams tshad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, merit becomes immeasurable.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi sangs rgyas rnams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa bdun gyis byang chub kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su skong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi sangs rgyas rnams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa bdun gyis byang chub kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su skong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the buddhas of other world systems, bodhisattvas perfect the immeasurable requisites for enlightenment in seven ways.

original: des kyang de dag sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des kyang de dag sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And by that, they approach buddhahood itself.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ba dgos par 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar 'gyur ba dgos par 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the purpose of the bodhisattva is to approach buddhahood itself.🔽And because they are similar to them in name, they experience a special joy.

original: de dag dang mtshan mthun pa'i phyir dga' ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag dang mtshan mthun pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang bzhugs pa lta zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang bas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de dag dang mtshan mthun pa'i phyir dga' ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag dang mtshan mthun pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang bzhugs pa lta zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang bas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ro
translated: This is the correct joy that arises from following worldly convention, thinking, “The Bhagavān buddhas who are similar in name to me also exist.”

original: // yang sangs rgyas @8b mang po nyid du bstan pa ni 'di ltar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: // yang sangs rgyas @8b mang po nyid du bstan pa ni 'di ltar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Also, the teaching of many buddhas should be understood in this way.

original: mtshan mthun pa kho na yang mang rab na mtshan tha dad pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pas nyan pa po rnams chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /🔽de yang la la dus gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa dgag pa'i phyir dang / de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtha' med par bzhugs na /
analyzed: mtshan mthun pa kho na yang mang rab na mtshan tha dad pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pas nyan pa po rnams chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir te / de yang la la dus gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa dgag pa'i phyir dang / de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtha' med par bzhugs na /
translated: Since it is taught that many buddhas with the same name exist, what need is there to mention those with different names? This is said in order to generate respect for the Dharma and the Dharma teacher in the listeners.

original: bdag kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes brtson 'grus mchog la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes brtson 'grus mchog la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this is said in order to prevent the thought that many buddhas do not appear at the same time and in order to generate enthusiasm for supreme diligence, thinking, if infinite transcendent buddhas exist in that way, why should I not become one?

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcur nges she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcur nges she na /
translated: Why are the buddha lands definitely ten million?

original: grangs de yod pa'i phyir dang / sa bcu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs de yod pa'i phyir dang / sa bcu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that number exists and because it is the stage of the ten grounds.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang mnyam pa'i pha rol na bzhugs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la tshun chad nas bzhugs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang mnyam pa'i pha rol na bzhugs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la tshun chad nas bzhugs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do the Buddhas who reside in world systems as numerous as the atoms of ten buddha-fields bless this system, and not the others?

original: de dag dang 'di spyod pa mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag dang 'di spyod pa mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the practices of the bodhisattvas there are the same as here.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: And this is understood from the fact that the bodhisattvas there are called Vajra-garbha.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsngags pa dang bskul ba dag la 'byung ste /
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsngags pa dang bskul ba dag la 'byung ste /
translated: Excellent, excellent! The word excellent is used in praise and in exhortation.

original: re zhig bsngags pa la ni ston pa legs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig bsngags pa la ni ston pa legs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In praise, for example, the Buddha said to Subhuti, Excellent, excellent!

original: bskul ba la ni rtses nas ring zhig lon gyis 'don pa gyis shig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bskul ba la ni rtses nas ring zhig lon gyis 'don pa gyis shig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In exhortation, for example, the Buddha said to Ananda, Come, Ananda, let us go to such and such a place.

original: 'dir ni bsngags pa kho na la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsngags pa kho na la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here it is praise that is meant.

original: yang legs so zhes smos pa ni khyad par du bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang legs so zhes smos pa ni khyad par du bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, excellent is said because of special praise.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rigs bzang po rnams kyi nang du bur gtogs pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rigs bzang po rnams kyi nang du bur gtogs pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu'o //
translated: Son of good family is a son of good family because he is included among the sons of good families in the Buddha's family.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'di nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam dang byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'di nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam dang byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the former aspirations and blessings of this Bhagavān Vairocana, means

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i 'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i 'o //
translated: the Bhagavān Śākyamuni is called Vairocana.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan 'di skad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan 'di skad ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called by that name?

original: smras pa / gdul bar bya ba rnams la dam pa'i chos sna tshogs snang ba mdzad pas rnam par snang bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gdul bar bya ba rnams la dam pa'i chos sna tshogs snang ba mdzad pas rnam par snang bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is said: He is called Vairocana because he illuminates various true dharmas for those to be tamed.

original: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad de dka' thub can bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad de dka' thub can bzhin no //
translated: He himself is Vairocana, like an ascetic.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sna tshogs su snang ba dang / dgyes par byed pas rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sna tshogs su snang ba dang / dgyes par byed pas rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: In one way, he is Vairocana because he illuminates various appearances and delights.

original: yon tan rnam pa mang po snang ba dang / mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon du dgyes par byed ces bya ba'i @9a * //🔽tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa mang po snang ba dang / mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon du dgyes par byed ces bya ba'i @9a * // tha tshig ste /
translated: and the appearance of many kinds of good qualities, and the delight of the wise.

original: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.🔽He is Vairocana.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In another way,

original: rnam par snang byed ni nyi ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang byed ni nyi ma ste /
translated: Vairocana is the sun,

original: skar ma dang zla ba la sogs pa zil gyis mnan nas khyad par du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skar ma dang zla ba la sogs pa zil gyis mnan nas khyad par du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears to surpass the moon, stars, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'di ni de'i yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'di ni de'i yin te /
translated: This is Vairocana,

original: de'i rgyud las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyud las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is born from his stream.

original: de skad du /🔽ngang pa phye rlab skyed byed 'od zer stong //
analyzed: de skad du / ngang pa phye rlab skyed byed 'od zer stong //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The sun produces the waves of the geese,

original: ri sha ka pi 'od phreng nyi ma gsal //
analyzed: ri sha ka pi 'od phreng nyi ma gsal //
translated: the light of the moon, the garland of stars,

original: nor can gso byed de bzhin sku dang ldan //🔽rnam snang bshes gnyen gzer tshad mun pa sel //
analyzed: nor can gso byed de bzhin sku dang ldan // rnam snang bshes gnyen gzer tshad mun pa sel //
translated: the light of the sun, the nourishment of wealth, and the body of the world.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Vairocana is the friend, the light of the sun, the dispeller of darkness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Blessed One said in the past,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas byin gyi rlabs kyi sngon rol du byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan 'di zhes bya ba sha stag gis byin gyis rlob par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob pa po de dag gis byin gyis brlab par smon lam btab cing don du🔽gnyer ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas byin gyi rlabs kyi sngon rol du byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan 'di zhes bya ba sha stag gis byin gyis rlob par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob pa po de dag gis byin gyis brlab par smon lam btab cing don du gnyer ba yin te /
translated: The Blessed One Śākyamuni, before the consecration, made the following aspiration: “May the bodhisattvas named so-and-so consecrate.” Those who were to consecrate aspired and sought the consecration.

original: smon lam ni byin gyi rlabs kyi yul can kho na yin no //
analyzed: smon lam ni byin gyi rlabs kyi yul can kho na yin no //
translated: The aspiration is the object of the consecration.

original: sh'akya thub pas de ltar smon lam btab nas rang gis kyang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de nas gzhan dag gis kyang byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pas de ltar smon lam btab nas rang gis kyang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de nas gzhan dag gis kyang byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Śākyamuni made that aspiration, and then he himself consecrated, and then others consecrated.

original: de ltar na sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de ltar na sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Thus Śākyamuni and others consecrated.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi smon lam dang / sngon gyi smon lam can gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi smon lam dang / sngon gyi smon lam can gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “by the consecration of the former aspiration and the former aspirational one.”

original: sngon gyi sgra gcig lus par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sgra gcig lus par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “former” is left out.

original: ci'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i byin gyis brlabs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i byin gyis brlabs she na /
translated: Why is this Dharma teaching blessed?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni dang por spyad pa yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par 'grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni dang por spyad pa yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par 'grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the first practice and the accomplishment of the Buddha qualities.

original: ci'i phyir na byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir bya ba gang dag gi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir bya ba gang dag gi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Why is it blessed? Why is it blessed for the sake of what?

original: bshad par zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad par zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it is blessed for the sake of explanation.

original: byin gyis rlob pa'i dgos pa ni shes te khong du chud na bshad pa de nyid gang gi don du snyam nas ci'i phyir na byin gyis brlabs zhes bshad pa'i dgongs pa 'dri'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa'i dgos pa ni shes te khong du chud na bshad pa de nyid gang gi don du snyam nas ci'i phyir na byin gyis brlabs zhes bshad pa'i dgongs pa 'dri'o //
translated: The purpose of the blessing is understood. But if one wonders for whose sake that explanation is, one asks why it is blessed, and the intention of the explanation is asked.

original: ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa ni rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa ni rnam pa gang gis so //
translated: How is it blessed? By what aspect?

original: dgos pa smras pa /
analyzed: dgos pa smras pa /
translated: The purpose is stated:

original: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For one's own benefit and the benefit of others.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gsung dang thugs dang skus zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gsung dang thugs dang skus zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it asked, by speech, mind, and body, as will be explained.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni gang dag sar ma chud pa ste so so'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni gang dag sar ma chud pa ste so so'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: Those who are on the stage of action in faith are those who have not yet entered the stages, i.e., ordinary persons.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni sar chud pa rnams bsdu ste dang @9b po pa rnams kyis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan pa la sogs pas rim gyis rang gi don 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni sar chud pa rnams bsdu ste dang @9b po pa rnams kyis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan pa la sogs pas rim gyis rang gi don 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes those who have entered the stages. It should be understood that they accomplish their own aim gradually by listening to this Dharma teaching, etc.

original: gzhan dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i don dang yi ge rnams yang dag par rtogs nas 'di rab tu bsnyad pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don 'grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i don dang yi ge rnams yang dag par rtogs nas 'di rab tu bsnyad pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don 'grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Others should understand that they accomplish the aim of others by teaching this Dharma teaching, etc., after they have realized its meaning and its words.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang rdo rje'i snying po'i byin gyi rlabs dang gdod 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang rdo rje'i snying po'i byin gyi rlabs dang gdod 'grub bo //
translated: Both of these are accomplished by the blessing of the vajra essence.

original: gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa'i gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa'i gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to //
translated: The reason for the blessing of others has already been explained.

original: 'di ni chos nyid 'di ltar mtshan de ma yin pa de dang 'dra ba rnams kyis kyang mi ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid 'di ltar mtshan de ma yin pa de dang 'dra ba rnams kyis kyang mi ston to //
translated: This is the nature of things, and it is not taught by those who are not like that.

original: kha cig na re thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra kho nas thams cad bsdus na de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'grel pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: kha cig na re thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra kho nas thams cad bsdus na de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'grel pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Some say: If the word all includes everything, what is the point of the commentary, all bodhisattvas abide on the level of practice motivated by aspiration and so on?

original: de lta bas na stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi 'don pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi 'don pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the word et cetera is not pronounced.

original: ma bton dang thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ma lus pa bsdu bar go bar 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba yin pas 'grel pa don ldan no //
analyzed: ma bton dang thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ma lus pa bsdu bar go bar 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba yin pas 'grel pa don ldan no //
translated: The commentary is meaningful because it is understood that the word all includes everything without exception.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa thob pa rnams kyis ni 'khor de na 'khod pa'am /🔽gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa thob pa rnams kyis ni 'khor de na 'khod pa'am / gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have attained the levels accomplish the benefit of others through teaching this Dharma to those who are present in the retinue or to others.

original: 'di bstan pa'i rgyus ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i gzhan gyi don 'grub pa med de /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i rgyus ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i gzhan gyi don 'grub pa med de /
translated: But this is not so, because even without teaching this Dharma, they accomplish the benefit of others as explained.

original: 'di bstan pa med par yang de srid pa'i phyir la bcu tshan gnyis pa la yang mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di bstan pa med par yang de srid pa'i phyir la bcu tshan gnyis pa la yang mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The second group of ten is stated to describe the level of practice motivated by aspiration.

original: gzhan dag na re ni stsogs pa'i sgra la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni stsogs pa'i sgra la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Others say: There is no fault in the term “etc.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: thams cad kyi bye brag du ma phye ba kho nar bcu tshan gnyis dang sbyar ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bye brag du ma phye ba kho nar bcu tshan gnyis dang sbyar ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is applied to the two sets of ten without distinguishing their differences.

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa gang gi rang gi don 'grub pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyid du bstan la /🔽sa dang po la gnas pa'i ni 'og ma ste sa bcu pa la gnas pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas /🔽de ltar na rang gi don gyi skabs kyis bcu tshan dang po thams cad kyi yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa gang gi rang gi don 'grub pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyid du bstan la / sa dang po la gnas pa'i ni 'og ma ste sa bcu pa la gnas pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas / de ltar na rang gi don gyi skabs kyis bcu tshan dang po thams cad kyi yin pa nyid do //
translated: The stage of accomplishing one’s own goal is taught for those abiding in the stage of resolute conduct.

original: de dag gis rang gi don de lta bu khong du chud nas gzhan dag la yang don de lta bu kho na sgrub par byed pas na gzhan gyi don gyi skabs kyis ni bcu tshan gnyis pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid do //

original: 'grel pa ni thams cad la bya ba nyid kyi /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni thams cad la bya ba nyid kyi /
translated: The commentary explains that this is the case for all.🔽

original: 'khor de na 'khod pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor de na 'khod pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The commentary explains that this is not just for those who are in the retinue.

original: zhes bstan pa'i @10a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i @10a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: phyir ro // de la kha cig stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don pa dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar tshogs gnyis su rnam par phye nas rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don bcu tshan gnyis su rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: phyir ro // de la kha cig stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don pa dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar tshogs gnyis su rnam par phye nas rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don bcu tshan gnyis su rnam par 'chad do //
translated: some, having observed the word “etc.,” divide the two collections in that way and explain the two sets of ten as the benefit for oneself and the benefit for others.

original: de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar bcu tshan dang po la yang sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug pa'i bar sa bcu smos la de dag kyang mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs pa rnams la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar bcu tshan dang po la yang sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug pa'i bar sa bcu smos la de dag kyang mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs pa rnams la mi rung ngo //
translated: That is not tenable, because in the first set of ten, the ten levels are mentioned up to the level of buddhahood, and those are not suitable for the stage of the practice of devoted interest.

original: ji ste re zhig par gsungs pa ma yin te 'on kyang de bstan pa'i rgyus 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag de la skye bar 'gyur ba yin na zhes zer na gal te de lta de dag ni bcu tshan gnyis pa la yang rung ba nyid do
analyzed: ji ste re zhig par gsungs pa ma yin te 'on kyang de bstan pa'i rgyus 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag de la skye bar 'gyur ba yin na zhes zer na gal te de lta de dag ni bcu tshan gnyis pa la yang rung ba nyid do
translated: If you say that the Buddha did not say that, but that those who are born there are born there because of the cause of teaching that, then those who are born there are also born there because of the cause of teaching the second group of ten.

original: // de lta bas na bye brag tu ma phye bar sbyar ba nyid bzang ste /
analyzed: // de lta bas na bye brag tu ma phye bar sbyar ba nyid bzang ste /
translated: Therefore, it is best to apply the term without distinction.

original: de dag gis bdag nyid kyis rtogs nas gzhan dag la khong du chud par byed pas de ni de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bdag nyid kyis rtogs nas gzhan dag la khong du chud par byed pas de ni de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since they understand it themselves and cause others to understand it, it should be understood in that way.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par bcad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par bcad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, because there would be no distinction,

original: slob dpon gyi 'grel pa chen po mi dgos par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi 'grel pa chen po mi dgos par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: the great commentary by the master would be unnecessary.

original: da ni bcu tshan dang po'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i skabs dbye ste de la brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams ni zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: da ni bcu tshan dang po'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i skabs dbye ste de la brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams ni zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: The inconceivable qualities of a Buddha are the nature of the uncontaminated factors of enlightenment, because they are not to be analyzed and because they are not the domain of sravakas and so on.

original: snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis mngon sum du byed pa ste 'di skad du zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag nyid kyi rang rig pas nyams su myong ba ni snang ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis mngon sum du byed pa ste 'di skad du zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag nyid kyi rang rig pas nyams su myong ba ni snang ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Illumination is the direct realization of the supramundane path. This is explained as follows: The illumination of those very uncontaminated factors of enlightenment is the experience by means of self-awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag rtogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they are realized.

original: 'thob pa dang mngon sum du byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang mngon sum du byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that they are attained and directly realized.

original: de brjod pa ni zhes bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de brjod pa ni zhes bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bstan pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: bstan pa yin par ston to //
translated: It is taught.

original: ji lta zhe na snang ba de 'dis rjod par byed /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na snang ba de 'dis rjod par byed /
translated: How? It is the expression of that appearance.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it illuminates it.

original: de yang bstan pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnams so //
analyzed: de yang bstan pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnams so //
translated: And that is by the nature of teaching.

original: de dag gis snang ba zhes bya ba gzhir gyur pa'i ye shes yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis snang ba zhes bya ba gzhir gyur pa'i ye shes yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: By those, the appearance of the pure pristine consciousness that is the basis is attained.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes ston par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag la 'jug pa ni dad pa dang mos pa dang rab tu dad pa thob pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la dad pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas de dag thos nas 'di dag ni 'di lta bu yin no @10b zhes yid
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes ston par 'gyur ro // de dag la 'jug pa ni dad pa dang mos pa dang rab tu dad pa thob pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la dad pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas de dag thos nas 'di dag ni 'di lta bu yin no @10b zhes yid
translated: It will be taught by the example of refined gold.🔽Engaging those is the attainment of faith, devotion, and complete faith.

original: ches pa dang bdag gis 'di dag nam zhig na thob par 'gyur snyam du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ches pa dang bdag gis 'di dag nam zhig na thob par 'gyur snyam du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Faith is the characteristic of desire, thinking, “These are like this,” having heard them, and thinking, “When will I attain these?”

original: mos pa ni de dag la gtan la phab ste nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni de dag la gtan la phab ste nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Devotion is the characteristic of ascertaining and apprehending them.

original: rab tu dang ba ni de gnyis sngon du 'gro ba can gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dang ba ni de gnyis sngon du 'gro ba can gang yin pa ste /
translated: Faith is that which precedes both of them.

original: de thob pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of both of them.

original: 'jug pa zhes spyir bshad pa kho na yin pas 'dir ni 'jug pa'i thabs dang 'jug pa dang mthar thug pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes spyir bshad pa kho na yin pas 'dir ni 'jug pa'i thabs dang 'jug pa dang mthar thug pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since the term “engagement” is explained in a general way, here, all of these—the means of engagement, engagement itself, and the culmination of engagement—are explained as “engagement.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mos pas spyod pa dang mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa'i phyir de dag yod na de rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa dang mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa'i phyir de dag yod na de rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist when those exist, since they are the causes of the path of meditative development and the path of seeing.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: In this way, they are subsumed by that which arises from hearing and so on.

original: sa de dag la dad pa dang mos pa dang / rab tu dang ba med na re zhig de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba la sogs pas de dag gi don dang / tshig gi sgo nas nyan par yang mi 'jug na bsam pa dang bsgom pa lta ga la 'jug /'di nyid thams cad kyi rten te /
analyzed: sa de dag la dad pa dang mos pa dang / rab tu dang ba med na re zhig de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba la sogs pas de dag gi don dang / tshig gi sgo nas nyan par yang mi 'jug na bsam pa dang bsgom pa lta ga la 'jug /'di nyid thams cad kyi rten te /
translated: If one lacks faith, devotion, and clear faith in those stages, then one does not even listen to the meaning and the words of those stages by way of seeking a spiritual teacher who teaches them, etc. How then could one contemplate them?

original: rtsa bar gyur pa yin pas na rtsa ba'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa bar gyur pa yin pas na rtsa ba'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since this is the basis and root of all of them, it is the root engagement.

original: de la gzhan de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhan de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the others?

original: bsdus pa'i 'jug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa la thug pa rnams so //🔽'di dag kyang mdo las /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i 'jug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa la thug pa rnams so // 'di dag kyang mdo las /
translated: The engagement of the collections, etc., up to the engagement of the culmination of buddhahood.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig dgus ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par dbye ba'i phyir thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig dgus ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par dbye ba'i phyir thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: These are also explained in the sutra with nine statements beginning with “in order to gather all the roots of virtue,” etc. In order to analyze them, it says “listening,” etc.

original: bcu tshan gyi tshig dang po ni sngar rnam par phye zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bcu tshan gyi tshig dang po ni sngar rnam par phye zin pa nyid do //
translated: The first term of the tenfold set has already been explained.

original: de la thos par bya ba yin pas na thos pa ste chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de la thos par bya ba yin pas na thos pa ste chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid do //
translated: It is hearing because it is to be heard, i.e., this very Dharma discourse.

original: de 'dzin pas grangs nas der gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus par 'gyur bas sdud pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /🔽'dis sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas grangs nas der gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus par 'gyur bas sdud pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste / 'dis sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the collection because the wisdom born of hearing collects all the roots of virtue included in it, since they are held by it.

original: de nyid 'jug pa yin te rim gyis sa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa yin te rim gyis sa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro // de yang mdo las /
translated: It is the entry because it is the means of gradually entering the stages.🔽And that is taught by the sutra itself with the words:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig kho nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig kho nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to collect all the roots of virtue.

original: 'di ltar des de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen las sa rnams kyi ming tsam thos nas dad pa dang mos pa dang rab tu dang ba skyes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar des de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen las sa rnams kyi ming tsam thos nas dad pa dang mos pa dang rab tu dang ba skyes te /
translated: Thus, having heard from a spiritual teacher the mere names of the stages, faith, aspiration, and clarity arise.

original: rtsa ba'i @11a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i @11a * //
translated: The root

original: 'jug pa la gnas pa ni de dag tshig re re nas nyan bar byed pas de'i phyir thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni bsdus pa'i 'jug pa zhes bshad do //🔽des de ltar de dag thos nas de dag gis brjod par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par rigs pas rnam par 'byed par byed la /
analyzed: 'jug pa la gnas pa ni de dag tshig re re nas nyan bar byed pas de'i phyir thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni bsdus pa'i 'jug pa zhes bshad do // des de ltar de dag thos nas de dag gis brjod par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par rigs pas rnam par 'byed par byed la /
translated: One who is engaged in the application of listening is one who listens to each of those words. Therefore, the knowledge that arises from listening is called the engaged application of listening.🔽Having listened to them in that way, in order to express them, one discriminates the factors of enlightenment and so on with unmistaken reasoning.🔽

original: rnam par 'byed pa ni de dag la mkhas par skye bas bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni don rtogs par byed pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ste 'dis don mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yang mdo las /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba la /🔽mkhas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin te /

original: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni sa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni sa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge that arises from reflection is the nature of skill in the discrimination of the topics of the factors of enlightenment, which are the subject matter of the stages.

original: de de ltar don de dag rnam par 'byed par byed pa na don de dag rnam grangs brjod pa du mas gzhan dag la ston par byed pa'i rnam grangs de dag rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos kyi sgrar bstan pa rnams rtogs par byed rab
analyzed: de de ltar don de dag rnam par 'byed par byed pa na don de dag rnam grangs brjod pa du mas gzhan dag la ston par byed pa'i rnam grangs de dag rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos kyi sgrar bstan pa rnams rtogs par byed rab
translated: When one thus discriminates those topics, one teaches them to others by means of many enumerations of those topics. One causes them to understand and to know the words of the Dharma, which are taught with the meaning of grasping their own characteristics.

original: tu shes par byed pas bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni chos rtogs par byed pa'i 'jug pa yin te 'dis chos kyi rnam grangs dag rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tu shes par byed pas bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni chos rtogs par byed pa'i 'jug pa yin te 'dis chos kyi rnam grangs dag rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That knowledge that arises from reflection, which is thus extremely superior, is the engagement that causes the understanding of the Dharma, because it causes the understanding of the enumerations of the Dharma.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: And that is taught in the sutra:

original: chos la ye shes shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la ye shes shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to expand one's wisdom regarding the Dharma.

original: chos la ye shes ni chos rnams shes pa ste de rgyas par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos la ye shes ni chos rnams shes pa ste de rgyas par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The wisdom of the Dharma is the knowledge of the Dharma. How does it expand?

original: rnam grangs rgya che zhing du ma yod pa'i chos kyi yul can de nyid de rgya bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽des de ltar bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i don rnam pa du ma dang / de rjod par byed pa'i rnam grangs rnams khong du chud nas sems can rnams la de gnyi ga phun sum tshogs par ston pas yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs rgya che zhing du ma yod pa'i chos kyi yul can de nyid de rgya bskyed pa'i phyir ro // des de ltar bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i don rnam pa du ma dang / de rjod par byed pa'i rnam grangs rnams khong du chud nas sems can rnams la de gnyi ga phun sum tshogs par ston pas yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni /
translated: It expands the object of the Dharma, which has many extensive categories.🔽Thus, having understood the many aspects of the meaning of this Dharma discourse and the categories that express it through the knowledge that arises from reflection, he ripens beings by teaching them both perfectly.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //🔽de yang mdo las /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o // de yang mdo las /
translated: That knowledge that arises from reflection is the supreme engagement in ripening beings.🔽And that is taught in the sutra:

original: legs par gnas pa'i chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: legs par gnas pa'i chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the Dharma well.

original: 'dis shin tu legs par gnas pa'i chos tshig 'bru dang don phun sum tshogs pas ston par byed pa'i @11b phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis shin tu legs par gnas pa'i chos tshig 'bru dang don phun sum tshogs pas ston par byed pa'i @11b phyir ro //
translated: This is because it teaches the Dharma that is well-established with perfect words and meanings.

original: des de ltar sngar dad pa dang mos pa dang / rab tu dang ba skyes nas /
analyzed: des de ltar sngar dad pa dang mos pa dang / rab tu dang ba skyes nas /
translated: Having previously generated faith, devotion, and clear faith,

original: de'i 'og tu thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba gnyis kyis don rtogs pa dang / rnam grangs du ma rig pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba gnyis kyis don rtogs pa dang / rnam grangs du ma rig pa /
translated: then, through the two that arise from hearing and reflection, one realizes the meaning and knows the many categories.

original: don bzang po dang / tshig bzang pos sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa na mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pas na mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa ni 'thob par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don bzang po dang / tshig bzang pos sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa na mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pas na mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa ni 'thob par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: When one ripens beings with good meaning and good words, one enters the path of seeing. Thus, the realization of the path of seeing is the entry to attainment.

original: bshad pa las chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa las chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that the explanation speaks of the purification of the knowledge of the equality of all phenomena?

original: 'di'i lugs ltar na bdag med pa'i rnam pa kho nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang spong bas bdag med pa nyid chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin te ro gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i lugs ltar na bdag med pa'i rnam pa kho nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang spong bas bdag med pa nyid chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin te ro gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: According to this system, since one sees only the aspect of selflessness, one abandons the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing. Therefore, selflessness itself is the equality of all phenomena, because they are not different due to being of one taste.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: ye shes tha mi dad pa rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes tha mi dad pa rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: “In order to purify the non-differentiation of wisdom.”

original: ye shes tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par byang ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par byang ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purification of that non-differentiation of wisdom is complete purity,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the stains to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ye shes tha mi dad pa yang yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes tha mi dad pa yang yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: The non-differentiation of wisdom is in terms of the non-differentiation of objects,

original: ye shes mang po rnams tha mi dad cing gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes mang po rnams tha mi dad cing gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that many wisdoms become undifferentiated and one.

original: yul tha dad pa ma yin pa ni stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa ma yin pa ni stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: The non-differentiation of objects is emptiness.

original: der chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena have the same characteristic in that.

original: de nyid bshad pa las mnyam pa nyid du shes pa yongs su sbyong bas zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis mnyam pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa las mnyam pa nyid du shes pa yongs su sbyong bas zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis mnyam pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The same point is taught by another term in the commentary: “purification of the knowledge of sameness.”

original: rang gi don gyi bcu tshan rnam par dbye bar sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba skabs ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs ni bshad pa nyid las bstan pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi bcu tshan rnam par dbye bar sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba skabs ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs ni bshad pa nyid las bstan pas ma bshad do //
translated: The chapter on the ten topics of one’s own aim is called “bringing beings to maturity.” The reason for its being out of sequence is explained in the commentary, so I will not explain it here.

original: sngar bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i sngon rol du zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i sngon rol du zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: “Taught above” should be understood as “before realization.”

original: des de ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs nas /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs nas /
translated: Having thus abandoned the discards that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: bsgom pa'i lam la rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i chos thams cad kyis mi mthos mi dmas pa nyid du dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed pa na bag yod bar gnas pas de'i 'og tu bag yod pa'i 'jug
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i chos thams cad kyis mi mthos mi dmas pa nyid du dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed pa na bag yod bar gnas pas de'i 'og tu bag yod pa'i 'jug
translated: On the path of cultivation, when one cultivates wholesome states that are not surpassed or overwhelmed by any defiled states, which are characterized by gain and loss, one abides in heedfulness.

original: pa ste / de yang mdo las /
analyzed: pa ste / de yang mdo las /
translated: The sutra states:

original: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽bsgom pas spong bar @12a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no // bsgom pas spong bar @12a * //
translated: In order to not be defiled by any worldly dharmas.🔽The afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation🔽are attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dag yod pa dang / rnyed pa la ni chags shing des kyang mthos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dag yod pa dang / rnyed pa la ni chags shing des kyang mthos par 'gyur la /
translated: When one gains, one is attached and conceited by that.

original: ma rnyed na ni gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rnyed na ni gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not gain, one is harmed.

original: ma rig pa ni sngon du 'gro ba yin pas 'jig rten gyi chos dag gis gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sngon du 'gro ba yin pas 'jig rten gyi chos dag gis gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since ignorance precedes them, one is defiled by worldly dharmas.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir mi gos te rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir mi gos te rtogs par sla'o //
translated: In order to abandon them, one is not defiled, and it is easy to realize.

original: de dag rnam pa thams cad du spangs par ni khong du chud par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam pa thams cad du spangs par ni khong du chud par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not understand that they are completely abandoned,

original: rnam par mnan pas rang gi mthu'i dpung byed mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mnan pas rang gi mthu'i dpung byed mi nus pa yin no //
translated: because they are not able to act as the power of the root of the wholesome of the bodhisattva who is in the process of eliminating them.

original: rim gyis yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir sa dang po kho nar rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par spong bar ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rim gyis yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir sa dang po kho nar rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par spong bar ni mi 'dod de /
translated: One does not accept that they are completely and totally eliminated on the first stage alone, because of the gradual purification.

original: sa bcu pa la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: They are completely purified on the tenth stage.

original: de bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun gang yin pa de dag nyid la ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin te /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun gang yin pa de dag nyid la ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin te /
translated: The thirty-seven aids to enlightenment are the roots of the wholesome of the bodhisattva who has entered the path of meditation and who is supramundane and uncontaminated.

original: de dag yongs su sbyangs pa'i 'og tu sa nas sar 'phar bar 'gyur bas sar 'phar ba'i 'jug pa brjod do //
analyzed: de dag yongs su sbyangs pa'i 'og tu sa nas sar 'phar bar 'gyur bas sar 'phar ba'i 'jug pa brjod do //
translated: The engagement of the leap is described because after their purification, one leaps from stage to stage.

original: 'di ltar de dag nyid gnas skabs snga ma dag pas gnas skabs phyi ma thob ste khyad par can du gyur nas gong ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nyid gnas skabs snga ma dag pas gnas skabs phyi ma thob ste khyad par can du gyur nas gong ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, they are called higher because they are distinguished by attaining a later state that is superior to a former state.

original: yang de dag nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang de dag nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Or, they are roots of virtue because they are the roots of virtue that are the factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This is another explanation.

original: sngar ni bye brag tu ma phye bar byang chub kyi phyogs pa nyid ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no zhes gzhi mthun par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni bye brag tu ma phye bar byang chub kyi phyogs pa nyid ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no zhes gzhi mthun par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Previously, without making a distinction, it was said in a general way that the roots of virtue that are the factors that contribute to enlightenment are the roots of virtue that are nonattachment and so on.

original: da ni de dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa zhes bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: da ni de dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa zhes bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: Now, it is explained that they are the roots of virtue that are the causes of those.

original: 'di skad du ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar skyes pa rnams yongs su sbyangs na byang chub kyi phyogs pa phyi ma mchog tu gyur pa 'dren pas sa snga ma las phyi mar 'phar bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar skyes pa rnams yongs su sbyangs na byang chub kyi phyogs pa phyi ma mchog tu gyur pa 'dren pas sa snga ma las phyi mar 'phar bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: If the roots of virtue such as nonattachment that have previously arisen are purified, then the later aspects of enlightenment are induced and one ascends from the earlier to the later stages.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: And this is taught in the sutra:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to purify the supramundane roots of virtue.

original: spyir bstan pas 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin no //
analyzed: spyir bstan pas 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin no //
translated: Since this is a general teaching, the roots of virtue are supramundane.

original: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste rgyur gyur pa yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad par smos so //
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste rgyur gyur pa yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad par smos so //
translated: Since they are the cause of those roots of virtue, the phrase is to be analyzed as separate words.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs mchog thob @12b pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la sogs pa shes par byed nus sam byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i 'jug pa brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs mchog thob @12b pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la sogs pa shes par byed nus sam byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i 'jug pa brjod do //
translated: The Bodhisattva said, I will explain the entry that brings about the perfection of the Bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la sogs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la gsang ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la sogs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la gsang ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: As for knowing the secrets of all the Tathagatas, etc., the secrets refer to the secrets of body, speech, and mind.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni sa bcu pa las phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / bskal ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / 'jug pa'i ye shes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa de bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni sa bcu pa las phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / bskal ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / 'jug pa'i ye shes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa de bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase and so on includes the knowledge of subtlety on the tenth ground, the knowledge of entering the eon, and the knowledge of entry as extensively explained.

original: 'dis der de dag rnam pa thams cad du rab tu shes pas na byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis der de dag rnam pa thams cad du rab tu shes pas na byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this [knowledge] completely knows those [secrets] in all aspects, it is called the entry that brings about the perfection of the Bodhisattva.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: And that [entry] is as stated in the sutra:

original: ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “in order to comprehend the domain of inconceivable wisdom” is taught.

original: ji lta zhe na gsang ba la sogs pa de dag nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' phal ba dag gis bsam par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na gsang ba la sogs pa de dag nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' phal ba dag gis bsam par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: How so? Those secrets and so on cannot be contemplated by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary bodhisattvas, and thus they are inconceivable.

original: de'i yul can yin pas ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can yin pas ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Since they are the domain of that, they are the inconceivable wisdom.

original: de'i yul zhes bya ba de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yul zhes bya ba de nyid la bya'o //
translated: The domain of that should be understood in the same way.

original: de khong du chud pa ni mngon du bya ba ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khong du chud pa ni mngon du bya ba ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: Comprehending that is actualizing it, and it is for that purpose.

original: khong du chud par bya ba khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes pas chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med par shes pas na sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug🔽pa brjod de /
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes pas chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med par shes pas na sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'jug pa brjod de /
translated: The bodhisattva who comprehends that which is to be comprehended knows all objects of knowledge without obstruction, with a knowledge that has abandoned obstructions, and thus with a knowledge that is unattached and unimpeded.🔽This is described as the engagement that brings about the culmination of buddhahood.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: And that is stated in the sūtras:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no//
translated: up to the domain of omniscient pristine wisdom.🔽The domain of omniscient pristine wisdom is the dharmadhātu, and that is indicated by the term “all objects of knowledge” in the explanation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni chos kyi dbyings te de yang bshad pa las shes bya thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni chos kyi dbyings te de yang bshad pa las shes bya thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
translated: Because of the statement:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the dharmadhātu,

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: there are no phenomena at all.

original: zhes bya ba de'i sgo nas chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i sgo nas chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: all phenomena are fully known.

original: 'jug pa 'di rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ming gzhan brjod pa bye brag khyad par shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'di rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ming gzhan brjod pa bye brag khyad par shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The terms “engagement,” etc., are synonyms that serve to distinguish it.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: don la khyad par med na ming tha dad par yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: don la khyad par med na ming tha dad par yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: then there would be no difference in the terms even if there were no difference in the object.

original: dang po ni ming gzhan la smos pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi yang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis na @13a * //
analyzed: dang po ni ming gzhan la smos pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi yang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis na @13a * //
translated: The first is mentioned by another name because it is the cause of the others.

original: spyir ming rtsa ba'i 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyir ming rtsa ba'i 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
translated: In general, it is called the basic engagement of names.

original: dngos po nye bar 'god pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gang du 'am mdo gzhan las phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam nye bar 'god pa gang yin pa de ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po nye bar 'god pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gang du 'am mdo gzhan las phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam nye bar 'god pa gang yin pa de ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The exception is the presentation of the thing itself, which means that the mere thing itself, such as the aggregates, is presented in some sūtras or in other sūtras.

original: yang na sa bcu pa 'di nyid las smon lam chen po dag gi nang na smon lam bzhi ba bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang na sa bcu pa 'di nyid las smon lam chen po dag gi nang na smon lam bzhi ba bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Or, in this very Stage of a Bodhisattva, such as in the four great prayers among the great prayers,

original: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i rigs pa'i thabs kyi dngos po nye bar bkod cing smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i rigs pa'i thabs kyi dngos po nye bar bkod cing smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the thing itself, the method of explanation of the characteristics of the branches, the proximate branches, and so on, is presented and mentioned.

original: 'du ba ni sdud pa ste gos blta ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: 'du ba ni sdud pa ste gos blta ba lta bu'am /
translated: The gathering is the collection, like the collection of cotton, or

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ltar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ltar bsdus pa'o //
translated: like the collection of the destruction of the world system.

original: 'jig pa'i sgo nas 'byung mod kyi bsdus pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sgo nas 'byung mod kyi bsdus pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: Although it arises through destruction, it does not go beyond the collection.

original: ji ltar na gsum bar 'don pa rnams kyi de nyid kyi phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gsum bar 'don pa rnams kyi de nyid kyi phyir yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the three are recited by some? It is for that very reason.

original: rgyu nyid du brjod pa'i phyir yin te gsum pa yang rgyu ni de nyid kyi phyir las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du brjod pa'i phyir yin te gsum pa yang rgyu ni de nyid kyi phyir las mi 'da'o //
translated: Because it is called the cause. The third is not beyond the action for that very reason.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsum pa yang de nyid kyi phyir yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsum pa yang de nyid kyi phyir yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, the third is for that very reason.

original: de la rtsom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la des sa 'di dag gi ming thos nas bdag gis 'di dag nam zhig thob par 'gyur zhes dad pa dang 'dun par byed do //
analyzed: de la rtsom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la des sa 'di dag gi ming thos nas bdag gis 'di dag nam zhig thob par 'gyur zhes dad pa dang 'dun par byed do //
translated: In that regard, having heard the names of these stages, he becomes faithful and intent, thinking, “When will I attain these?”

original: de gnyis kyis bskul ba na de dag skul bar byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi thad du nye bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bskul ba na de dag skul bar byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi thad du nye bar 'gro'o //
translated: Urged by those two, he approaches spiritual friends who urge him.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bshad pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bshad pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes those who serve him and those who seek the meaning of the teachings.

original: 'di nyid tshol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid tshol ba yin te /
translated: This is the very search.

original: ji srid ma thos kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid ma thos kyi bar du'o //
translated: It lasts as long as he has not heard the teachings.

original: 'thob pa ni 'di dag thos nas don dang tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni 'di dag thos nas don dang tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the retention of the teachings in terms of their meaning and their verbal expression.

original: 'dir ni rnam grangs dang po nyid ces bya ba ni rtsom zhing 'thob pa dag gi mjug thogs su gtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir bshad pa gnyis pa mi 'thad do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam grangs dang po nyid ces bya ba ni rtsom zhing 'thob pa dag gi mjug thogs su gtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir bshad pa gnyis pa mi 'thad do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Here, the first alternative is explained, because it is included immediately after the undertaking and the obtainment. The second explanation is not tenable.

original: 'di ni rang gis rtogs nas sems can rnams la de bzhin byed pas sems can rnams kyis rtsom zhing thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gis rtogs nas sems can rnams la de bzhin byed pas sems can rnams kyis rtsom zhing thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This is understood by oneself and then one acts for the sake of sentient beings. Therefore, it should be understood that the undertaking and the obtainment are for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de ltar bcu tshan 'di gzhan gyi don kyi dbang du byas par rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bcu tshan 'di gzhan gyi don kyi dbang du byas par rung ngo //
translated: Thus, this set of ten is suitable from the perspective of the benefit for others.

original: tshig dang po ni rtsom zhing 'thob pa'i rtsa bas bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig dang po ni rtsom zhing 'thob pa'i rtsa bas bshad zin to //
translated: The first term, “undertaking and obtainment,” has already been explained by the root text.

original: rtsom zhing 'thob pa gzhan bcu tshig gzhan bcus ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: rtsom zhing 'thob pa gzhan bcu tshig gzhan bcus ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The other ten terms, “undertaking and obtainment,” should be analyzed in the same way as the ten terms that have been explained.

original: ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to “as one has heard,” and so on,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci @13b ma log par thos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thos pa ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci @13b ma log par thos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thos pa ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The hearing is this very Dharma discourse, because it is to be heard in accordance with reality, without error.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po bstan pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po bstan pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: And that is these very natures of the Dharma that are taught in the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: de'i don ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid de dag kho na yin no //
translated: And the meaning of that is those very ones that have the nature of wisdom.

original: de legs par 'dzin pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de legs par 'dzin pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The correct grasping of that is the correct apprehension.

original: de nyid khyad par du bkod pa yin pas rnam par bkod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du bkod pa yin pas rnam par bkod pa ste /
translated: That very thing is the array, because it is the special arrangement,

original: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa mchog gis gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa mchog gis gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: which is the ascertainment by the supreme cognition that arises from reflection.

original: de ltar bdag nyid kyis bzung nas 'dzin du 'jug pas shes par bya ba ni gdul ba rnams la ston pas zhes bya ba yin pas yang dag par 'dzin pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid kyis bzung nas 'dzin du 'jug pas shes par bya ba ni gdul ba rnams la ston pas zhes bya ba yin pas yang dag par 'dzin pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa'o //
translated: Having thus grasped it oneself, one causes others to grasp it, and so one teaches to the disciples who are to be trained. Thus one begins and attains the correct apprehension.

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: And this is stated in the sutra:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the phrase “in order to become skilled in the arrangement of the bodhisattva stages just as they are.”

original: ji skad du bstan pa de bzhin du bshad pa'i tshig gi don rnam par dbye ba nyid kyis bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa de bzhin du bshad pa'i tshig gi don rnam par dbye ba nyid kyis bshad do //
translated: The meaning of the words of the explanation is analyzed just as it is taught.

original: des de ltar sa 'di dag bzung ste /
analyzed: des de ltar sa 'di dag bzung ste /
translated: Having thus taken up these stages,

original: don dang tshig gi sgo nas rab tu bstan nas ye shes kyi bdag nyid 'di dag kho na mngon sum du bya bas thob par 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: don dang tshig gi sgo nas rab tu bstan nas ye shes kyi bdag nyid 'di dag kho na mngon sum du bya bas thob par 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ste /
translated: having taught them in terms of their meaning and words, he generates the aspiration and desire to attain them by making them directly evident to himself through the very knowledge that is his nature.

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la lhag par dmigs par bya ba'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la lhag par dmigs par bya ba'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “In order to take up all the qualities of a buddha.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de zag pa med pa'i sa thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de zag pa med pa'i sa thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The taking up of all the qualities of a buddha, of all the uncontaminated stages, is the aspiration, the desire.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the taking up of the higher intention.

original: bshad pa'i don ni de de ltar 'dun pa drag po skyes nas /
analyzed: bshad pa'i don ni de de ltar 'dun pa drag po skyes nas /
translated: The meaning of the explanation is as follows:

original: zag pa med pa'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi bye brag snang ba thob pa la sogs pa mdo sde'i rgyan las bshad pa des bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi bye brag snang ba thob pa la sogs pa mdo sde'i rgyan las bshad pa des bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having generated such intense aspiration, one cultivates the uncontaminated dharmas that are factors of enlightenment, such as the attainment of light, as explained in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: de nyid rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the aspect,

original: des rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because one realizes through that.

original: de'i tshe de dag rnam pa des sgom par byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag rnam pa des sgom par byed kyi /
translated: At that time, one cultivates those through that aspect,

original: snga ma bzhin du sems pa tsam gyis ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ston par byed pas sbyor ba rtsom zhing 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems pa tsam gyis ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ston par byed pas sbyor ba rtsom zhing 'thob pa yin te /
translated: not merely through thought as before. Therefore, it shows the stage of equipoise, and one begins and attains the application.

original: gnas skabs de ni rtogs pa'i 'phen par byed pa yin pas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni rtogs pa'i 'phen par byed pa yin pas sbyor ba'o //
translated: That stage is the application that propels realization.

original: 'di yang mdo las /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos bye brag gis bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las / zag pa med pa'i chos bye brag gis bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is also taught in the sūtras:🔽For the sake of cultivating the uncontaminated dharmas through distinctions.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams bsams pa @14a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams bsams pa @14a * //
translated: The uncontaminated dharmas are contemplated,

original: las byung ba las khyad par du 'phags pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa bye brag gis bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las byung ba las khyad par du 'phags pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa bye brag gis bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is cultivated by the knowledge in meditative equipoise, which is superior to that which arises from karma.

original: rtogs par byed pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni rnam par phye zin pa nyid du zad do //🔽shes rab chen po yang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs bstan pas /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni rnam par phye zin pa nyid du zad do // shes rab chen po yang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs bstan pas /
translated: The composition of the means of realization and the attainment of the result have already been explained in detail.

original: mdo las yon tan rjod par byed de /
analyzed: mdo las yon tan rjod par byed de /
translated: The sutra describes the qualities of the path of seeing by means of synonyms such as “great wisdom” and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di nyid dngos po'i mtha' shes pa yin pa'i phyir /🔽don dam pa pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di nyid dngos po'i mtha' shes pa yin pa'i phyir / don dam pa pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yin te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the limit of reality because it is the path of seeing itself.

original: 'di yod na dri ma gnyis dang 'bral bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di yod na dri ma gnyis dang 'bral bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is the generation of the ultimate thought of awakening because when it exists, one becomes free from the two obscurations.🔽It is not the case that the listeners and so forth have such a great purpose.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni don chen po ma yin pa nyid do zhes gdul ba rnams theg pa chen po la spro ba bskyed pa'i ched yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni don chen po ma yin pa nyid do zhes gdul ba rnams theg pa chen po la spro ba bskyed pa'i ched yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is taught in order to inspire those to be trained to take up the Great Vehicle.

original: des de ltar rtogs nas bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: des de ltar rtogs nas bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa ni /
translated: Having realized the path of seeing in this way, one then abides in the path of meditation.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi sa bcu la sogs pa chos kyi rnam grangs rnams kyi don du brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtogs par byed rab tu shes par byed pas na bsgom pa'i
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi sa bcu la sogs pa chos kyi rnam grangs rnams kyi don du brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtogs par byed rab tu shes par byed pas na bsgom pa'i
translated: The path of cultivation is so called because it causes one to realize and fully understand the topics of the Dharma, such as the ten levels of pure mundane gnosis and so forth, which are the subject matter of the Dharma teachings, such as the elements that lead to enlightenment.🔽

original: lam rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of meditation is called the path of preparation and attainment because it is the realization and full understanding of the topics of the Dharma, such as the ten levels of pure mundane wisdom, and so on.

original: ji ltar de dag rtogs par byed ce na de des rang gi rtogs pas yongs su gcod pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rtogs par byed ce na de des rang gi rtogs pas yongs su gcod pa na /
translated: How does it realize them? When it fully comprehends its own realization,

original: de dag kyang des rtogs te /
analyzed: de dag kyang des rtogs te /
translated: it realizes them too,

original: de dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in supramundane gnosis.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de'i bya ba rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de'i bya ba rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pas /
translated: Or alternatively, its function is not just the full comprehension of its own realization,
