original: de'i phyir de dag kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: so it also fully understands them.

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to enter the door of the wisdom of thorough investigation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom of thorough investigation

original: rjes la thob pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rjes la thob pa kho na yin te /
translated: is only subsequent,

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is born through the power of the uncontaminated.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Even though it is contaminated, it is called that.

original: des sgo rnams la 'jug pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des sgo rnams la 'jug pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Its entry into the doors is realization.

original: sgo ni 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs kyi don yin te /
analyzed: sgo ni 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs kyi don yin te /
translated: The doors here are the topics of the Dharma categories,

original: de'i sgo nas de dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one enters them through those doors.

original: res 'ga' don yang sgra yongs su shes par bya ba la sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' don yang sgra yongs su shes par bya ba la sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: Sometimes the meaning is also called the door of the understanding of the words.🔽The teaching of the distinctions of one's own position as appropriate.

original: rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par ci rigs par yongs su bstan pa la zhes bya ba la ci rigs su zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par ci rigs par yongs su bstan pa la zhes bya ba la ci rigs su zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the explanation of as appropriate is as appropriate.

original: lugs gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas gang la gang @14b rigs par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lugs gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas gang la gang @14b rigs par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means in whatever way is appropriate, following another system.

original: gnas gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of other basis is distinctions of one's own position.

original: rang gi phyogs nyid de las gzhan pa la ltos na khyad par can yin la /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs nyid de las gzhan pa la ltos na khyad par can yin la /
translated: One's own position is distinguished from the other position.

original: de nyid gnas gzhan yang yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gnas gzhan yang yin te /
translated: And that itself is the other place,

original: pha rol smra ba'i phyogs gzhan la ltos na gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: pha rol smra ba'i phyogs gzhan la ltos na gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is other than the other position of the opponent.

original: / rab tu brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yongs su bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: / rab tu brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yongs su bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The term utterance is explained by the term teaching.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: Utterance is teaching.

original: de nyid yongs su bstan pa yin te 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rang gi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid yongs su bstan pa yin te 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rang gi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That itself is teaching, which is to say, the establishment of one's own position by means of the reasoning that establishes tenability.

original: de la bag tsha ba med pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yul yul por ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag tsha ba med pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yul yul por ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is the absence of fear, because one is not timid in the presence of others.

original: mi shes pas yul yul por gyur pa dang 'dra bas na bag tsha ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pas yul yul por gyur pa dang 'dra bas na bag tsha ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Timidity is like timidity in the presence of others due to ignorance.

original: spobs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra lan 'debs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: spobs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra lan 'debs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The term eloquence is explained by the term eloquence in reply.

original: lan ni tshig lan no //
analyzed: lan ni tshig lan no //
translated: Answer means verbal answer.

original: de gdab par nus ba ni spobs pa'o //
analyzed: de gdab par nus ba ni spobs pa'o //
translated: The ability to give that is eloquence.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byung ba'i phyir lan 'debs nus pa ni dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byung ba'i phyir lan 'debs nus pa ni dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The ability to answer in order to refute the position of another is stainless.

original: des sun 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: des sun 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid de /
translated: It is the very clarity of all the aspects of refutation.

original: de lta bur mun pa med pa ni snang ba yin pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur mun pa med pa ni snang ba yin pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is such a non-darkness, it is illumination. The ability to destroy the adversary is called the undertaking and the attainment.

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu brjod pa la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu brjod pa la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to illuminate through eloquence that is free from timidity in the exposition of any subject matter.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu bstan par bya ba la bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu bstan par bya ba la bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the absence of timidity in the exposition of any subject matter.

original: spobs pas snang bar bya ba gang yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spobs pas snang bar bya ba gang yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the illumination of eloquence.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa ni spyod yul dang yul lo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa ni spyod yul dang yul lo //
translated: The stage of great analytical knowledges is the domain and the object-field.

original: de shes pas mngon sum du byed pa ni khong du chud pa dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pas mngon sum du byed pa ni khong du chud pa dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: Understanding it, one makes it evident, which is the comprehension and investigation.

original: de dang ldan pas gzhan dag gis dri ba rnam pa du ma smras pa rnams kyi lan 'debs par nus pas de'i 'og tu dris pa lan 'debs nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas gzhan dag gis dri ba rnam pa du ma smras pa rnams kyi lan 'debs par nus pas de'i 'og tu dris pa lan 'debs nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one possesses that, one is able to answer the various questions of others. Therefore, immediately after that, one is said to undertake and attain the ability to answer questions.

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “In order to thoroughly realize the stage of the great analytical knowledges.”

original: ji lta zhe na go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa chen po chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis ming @15a * //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa chen po chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis ming @15a * //
translated: What is that? It is the four great analytical knowledges of Dharma, meaning, etymological analysis, and ready speech.🔽In order to thoroughly realize the characteristics of name,

original: dang don dang tshig dang / shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang don dang tshig dang / shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: meaning, word, and knowledge, respectively.

original: rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are thoroughly distinguished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi sems yin pas byang chub don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi sems yin pas byang chub don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is the thought of awakening, so he is one who strives for awakening.

original: byang chub tu smon lam btab pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ston par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub tu smon lam btab pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ston par byed do //
translated: The term “one who has made a vow for awakening” indicates this.

original: des na dran pa mi brjed pas chud mi gson pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dran pa mi brjed pas chud mi gson pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he does not waste his life because he does not forget his recollection.

original: de yang byang chub dran pa chud mi gson pa yod na yod pas /
analyzed: de yang byang chub dran pa chud mi gson pa yod na yod pas /
translated: Moreover, if he has the recollection of awakening, he does not waste his life.

original: la la las bar du byang chub ces bya ba'i sgra 'byung ngo //
analyzed: la la las bar du byang chub ces bya ba'i sgra 'byung ngo //
translated: In some places, the term “awakening” is used.

original: la la las ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i sgra kho na zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: la la las ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i sgra kho na zhig 'byung ste /
translated: In some places, only the term “thought of awakening” is used.

original: de'i tshe ni byang chub tu smon lam btab pa nyid byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched yin bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni byang chub tu smon lam btab pa nyid byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched yin bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: At that time, it should be understood that the very vow for awakening is the thought of awakening.

original: des na 'di theg pa dman pa la dga' ba skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: des na 'di theg pa dman pa la dga' ba skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: Therefore, this does not generate delight in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: de'i nyes pa'i gnyen por theg pa dman par 'gro ba'i gnyen por rtsam zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa'i gnyen por theg pa dman par 'gro ba'i gnyen por rtsam zhing 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: As an antidote to that fault, the antidote to going to the Lesser Vehicle is called “striving and obtaining.”

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This is also taught in the sutra:

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis dran pa brjed pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis dran pa brjed pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to not forget the thought of awakening.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la le lo byed pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni rtogs par sla'o //🔽thams cad du zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga dag tu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la le lo byed pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni rtogs par sla'o // thams cad du zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga dag tu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The remedy for laziness in working for the welfare of sentient beings is the practice of and attainment of realization.🔽The commentary on “in all” is “in the five sciences.”

original: zhugs pa ni rnam par zhugs pa ste gtan la 'bebs pa gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni rnam par zhugs pa ste gtan la 'bebs pa gang yin ba'o //
translated: Engaging is fully engaging in the ascertainment of the five sciences.

original: de thob pa ni rtogs pa ste ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de thob pa ni rtogs pa ste ldan pa yin no //
translated: Attaining that is realization, which is possessing them.

original: des na 'di sems can gyi don gyi thabs su rig pa'i gnas de dag la mkhas shing sems can bag la nyal tha dad pa rnams yongs su smin par byed nus pas thabs mi shes pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'di sems can gyi don gyi thabs su rig pa'i gnas de dag la mkhas shing sems can bag la nyal tha dad pa rnams yongs su smin par byed nus pas thabs mi shes pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this is called the practice of and attainment of the remedy for not knowing the methods, since one is skilled in those sciences that are the means for the welfare of sentient beings and is able to ripen sentient beings with different latent tendencies.

original: 'di yang mdo las thams cad du zhugs pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las thams cad du zhugs pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also is indicated in the sutra, “in order to attain the discernment that penetrates everywhere.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga ni /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga ni /
translated: The five branches of learning are:

original: sgra dang gtan tshigs de bzhin bzo //
analyzed: sgra dang gtan tshigs de bzhin bzo //
translated: grammar, logic, the inner science,

original: gso ba dang ni de bzhin du //🔽nang ni so sor brtag bya ba //
analyzed: gso ba dang ni de bzhin du // nang ni so sor brtag bya ba //
translated: arts and medicine.🔽The wise one should know

original: shes pa mkhas pas rig par 'dod //
analyzed: shes pa mkhas pas rig par 'dod //
translated: that the inner science is to be analyzed.

original: de ltar na gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas bcu tshe na gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas bcu tshe na gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the second chapter, beginning with the benefit for others, there are ten topics.

original: don du brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo rnams ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs rnams te /
analyzed: don du brjod par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo rnams ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs rnams te /
translated: The topics to be expressed are the doors of doctrine such as the elements that lead to enlightenment, which are the various enumerations of doctrine such as the Heap of Jewels Sutra,

original: de dag gis don gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i @15b phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis don gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i @15b phyir ro //
translated: because they are the means of engaging the meaning.

original: de dag gis rab tu dbye ba ni mang po nyid de //
analyzed: de dag gis rab tu dbye ba ni mang po nyid de //
translated: Their differentiation is their multiplicity.

original: sgo rab tu dbye ba de la'o /
analyzed: sgo rab tu dbye ba de la'o /
translated: The analysis of the doors of doctrine is the analysis of the topics.

original: ji ltar na 'dis mkhas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dis mkhas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become wise through them?

original: thams cad 'di'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad 'di'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: because everything is included in it.

original: 'di dang 'dir don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di dang 'dir don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, beginning from the ultimate thought of awakening,

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rab tu phye ba rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gnas skabs gang nas gang ma thob pa la rnam par phye nas sa bcu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rab tu phye ba rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gnas skabs gang nas gang ma thob pa la rnam par phye nas sa bcu nyid du brjod do //
translated: the ten stages are described as the various attainments of the state of a bodhisattva and a tathagata, which are due to the stream of uncontaminated intuition.

original: mdo thams cad las ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs sam rgyu'i gnas skabs zhig 'byung la /
analyzed: mdo thams cad las ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs sam rgyu'i gnas skabs zhig 'byung la /
translated: In all the scriptures, either the state of result or the state of cause is described,

original: 'di las ni gnyis ka 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dis thams cad la mkhas par gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las ni gnyis ka 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dis thams cad la mkhas par gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: but in this treatise, both are described. Therefore, one should understand that this treatise is learned in all the scriptures.

original: gzhan dag na re dang po nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dang po nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is because the ten stages are explained first.

original: spobs bar gyis shig ces bya ba 'dis ni spobs pa spyir gsungs te /
analyzed: spobs bar gyis shig ces bya ba 'dis ni spobs pa spyir gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “speak with eloquence” indicates eloquence in general.

original: de nyid rang gi mthu dang gzhan gyi mthu'i spobs pa zhes rnam par phye nas brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi mthu dang gzhan gyi mthu'i spobs pa zhes rnam par phye nas brjod do //
translated: That is called the power of one’s own and the power of another’s eloquence.

original: de ltar na spobs pa'i rtsa ba ni yan lag kyang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na spobs pa'i rtsa ba ni yan lag kyang yin la /
translated: Thus, eloquence is both a branch and a subdivision.

original: cig shos ni de'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni de'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The other is a subsidiary branch because it is a subdivision of that.

original: 'dir nye ba'i yan lag gi rang gi mthu'i spobs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nye ba'i yan lag gi rang gi mthu'i spobs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the power of one’s own eloquence is a subsidiary branch.

original: yan lag tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbye ba'i ngo bo spobs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbye ba'i ngo bo spobs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which becomes a branch is the basis for the other four kinds of eloquence, which have the nature of subdivisions.

original: de la gzhan gyi mthu byin gyi rlabs kyis 'char bar nus te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi mthu byin gyi rlabs kyis 'char bar nus te /
translated: Among them, the power of another is able to arise through the blessing of another.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is indicated by “through the power of the Buddha.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus de ni mdo nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs zhes tshig gzhan gyis rnam par phye ba mdzad pa yin te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus de ni mdo nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs zhes tshig gzhan gyis rnam par phye ba mdzad pa yin te ;
translated: Through the power of the Buddha, that is distinguished by other words in the sūtra itself as “the blessing of the Tathāgata’s appearance of wisdom.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs kyis /
translated: Through the blessing of the Tathāgata,

original: rdo rje snying po snang zhing mun pa med pa dang / rab tu mngon zhing don thams cad gsal bar gyur nas ji ltar bstan par bya ba'i don byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas bzhin du phyin ci ma log par ston pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rdo rje snying po snang zhing mun pa med pa dang / rab tu mngon zhing don thams cad gsal bar gyur nas ji ltar bstan par bya ba'i don byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas bzhin du phyin ci ma log par ston pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: and the vajra essence is luminous and without darkness, and having become very manifest and clear about all meanings, it is blessed so that it can teach the meaning that is to be taught, such as the factors of awakening, just like a buddha, without error.

original: /'dus byas ni zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'dus byas ni zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conditioned factors are the uncontaminated factors of awakening and so on.

original: de nyid ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called the virtuous roots because they are by nature nonattachment and so on.

original: rdo rje'i snying po'i rgyud du gtogs pa de dag yongs su dag cing rnam par byang pas spobs pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po'i rgyud du gtogs pa de dag yongs su dag cing rnam par byang pas spobs pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: They are called eloquence because they are included in the vajra essence and are completely purified and cleansed.

original: @16a * // de la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi skabs su gzhan gyi mthu'i spobs pa kho na brjod par rung ste /
analyzed: @16a * // de la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi skabs su gzhan gyi mthu'i spobs pa kho na brjod par rung ste /
translated: In this context, it is appropriate to speak only of the eloquence of others' power in the context of the buddhas' blessings.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos de dag spobs pa 'byin nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsung gis rdo rje'i snying po la bskul ba dang / brtas shing kha 'bye la rgyas par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos de dag spobs pa 'byin nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsung gis rdo rje'i snying po la bskul ba dang / brtas shing kha 'bye la rgyas par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Those conditioned phenomena are able to produce eloquence, and the Tathāgata himself exhorts the vajra essence with his speech, and it expands, opens, and spreads.

original: 'on kyang rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi mthu brtas pas der spobs pa skye ba'i phyir rang gi mthu'i spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi mthu brtas pas der spobs pa skye ba'i phyir rang gi mthu'i spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: However, since eloquence arises there due to the expansion of the power belonging to one's own continuum, it is called eloquence through one's own power.

original: gzhan yang yod dgu de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs 'ba' zhig 'chad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod dgu de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs 'ba' zhig 'chad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not only the Tathāgata's blessing that is explained in all cases.

original: 'di'i rang gi nus pa'i mthu yang 'di 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi nus pa'i mthu yang 'di 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that the power of one's own ability is also like this,

original: 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo las /
translated: this is also taught in the sūtra:

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because one's own roots of virtue are completely pure.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are suchness and the dharmadhātu.

original: de yongs su dag pa ni rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: de yongs su dag pa ni rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: Its complete purity is purification.

original: de'i stobs kyi spobs pa gang yin pa de 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su dag par spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi spobs pa gang yin pa de 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su dag par spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That confidence which is due to that is called “confidence in the purification of the unconditioned element.

original: de yang mdo las chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang mdo las chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan to //
translated: ” And that is taught by another enumeration in the sutra as “purification of the dharma-element.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phan 'dogs pa de'i rgyu las byung ba yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phan 'dogs pa de'i rgyu las byung ba yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: ” The cause of that benefit which is the ripening of beings is purification.

original: des spobs pa'o //
analyzed: des spobs pa'o //
translated: That is confidence.

original: de yang mdo las sems can gyi khams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang mdo las sems can gyi khams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig gis bstan to //
translated: And that is taught by its own words in the sutra as “benefit for the realm of beings.

original: chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: ” The dharma-body is the dharma-element.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa spangs zhes bya ba ni de bye brag tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa spangs zhes bya ba ni de bye brag tu byed pa yin no //
translated: “Abandonment of mind, mentality, and consciousness” is its specification.

original: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags sa bon rnams kyis bstsags shing bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags sa bon rnams kyis bstsags shing bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the store-consciousness is called “mind” because it is accumulated and imbued with the seeds of the propensities for all afflicted phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhis rlom pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yid yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhis rlom pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yid yin no //
translated: The afflicted mind is the mind because it is always the nature of conceit due to the four afflictions such as delusion of self.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa drug car yang rnam par shes pa yin te de dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa drug car yang rnam par shes pa yin te de dag spangs pa'o //
translated: The consciousnesses of eye, etc., are the six consciousnesses because they are the appearance of form, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / rdo rje'i snying po la mthar phyin pa rnam pa 'di gsum char yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa / rdo rje'i snying po la mthar phyin pa rnam pa 'di gsum char yod de /
translated: It is said: The vajra essence has these three perfections.

original: mthar phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mchog nyid yin no //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mchog nyid yin no //
translated: Perfection is the supremacy of the bodhisattva.

original: de la sa bcu pa la de'i de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa na /
analyzed: de la sa bcu pa la de'i de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa na /
translated: Therein, on the tenth stage, when its suchness is transformed,

original: de'i tshe shes pa de dag @16b sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de dag tu mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa de dag @16b sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de dag tu mi brjod kyi /
translated: at that time, those consciousnesses are not called mind, etc., because there is no reason for the application of the terms mind, etc.

original: 'on kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Nevertheless, it is called mirror-wisdom, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa spangs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa spangs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is said to be the abandonment of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig gi gnas zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig gi gnas zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it the abode of pure consciousness alone?

original: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes dag pa 'ba' zhig gi gnas yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes dag pa 'ba' zhig gi gnas yin pas so //
translated: It is the abode of pure consciousness alone, because it is free from the stain of the duality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'di go chos nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di go chos nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is not this reality the Dharma-element?

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi gnas yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the abode of these?

original: de dag des rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag des rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is the abode of these because it is revealed by them.

original: 'di ltar gzhan nas dang po ni gnyis kyi gnas yin no zhes de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid 'di longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa gnyis kyi gnas yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan nas dang po ni gnyis kyi gnas yin no zhes de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid 'di longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa gnyis kyi gnas yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus, elsewhere it is said that the first is the abode of the two, i.e., the Dharma-element is the abode of both the beatific and the emanation bodies.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: For this very reason, it is called the Dharma-element, because it is the cause of the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa 'di yang mdo las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa 'di yang mdo las /
translated: This ultimate perfection of the bodhisattva is also stated in a sūtra:

original: chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the dharma body is the body of wisdom.

original: 'di ni chos kyi sku yang yin la ye shes kyi sku yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi sku yang yin la ye shes kyi sku yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: It is the dharma body and it is the body of wisdom, so the words are combined.

original: sku ni gnas kho na yin no //
analyzed: sku ni gnas kho na yin no //
translated: The body is the basis.

original: yang na ye shes rnams nyid sku'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: yang na ye shes rnams nyid sku'i gnas yin te /
translated: Or, the bodies are the basis of the wisdoms.🔽Because it is the nature of the dharma, it is the basis of wisdom alone.

original: de ni chos kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ye shes 'ba' zhig gi gnas zhes bya ba 'dir yang me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig rten yin pas ye shes de skad tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ye shes 'ba' zhig gi gnas zhes bya ba 'dir yang me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig rten yin pas ye shes de skad tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the mirrorlike wisdom and so on are the basis of wisdom alone.

original: mthar phyin gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthar phyin gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The second ultimate is the ultimate of the buddhas.

original: da gzod kho na dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su skye zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: da gzod kho na dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su skye zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it explained that one is born in the realm of Maheśvara only at that time?

original: de ni 'og min gyi gnas su skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ni 'og min gyi gnas su skye ba yin pas /
translated: That is birth in the Akaniṣṭha realm.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: That is also stated in a sūtra:

original: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin na /
translated: Because it is taught that the body arises that is superior to all worlds.

original: ji ltar de'i lus khog pa 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa dpag tshad khri drug stong gi tshad du 'byung ba rnyed pa dang / de bzhin du sems can gyi don la 'gro ba gzhan du yang skye ba nyid na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i lus khog pa 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa dpag tshad khri drug stong gi tshad du 'byung ba rnyed pa dang / de bzhin du sems can gyi don la 'gro ba gzhan du yang skye ba nyid na /
translated: How is it that his body, which is superior to all worlds, arises with a size of sixteen thousand yojanas, and likewise, how is it that he is born in other migrations for the sake of sentient beings?

original: de ji ltar 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'da' sba zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'da' sba zhes bya ba na /
translated: How is it that he transcends the five migrations?

original: dbang thob pas nyon mongs ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gis de dag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang thob pas nyon mongs ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gis de dag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained mastery, he is not born there through the power of others, i.e., the afflictions.

original: nyan thos rnams ni gtan du mi skye ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni gtan du mi skye ste /
translated: The sravakas are not born there forever.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par 'das pa ni thun mong ba'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par 'das pa ni thun mong ba'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, transcending is said to be the culmination of the common vehicle.

original: de yang mdo @17a * //
analyzed: de yang mdo @17a * //
translated: Moreover, it is taught in the sutra:

original: las 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: las 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes rang gi tshig gis bstan to //
translated: Because it transcends all migrations of the world.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pa ni mdo las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pa ni mdo las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te ;
translated: The path to nirvana is pure, as a sutra declares:🔽In order to purify the going of supramundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gre ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar bsdus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gre ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar bsdus so //
translated: This is summarized in the phrase “the pure going of supramundane dharmas.”

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: Nirvana is the ultimate truth and thus is dharma.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The path that causes one to attain it is going,

original: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni lam yin no //
analyzed: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni lam yin no //
translated: because one goes there. Going is the path.

original: 'jig rten pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a mundane path,

original: des kyang 'bral ba 'thob pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i sgras khyad bar du byas so //
analyzed: des kyang 'bral ba 'thob pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i sgras khyad bar du byas so //
translated: but it is distinguished by the term supramundane because it attains separation.

original: thugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is the mental blessing?

original: lus de yang phung po lnga pa yin pas /
analyzed: lus de yang phung po lnga pa yin pas /
translated: That body is also the five aggregates.

original: de'i phyir de dag zil gyis mi non pa nyid du rnam par phye nas brjod do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag zil gyis mi non pa nyid du rnam par phye nas brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, they are described as not being outshone, having distinguished them from the others.

original: / bla na med pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / bla na med pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Possessing the splendor of unsurpassed glory🔽.

original: gzi brjid ni gzi byin te gzugs mdzes pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzi brjid ni gzi byin te gzugs mdzes pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Splendor is majesty, a special beauty of form.

original: de yang sman bcud kyis len la sogs pas kyang 'gyur ba de'i phyir bla na med pa'i dpal gyis zhes smos pas khyad par du byas te /
analyzed: de yang sman bcud kyis len la sogs pas kyang 'gyur ba de'i phyir bla na med pa'i dpal gyis zhes smos pas khyad par du byas te /
translated: That is also produced by elixirs, etc. Therefore, it is specified by the words of unsurpassed glory.

original: dpal gyis mdzes pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpal gyis mdzes pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that he possesses the beauty of glory.

original: de yang dpes ston par byad de /
analyzed: de yang dpes ston par byad de /
translated: That is illustrated by an example.

original: de ni mdog mdzes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyal po'i 'khor rnams zil gyis mnan nas 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni mdog mdzes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyal po'i 'khor rnams zil gyis mnan nas 'jug go //
translated: Because he possesses a beautiful complexion, he enters, outshining the king's retinue.

original: bstan bcos kyi don rnam par gtan la dbab par bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don rnam par gtan la dbab par bya ba la /
translated: In the determination of the meaning of the treatise,

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las gzhan pa'i gdams ngag sbyin ba'i mthu ni 'di la yod pa nyid las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad ci dgos /🔽de sbyin nus pa ni der spobs @19a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gdams ngag sbyin ba'i mthu ni 'di la yod pa nyid las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad ci dgos / de sbyin nus pa ni der spobs @19a * //
translated: Since he has the power to give instructions that are different from those, why would he need to establish them?

original: pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa nyid do //
translated: The ability to give them is eloquence in that.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: stobs bcu po thogs pa med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: stobs bcu po thogs pa med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He is said to be the one who has the ten powers that are unobstructed.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stobs bcu po byin gyis brlabs pas de dag sangs rgyas kyi mthus yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stobs bcu po byin gyis brlabs pas de dag sangs rgyas kyi mthus yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the Blessed One has blessed the ten powers, they are due to the power of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: They are endowed with the powers of a Buddha.

original: de dag gis sems de dag la thogs pa med thags thogs med pas gdul ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa drungs nas 'byin par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag gi spobs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis sems de dag la thogs pa med thags thogs med pas gdul ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa drungs nas 'byin par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag gi spobs pa yin te /
translated: Since they have no obstruction or resistance to those minds, they have the courage of instructions that definitely remove, because they eradicate the afflictions of those to be trained.

original: mdo las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The sutra says, “The power of the perfect Buddha is invincible.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar sgrub ba mdzad pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs dag gis rdo rje'i snying po brdzi ba med pa'i mthu rnyed pas sangs rgyas kho na bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar sgrub ba mdzad pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs dag gis rdo rje'i snying po brdzi ba med pa'i mthu rnyed pas sangs rgyas kho na bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The power of the perfect Buddha is the power of the Bhagavat. The power of the vajra essence is invincible. The power of the Buddha is obtained by the power of the Buddha. It is unobstructed like the Buddha himself.

original: de yang thar pa pa'i lam gyis lung phog pas gdul ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa gcod pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thar pa pa'i lam gyis lung phog pas gdul ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa gcod pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood from the eradication of the afflictions of those to be trained by the prediction of the path of liberation.

original: de lta na mi 'jigs pa la sogs pas zhum pa med cing mi 'gong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na mi 'jigs pa la sogs pas zhum pa med cing mi 'gong ba nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, he is not timid and not arrogant due to his fearlessnesses, etc.

original: mi shes pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba dang nya bar gnas na 'gong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba dang nya bar gnas na 'gong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He is not timid due to his lack of knowledge, nor is he arrogant due to his lack of fear of opponents.

original: mi 'jigs pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad pas na bag tsha ba med par ston par byed do ;
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad pas na bag tsha ba med par ston par byed do ;
translated: He is fearless because he has attained fearlessness.

original: / de yang mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pas zhum pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / de yang mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pas zhum pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Sūtra says that he is not timid due to the tathāgatas’ powers and fearlessnesses.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kho na bstan pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kho na bstan pa yin /
translated: The phrase “belonging to the Buddha’s knowledge” indicates the knowledge of all things by another name.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni bye brag yin te des so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni bye brag yin te des so //
translated: The analysis of the analytical knowledges is their differentiation.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “the Sūtras, etc.” includes the melodious narrations and predictions, etc.

original: tshul drug po de dag la rtog pa ni dpyod pa ste des chos de dag gi rnam grangs du ma mos pa tha dad pa rnams la ston pas na mi zad pa'i spobs ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul drug po de dag la rtog pa ni dpyod pa ste des chos de dag gi rnam grangs du ma mos pa tha dad pa rnams la ston pas na mi zad pa'i spobs ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The investigation of those six modes is analysis. Since that teaches many enumerations of those phenomena to those with different aspirations, it is called inexhaustible eloquence.

original: de yang mdo las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag bar rig pa'i bye brag gis chos kyi tshul la rtogs pa zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mdo las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag bar rig pa'i bye brag gis chos kyi tshul la rtogs pa zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the sutra, the knowledge of the distinctions of the individual correct knowledges of the omniscient wisdom is called the realization of the way of the Dharma.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag ni rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag ni rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The distinctions of the individual correct knowledges of the omniscient wisdom are its divisions.

original: yul gyi @19b bye brag gis rnam pa du mar sa bcu pa las bshad do //
analyzed: yul gyi @19b bye brag gis rnam pa du mar sa bcu pa las bshad do //
translated: By the distinction of objects, it is explained in the Ten Grounds Sutra to have many aspects.

original: des na chos rnams kyi tshul la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: des na chos rnams kyi tshul la rtog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it realizes the way of phenomena.

original: de la tshul dag ni drug go //
analyzed: de la tshul dag ni drug go //
translated: Therein, the ways are six.

original: de dag la rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag la rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang rtog pa nyid do //
translated: The investigation of those is analysis and investigation itself.

original: de la tshul drug ni de kho na nyid kyi don gyi tshul dang / thos pa'i tshul dang / ston pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spong ba'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de la tshul drug ni de kho na nyid kyi don gyi tshul dang / thos pa'i tshul dang / ston pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spong ba'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The six methods are the method of the meaning of reality, the method of hearing, the method of teaching, the method of avoiding the two extremes, the method of the inconceivable, and the method of the intention.

original: de la phyi ma rnams kyis dang po gsum rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyi ma rnams kyis dang po gsum rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The latter three are to be understood by means of the first three.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na dge slong dag / gzugs la ro myang ba yang yod /
analyzed: dper na dge slong dag / gzugs la ro myang ba yang yod /
translated: For example, monks, there is enjoyment in form,

original: nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba yang yod do //
translated: there is danger and there is escape.

original: tshor ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang de 'dra'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshor ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang de 'dra'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The same is said in detail for feeling, etc.

original: phung po lnga po kho na la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba bstan te /
analyzed: phung po lnga po kho na la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba bstan te /
translated: The defilement and purification of the five aggregates is taught.

original: ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: Enjoyment and danger are defilement.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni rnam par byang ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni rnam par byang ba yin no //
translated: Escape is purification.

original: de gnyi ga yang 'di nyid la yod na bdag gis ci zhig bya zhes sgro 'dogs pa mtha' bstsal to //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang 'di nyid la yod na bdag gis ci zhig bya zhes sgro 'dogs pa mtha' bstsal to //
translated: If both of them exist, then what use is there for a self?

original: bdag med na yang de dag mi rung ngo zhes de gnyis la skur ba 'debs pa yang 'di nyid kyis bstsal to //
analyzed: bdag med na yang de dag mi rung ngo zhes de gnyis la skur ba 'debs pa yang 'di nyid kyis bstsal to //
translated: This also refutes the extreme of denial that denies the reality of both the self and the world, saying that if there is no self, then they are not possible.🔽Therefore, this passage teaches the meaning of reality by way of abandoning the two extremes, and it teaches the meaning of the self by way of abandoning the two extremes.

original: de lta bas na 'di las mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyi don gyi tshul bstan pa lta bu dang / dper na mdo nyid las dge slong dag ngas ji srid du gzugs la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyi don gyi tshul bstan pa lta bu dang / dper na mdo nyid las dge slong dag ngas ji srid du gzugs la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang /
translated: For example, in the sutra itself, the Buddha says:🔽Monks, as long as I did not understand taste in form, the faults of taste in form,

original: nges par 'byung ba shes par ma gyur /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba shes par ma gyur /
translated: and the definite emergence from taste in form,🔽I did not understand that I had fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la shes par ma gyur pa de srid du ngas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so snyam du shes par ma gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la shes par ma gyur pa de srid du ngas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so snyam du shes par ma gyur gyi /
translated: And so on.

original: gang gi phyir ngas 'di dag la ro myang ba la sogs par shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngas 'di dag la ro myang ba la sogs par shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because I know that they savor the taste of these,

original: ngas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so snyam du shes so zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ngas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so snyam du shes so zhes gsungs pa /
translated: I know that I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mdo de nyid las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from that very sūtra.🔽This explains the mode of obtaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, as if explaining the inconceivable nature of obtaining it.

original: 'dis ni thob pa'i tshul bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i ngo bo bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi tshul gyis bshad pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du mdo de nyid las dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur ston pas dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i tshul bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽mjug tu zil @20a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni thob pa'i tshul bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i ngo bo bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi tshul gyis bshad pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du mdo de nyid las dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur ston pas dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i tshul bshad pa lta bu'o // mjug tu zil @20a * //
translated: Similarly, in that very sūtra, by teaching in this way and that way, it explains the mode of teaching through implication by this very intention.

original: gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid smos pa'i 'di ni de'i dbye ba yin no zhes ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid smos pa'i 'di ni de'i dbye ba yin no zhes ston par byed pa ste /
translated: In conclusion, it mentions the very non-submergence of the body, showing that this is its division.

original: bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obstructed.

original: gdul ba tha dad pas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lus gang la mos pa bzhin du gdul ba rnams la nyan thos la sogs pa'i lus de ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba tha dad pas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lus gang la mos pa bzhin du gdul ba rnams la nyan thos la sogs pa'i lus de ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Different is said to be due to the different disciples, because the Buddha displays the bodies of sravakas and so on for those to be trained who aspire to those bodies.

original: sku la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul sku la sogs pa'i ngo mtshar rnams mngon du mdzad pa ni kun du spyod pa dang / dbang ba nyid de ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin ston pa'i phyir cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul sku la sogs pa'i ngo mtshar rnams mngon du mdzad pa ni kun du spyod pa dang / dbang ba nyid de ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin ston pa'i phyir cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The miracles of body and so on are the wonders of body and so on, which are the conduct and mastery of displaying whatever is wished, and so this is called the responsive eloquence of miracles.

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: In the sutra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa nyid nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa nyid nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: it is taught that the Tathagata establishes the full accomplishment of all the ornaments of body, speech and mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i rgyan cho 'phrul gang dag 'gro ba thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba tha dad du gyur pa de dag mngon par sgrub pa ni mngon par sgrub pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i rgyan cho 'phrul gang dag 'gro ba thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba tha dad du gyur pa de dag mngon par sgrub pa ni mngon par sgrub pa'o ;
translated: The adornments of the Tathagatas' bodies, etc., are the miracles that delight all beings. Their accomplishment is the accomplishment of those miracles.

original: / de'i dngos po ni mngon par sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i dngos po ni mngon par sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the nature of accomplishment.

original: gang dang ldan na mngon par 'grub pa de yang ye shes yin te /
analyzed: gang dang ldan na mngon par 'grub pa de yang ye shes yin te /
translated: And that by which one is accomplished is also knowledge.

original: de mngon par sgrub pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de mngon par sgrub pa mdzad do //
translated: He accomplishes that.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' du ma zhig 'dus na de kho na la byin gyis brlabs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' du ma zhig 'dus na de kho na la byin gyis brlabs she na /
translated: Why does he bless only that assembly of many Bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus so //
analyzed: smras pa ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus so //
translated: He says: by the power of samadhi.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba'i sangs gzhan dag la ci'i phyir med ce na 'di la yang /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba'i sangs gzhan dag la ci'i phyir med ce na 'di la yang /
translated: Why is that not so for others?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu de ni gzhan dag la med do zhes gtan tshigs ston par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu de ni gzhan dag la med do zhes gtan tshigs ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the reason: that power of samadhi is not so for others.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag las kyang sring mo yid gnyis sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang gi mthus 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang bslang bar ma nus na gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag las kyang sring mo yid gnyis sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang gi mthus 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang bslang bar ma nus na gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci
translated: In this way, even other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, such as Ārya Mañjuśrī, were unable to rouse him through the power of the samādhi called Dispelling the Doubts of My Sister. What need is there to speak of others?🔽

original: dgos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de lta bu la snyoms par zhugs so zhes grag go //
analyzed: dgos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de lta bu la snyoms par zhugs so zhes grag go //
translated: Thus, it is well known that he entered into a meditative absorption called the “sister dispelling doubt” through the power of which even the bodhisattva mahasattva Manjushri and so on were unable to rouse him, not to mention others.

original: yang ji ltar na mthu de 'di kho na la yod kyi gzhan dag la ma yin zhe na /🔽sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pas 'phangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //🔽sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed bas 'phangs pa de la yang mdo las /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na mthu de 'di kho na la yod kyi gzhan dag la ma yin zhe na / sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pas 'phangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed bas 'phangs pa de la yang mdo las /
translated: Why does he alone have this power and not others?🔽He said, “It was projected by his previous formation” and so on.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis mngon par bsgrubs zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis mngon par bsgrubs zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The sutra states that it was accomplished by his previous aspiration.

original: des sngon gang gis na bdag kho na la ting nge 'dzin 'di yod kyi gzhan dag la ma yin pa de lta bu'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs so//
analyzed: des sngon gang gis na bdag kho na la ting nge 'dzin 'di yod kyi gzhan dag la ma yin pa de lta bu'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs so//
translated: He made a vow that would bring about the cause for his having this concentration, not for anyone else.

original: @20b ting nge 'dzin gyi rten ni de skye ba'i rgyu rnams te yon tan 'og nas gzhi dag pa la sogs pa nyid du 'byung ba gang dag yin ba de dag yongs su 'dzin pa ni yang dag bar sgrub pa dang / 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: @20b ting nge 'dzin gyi rten ni de skye ba'i rgyu rnams te yon tan 'og nas gzhi dag pa la sogs pa nyid du 'byung ba gang dag yin ba de dag yongs su 'dzin pa ni yang dag bar sgrub pa dang / 'thob pa'o //
translated: The basis of concentration is the cause for its arising, which is the purity of the basis, etc.

original: de dad pa dang ldan pas mngon par yid ches par gyur la 'dun pa dang ldan pas don du gnyer bar gyur nas dge ba'i chos thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'di gnyi ga dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la sngon du 'gro ba yin
analyzed: de dad pa dang ldan pas mngon par yid ches par gyur la 'dun pa dang ldan pas don du gnyer bar gyur nas dge ba'i chos thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'di gnyi ga dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la sngon du 'gro ba yin
translated: Since he has faith, he has conviction; since he has aspiration, he has interest. Since he accomplishes all virtuous qualities, both of these are the prerequisites for the arising of all roots of virtue.

original: pas sa bzhi'o //
analyzed: pas sa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, the fourth stage is called the radiant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ba'i rgyu zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ba'i rgyu zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: For this reason, it is said below that it is the cause for the exertion of effort.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni gzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni gzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Its purity is the purity of the basis.

original: de yang sa dang po la gnas pa la yang dri ma dang bral ba shas kyis yod pas khyad par du bya pa'i phyir mdo las lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir zhes shin tu zhes bya ba'i sgra smos la /
analyzed: de yang sa dang po la gnas pa la yang dri ma dang bral ba shas kyis yod pas khyad par du bya pa'i phyir mdo las lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir zhes shin tu zhes bya ba'i sgra smos la /
translated: Moreover, since the state of freedom from impurity exists to some extent even for one who abides in the first stage, the word “extremely” is used in the sūtra, “in order to purify the superior intention extremely well,” in order to distinguish it.

original: bshad pa las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: bshad pa las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin ba zhes smos so //
translated: And in the commentary, “the perfection of the bodhisattva” is mentioned.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pas rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pas rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: It is pure because the continuum is completely matured.

original: 'dir tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, the collection is the collection of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab rnam par dag pas bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab rnam par dag pas bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of wisdom is explained as the purity of wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is the cause of non-wastage.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa rgya chen po 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa rgya chen po 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the cause for attaining vast wealth, as will be explained.

original: shes rab chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can gyis /
analyzed: shes rab chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can gyis /
translated: By the wisdom that has the dharmadhatu as its object,

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir thams cad mngon sum du byed pas chud mi za la /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir thams cad mngon sum du byed pas chud mi za la /
translated: everything is actualized because it is non-different from that, so there is no wastage.

original: bsod nams kyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'byor pa mchog rnams 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'byor pa mchog rnams 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of his merit, he obtains the best of all resources, since he is not in common with the Sravakas, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i chos rnams thams cad bstan pa ste gsang ba dag kho na chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i chos rnams thams cad bstan pa ste gsang ba dag kho na chos rnams yin no //
translated: The Dharma of the Tathagatas is all the secret Dharmas, and they are secret only because they are Dharmas.

original: de yang yul tshad med pa nyid kyis tshad med do //
analyzed: de yang yul tshad med pa nyid kyis tshad med do //
translated: And that is immeasurable because the object is immeasurable.

original: de dran pa mi brjed pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de dran pa mi brjed pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The retention of that is the memory which does not forget.

original: 'di dran pa de'i snod dang gzhi la rten yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dran pa de'i snod dang gzhi la rten yin pa'o //
translated: It is the support and basis of that memory.

original: gsang ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de 'di skad du sangs rgyas rnams las chos bstan pa tshad med pa dag thos nas dran zhing 'dzin par phod nus so zhes bstan pa yin pas thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de 'di skad du sangs rgyas rnams las chos bstan pa tshad med pa dag thos nas dran zhing 'dzin par phod nus so zhes bstan pa yin pas thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mention of the secret is merely an example. It is taught that one is able to hear and retain the immeasurable teachings of the Dharma from the Buddhas, and so it is called the purification of the retention of what is heard.🔽The Illumination of the Superknowledges

original: mngon bar shes pa 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ji ltar na mngon par shes pa dag mos pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mngon bar shes pa 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ji ltar na mngon par shes pa dag mos pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that the superknowledges are called illuminations?

original: smras pa / des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di yang phal cher dpe'i dbang @21a * //
analyzed: smras pa / des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro // 'di yang phal cher dpe'i dbang @21a * //
translated: He replied: Because they are distinguished by that.

original: du byas nas bshad par zad de /
analyzed: du byas nas bshad par zad de /
translated: Moreover, this is explained for the most part from the perspective of the example.

original: 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni yang ba nyid du mos pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni yang ba nyid du mos pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the superknowledge of magical power is distinguished by the resolve for lightness.

original: lha'i rna ba dang lha'i mig dag ni sgra dang snang ba la mos pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang lha'i mig dag ni sgra dang snang ba la mos pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The divine ear and divine eye are distinguished by the resolve for sound and light.

original: shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of thorough realization, because of good realization.

original: gzungs rnams kyi sgo ni yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: gzungs rnams kyi sgo ni yi ge rnams te /
translated: The doors of the dhāraṇīs are the syllables.

original: de dag la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the means of entry into them.

original: yi ge de de dag tha dad pa med pa ni snga phyi mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge de de dag tha dad pa med pa ni snga phyi mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: The non-differentiation of those syllables is the non-contradiction of prior and subsequent.

original: don dam pa shes par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag gang yin pa de bslu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa shes par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag gang yin pa de bslu ba med pa ste /
translated: The instruction that is for the purpose of knowing the ultimate is non-deceptive.

original: de rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rtogs pas nga rgyal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rtogs pas nga rgyal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since all pride is abandoned through the realization of that, it is called “purification free from manifest pride.🔽”

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: The sutra teaches:🔽“Because it is well-sealed with the seal of the dharma-dhātu.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i phyag rgyas legs bar btab pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i phyag rgyas legs bar btab pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because it is well sealed with the seal called the expanse of reality.🔽🔽

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings yin no //
translated: The ultimate is the dharma-dhātu because it is the supreme of all phenomena.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa don dam pa shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa don dam pa shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is the subject of that is ultimate consciousness and dharma-dhātu consciousness.

original: de'i ched kyi phyag rgya ni mtshan nyid gsum gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ched kyi phyag rgya ni mtshan nyid gsum gang yin pa ste /
translated: The seal for that is the three natures.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum mo //
translated: They are the three general natures.

original: yang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dang mdo sde la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de des legs par btab pa'o ;
analyzed: yang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dang mdo sde la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de des legs par btab pa'o ;
translated: It is well-sealed with that because it is the nature of the Vinaya, Abhidharma, and sūtras.

original: / de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gdams ngag go zhes tshig khong nas drang ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag go zhes tshig khong nas drang ste /
translated: The instruction is to be inferred from the words.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not deceptive.

original: yang na gdams ngag de nyid phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: yang na gdams ngag de nyid phyag rgya yin te /
translated: Or else, that instruction itself is the seal,

original: rang la nges pa bzhin 'doms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la nges pa bzhin 'doms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is advice that is certain for oneself.

original: bslu ba med pa nyid ni gang dag la 'doms pa de dag gis de rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bslu ba med pa nyid ni gang dag la 'doms pa de dag gis de rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of deception should be understood by those to whom the advice is given, because they will realize it.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu yang yod la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu yang yod pas rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus zhes khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu yang yod la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu yang yod pas rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus zhes khyad par du byed do //
translated: Since there is the power of concentration and also the power of supernatural emanations, the power of supernatural emanations is specified.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na don dam pa pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir the tshom med pas shin tu rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na don dam pa pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir the tshom med pas shin tu rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: The ultimate generation of the thought of enlightenment, which occurs in the state of the path of insight, is extremely certain, because it is free from doubt, since it is based on the knowledge of the ultimate.

original: gnas pa nyid ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dag gis so //
translated: It is based on the first stage, because it is based on the first stage.

original: sems bskyed ba de ni sa dang por chud pa yin no //
analyzed: sems bskyed ba de ni sa dang por chud pa yin no //
translated: The generation of the thought is the entry into the first stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos chen po rnams skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir rgyu'i don gyi dbyings yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos chen po rnams skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir rgyu'i don gyi dbyings yin no //
translated: It is the realm of the cause, because it is the seed that is the cause for the arising of the great qualities of a Buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas @21b pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas @21b pa'o ;
translated: For this very reason, it is called great.

original: / yang zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: / yang zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Again means another explanation.

original: chos kyi dbyings la che ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la che ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realm of the Dharma is great.

original: la zhes bya bas ni yul dang yul can gyi dngos por ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: la zhes bya bas ni yul dang yul can gyi dngos por ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “great” indicates the state of being the object and subject.

original: sngar ni bye brag bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: sngar ni bye brag bsdu ba ste /
translated: Previously, the inclusion of the distinctions was explained,

original: sems bskyed ba nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pas ;
analyzed: sems bskyed ba nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pas ;
translated: because the generation of the resolve itself is the reason for the arising of the dharmas with and without impurity.

original: chos kyi dbyings su bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained as the realm of the Dharma.

original: da ni khyad par du brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis zag pa med pa dag kho na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: da ni khyad par du brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis zag pa med pa dag kho na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin te /
translated: Now, by the power of the desire to express the distinction, only the dharmas without impurity are the qualities of a Buddha,

original: dper na srid sgrub gzhu thogs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na srid sgrub gzhu thogs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as it is said that Arjuna is the wielder of the bow.

original: de dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos dbyings bdag med pa gnyis te//
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos dbyings bdag med pa gnyis te//
translated: The cause of those is the reality realm, which is the non-self of both persons and phenomena.

original: de'i yul can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The cognition that has that as its object is also called that.

original: rgyas pa nyid kyi rgyu ston par byed de so so'i skye bo la sogs pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa nyid kyi rgyu ston par byed de so so'i skye bo la sogs pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: It shows the cause of its expansion: any other cognition that observes suchness, such as that of an ordinary being, etc.

original: so so'i skye bo'i ni thos pa'i gnas skabs na kun rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i ni thos pa'i gnas skabs na kun rdzogs pa'o //
translated: That of an ordinary being is complete in the stage of hearing.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That of a śrāvaka, etc. is known to be the observation of suchness.

original: de rnams pas shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams pas shin tu mchog tu gyur pa ni /
translated: It is superior to those

original: sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antidote to the two obstructions, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ba'i rnam par dag pa nyed chos zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ba'i rnam par dag pa nyed chos zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: It should be understood as the Dharma that is conducive to purification, but not as the purification itself that is the Dharma.

original: de ni theg pa chen po'i gsung rab nyid bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po'i gsung rab nyid bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: It is the Dharma because it is the essence of the teaching of the Great Vehicle.
