original: de nyid rigs kyi don gyis na dbyings te gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de'i rigs dang dbyings yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rigs kyi don gyis na dbyings te gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de'i rigs dang dbyings yin no //
translated: That itself is the realm in the sense of a class, because that from which something is born is its class and realm.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i don mnyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis chos des yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa de'i yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i don mnyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis chos des yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa de'i yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the stage that is to be purified by that reality is called the stage of the generation of the resolve, because the mind is purified by the process of listening to and reflecting on that reality.

original: 'di la rgyal ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyal ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The word “victorious” is to be supplied in the compound “stage of the generation of the resolve.

original: rgyas pa ni mdo la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i bye brag gis mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni mdo la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i bye brag gis mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” It is extensive because it is infinite, due to the infinite variety of the sūtras, etc.

original: yang dge ba'i don gyis bsod nams kyi rnam grangs nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang dge ba'i don gyis bsod nams kyi rnam grangs nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, it is shown to be a synonym of merit in the sense of virtue.

original: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: Here, the word “realm” means “cause.

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni bshad ma thag pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni bshad ma thag pa kho nar zad do //
translated: ” The analysis of the compound is just as was explained previously.

original: rgyas pa ni bskal pa du mar bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni bskal pa du mar bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is extensive because it is accomplished over many eons.

original: 'dis ni 'di bskal pa du mas bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams kyis bskyed pa nyid du bstan to //🔽mi rtag pa 'dus byas sdug @22a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di bskal pa du mas bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams kyis bskyed pa nyid du bstan to // mi rtag pa 'dus byas sdug @22a * //
translated: This shows that it is generated by the merit that is achieved over many eons.

original: bsngal yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: bsngal yid du 'ong ba /
translated: The impermanent is the cause of the formation of suffering.🔽The pleasant is the cause of the formation of the agreeable.

original: 'grub pa skye ba nyid kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa skye ba nyid kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The agreeable is the cause of the formation of birth.

original: der shin tu rnam par nges pa ste /
analyzed: der shin tu rnam par nges pa ste /
translated: It is very certain that

original: mdo las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: the Sūtra teaches this with the words: “up to the end of the realm of space.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: de nyid slob dpon gyis nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid slob dpon gyis nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: The Master has taught: “It is like space.”

original: zhes bstan te 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' go phye ba'i sgo nas des bskyed pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis kyang zad par mi 'gyur ba ltar sems bskyed pa 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan te 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' go phye ba'i sgo nas des bskyed pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis kyang zad par mi 'gyur ba ltar sems bskyed pa 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as space is not exhausted by the various kinds of forms that are generated in it, so also this generation of the thought is not exhausted.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: de ni zag pa med pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gnas la /
translated: It is the cause of natural outcome, because it is the projecting cause of the mirror-like intuition that is uncontaminated.

original: de dag kyang sems can mthar thug par yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba ji srid par rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can mthar thug par yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba ji srid par rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, they are applied for as long as cyclic existence lasts, by the power of their dedication to the ultimate of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, the Tathagata is called the “cause of the concordance.”

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu bskyed nas ldog gi rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu dag skyes na ches shin tu rgyas par 'gyur bas de ltar na 'di 'bras bu mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu bskyed nas ldog gi rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu dag skyes na ches shin tu rgyas par 'gyur bas de ltar na 'di 'bras bu mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no
translated: The cause of the ripening of karma is terminated after it has produced its result. But the cause of the concordance increases more and more after it has produced its result. Thus, it is said that this cause is inexhaustible, because its result is inexhaustible, and it extends to the end of space.

original: // phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs ba'i dus so //
analyzed: // phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs ba'i dus so //
translated: The end of the future is the future time.

original: de'i mu ni mthas gtugs pa ste de rnam par 'chad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mu ni mthas gtugs pa ste de rnam par 'chad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The limit of that is the end of that. Nirvana is the termination of that.

original: de'i thug ba ni gzhol ba ste /
analyzed: de'i thug ba ni gzhol ba ste /
translated: The end of that is the descent to that.

original: de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems bskyed ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems bskyed ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The generation of the thought is so called because it causes the attainment of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis 'dir sdug pa smos pa dang 'grub pa smos pa ma mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis 'dir sdug pa smos pa dang 'grub pa smos pa ma mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the Master did not mention the pleasant or the established here.

original: rtag pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mi sdug pa dang ldan pas rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir dang / de thob pas 'di rgyu'i dngos po yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mi sdug pa dang ldan pas rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir dang / de thob pas 'di rgyu'i dngos po yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eternal nirvana is not to be eliminated by being associated with the unpleasant, and because it is the cause of attaining it, but not its producer.

original: shin tu rnam par nges pa 'di gnyis kyis ni rim bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa brjod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par nges pa 'di gnyis kyis ni rim bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa brjod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: By these two very certainties, the perfection of the knowledge and abandonment of the Bhagavat should be seen as described.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: go rims bzhin du 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams dang / 'dus ma byas mya ngan las 'das pa smos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams dang / 'dus ma byas mya ngan las 'das pa smos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the qualities of the nature of the conditioned and the unconditioned nirvana are mentioned, respectively.

original: rtag pa'i rgyu nyid shin tu rnam par nges par brjod ma thag pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa tsam zhig thob par bshad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rgyu nyid shin tu rnam par nges par brjod ma thag pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa tsam zhig thob par bshad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of permanence has just been stated with complete certainty, but it is said that one merely attains nirvana, not a special nirvana.

original: 'dis ni gcig kho nar @22b mya ngan las 'da' ba bkag ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig kho nar @22b mya ngan las 'da' ba bkag ste /
translated: This refutes that there is only one nirvana,

original: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one takes up birth in samsara for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pas 'di brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhum pa med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pas 'di brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhum pa med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is the entry into the stage of wisdom of those in the past, present, and future, it is called “undeterred” in order to demonstrate that it is the cause of undertaking great effort.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Correct accomplishment is the result.

original: 'jig rten na yang gang las 'bru rnams skye ba de zhing zhes bya bas de bzhin du 'dir yang 'di dag la 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'bru 'bras bur gnas pas na ye shes kyis 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gang las 'bru rnams skye ba de zhing zhes bya bas de bzhin du 'dir yang 'di dag la 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'bru 'bras bur gnas pas na ye shes kyis 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: In the world, that from which grains are produced is called a field. In the same way, here, these are fields because the grain of the Tathāgata’s wisdom is produced from them.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: so so skye bo'i mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The characteristic of an ordinary person is the non-acquisition of the noble dharmas.

original: sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas /
analyzed: sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas /
translated: When the path of seeing arises on the first stage,

original: de dang bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dang bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin te /
translated: it is incompatible with that, because it is separated from it.

original: 'di skad du byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained as follows: “Having transcended the stage of the foolish ordinary person. ”

original: gnyis pa la ni dge ba bcu bsten pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa de las bzlog pa log par sgrub pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni dge ba bcu bsten pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa de las bzlog pa log par sgrub pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: On the second stage, one is correctly engaged because one relies on the ten wholesome actions. The opposite of that, wrong practice, is incompatible.

original: gsum pa la ni de ches phyug pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa la sogs pa'i don snang ba brjod pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa brjed pa zhes bya ba mun pa'i tshul can nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni de ches phyug pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa la sogs pa'i don snang ba brjod pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa brjed pa zhes bya ba mun pa'i tshul can nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: In the third, it is said that the object of hearing, etc. is illuminated by the light of the Dharma, and the opposite of that is the darkness of forgetfulness.

original: bzhi pa la ni gang 'di 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag par g-yo ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni gang 'di 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag par g-yo ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: In the fourth, it is said that the object of hearing, etc. is free from the agitation that is preceded by the afflicted view of the self, etc.

original: de dang bral bar brjod pa'i phyir de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral bar brjod pa'i phyir de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the agitation that is preceded by the afflicted view of the self.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni dang po kho na la spangs so zhes bstan ba'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni dang po kho na la spangs so zhes bstan ba'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa zhes smos te /
translated: The word “innate” is mentioned in order to show that the imaginary is abandoned from the very beginning.

original: de skad du gsum pa las rnam par brtags pa'i lta ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta bas byas pa'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas spangs pa kho na'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du gsum pa las rnam par brtags pa'i lta ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta bas byas pa'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas spangs pa kho na'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, in the third verse, it is said that the bonds created by the view are already abandoned, from the perspective of the imaginary view.

original: de la phra ba'i rnam pa ni dge bal sogs pa'i sems la yang de dang mi 'gal bar dus thams cad du gnas pas brtag dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la phra ba'i rnam pa ni dge bal sogs pa'i sems la yang de dang mi 'gal bar dus thams cad du gnas pas brtag dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Subtle is difficult to discern because it exists at all times without contradicting virtuous minds and so on.

original: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba la sogs pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba la sogs pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus attachment to self, pride in self and so on definitely exist because they are concomitant with virtuous minds and so forth when they arise.

original: rnam par brtags pa ni de lta ma yin bas rags pa yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa can @23a * //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni de lta ma yin bas rags pa yin te / nyon mongs pa can @23a * //
translated: The opposite of that is coarse.

original: gyi yid du byed cing de skye ba'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gyi yid du byed cing de skye ba'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The afflicted mind is coarse because it is afflicted and it is generating because it generates the seeds that produce it.

original: rang gi yid la byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yid la byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is its own is the foundation consciousness because the other is described as the mind that is its own.

original: 'di ltar gzhan ni de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de'i brjod pas bsgos pa'i brjod pa'i yid la byed ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan ni de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de'i brjod pas bsgos pa'i brjod pa'i yid la byed ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus another is described as the mind that is its own because it is conditioned by that foundation consciousness and because it is imbued with the expression of that foundation consciousness.

original: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa nyid kyis brtag dka' ba nyid de /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa nyid kyis brtag dka' ba nyid de /
translated: Moreover, it is difficult to discern because the object and aspect are not fully differentiated.

original: de la dmigs pas kyang phra ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pas kyang phra ba yin no //
translated: It is subtle because it is the object of that.

original: ring du song ba nyid ni bzhi pa'i bar du rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du song ba nyid ni bzhi pa'i bar du rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is far-reaching because it is connected with the fourth.

original: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyi sa phra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyi sa phra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, subtlety should be understood as having three causes.

original: lnga pa la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nus kyang thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi don bya bar gnas pa'i phyir theg pa dman bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nus kyang thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi don bya bar gnas pa'i phyir theg pa dman bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: On the fifth, the inferior vehicle's parinirvana is a counteragent to the bodhisattva's parinirvana, because he is able to attain parinirvana, but remains in order to act for the sake of sentient beings through skill in means.

original: drug pa la ni snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba mi 'dor ba'i phyir chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phal cher mtshan ma kun du 'byung
analyzed: drug pa la ni snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba mi 'dor ba'i phyir chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phal cher mtshan ma kun du 'byung
translated: Most of the rest of the text teaches the arising of few signs.

original: ba nyung bar bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ba nyung bar bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The arising of coarse signs is the counteragent to that.

original: bdun pa la ni de ma spangs par lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mtshan ma dang bral ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun pa la ni de ma spangs par lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mtshan ma dang bral ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the seventh, the practice of signlessness is taught, as it says, “Without abandoning that, one enters into the signless activities of body, speech, and mind.”

original: mtshan ma chung du kun du 'byung ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma chung du kun du 'byung ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The arising of subtle signs is the counteragent to that.

original: brgyad pa la ni rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i gru bo che zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma med par spyod pa la yang rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar brjod pa'i phyir mngon bar 'du byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i gru bo che zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma med par spyod pa la yang rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar brjod pa'i phyir mngon bar 'du byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: On the eighth, the obstacle is the over-exertion in the signless, because it is said that one is free from all effort in the practice of the signless.

original: dgu pa la ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa yin pas sems can gyi don la mngon bar 'du mi byed pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //🔽bcu pa la ni gsang ba la sogs pa'i chos thams cad snang bas chos thams cad la dbang thob pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa yin pas sems can gyi don la mngon bar 'du mi byed pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no // bcu pa la ni gsang ba la sogs pa'i chos thams cad snang bas chos thams cad la dbang thob pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: On the ninth, the obstacle is the non-exertion in the benefit of sentient beings, because one has attained the correct discriminations.

original: de la dbang ma thob pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang ma thob pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: On the tenth, the obstacle is the non-attainment of power, because it is said that one attains power over all dharmas through the appearance of all dharmas such as the secret and so on.

original: sa 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo @23b las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo @23b las shes par bya'o //
translated: The definitions, functions, counteragents, and antidotes of these stages should be understood from the Arya-Samdhinirmocana-sutra.

original: de la mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs bcu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs bcu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The second state is called arbuda.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽like a lump of curd,

original: phyi rol spris mar chags la /
analyzed: phyi rol spris mar chags la /
translated: or like a lump of dough.

original: nang rlan te mar 'dug pa ni nur nur po yin no //
analyzed: nang rlan te mar 'dug pa ni nur nur po yin no //
translated: The third state is called peśin.🔽The embryo is like a piece of meat,🔽or like a lump of flesh.🔽The fourth state is called ghana.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,

original: phyi nang gnyis ka khad de chags la sha'i dngos por ma red pa ni mer mer po yin no //
analyzed: phyi nang gnyis ka khad de chags la sha'i dngos por ma red pa ni mer mer po yin no //
translated: or like a lump of dough.

original: rnyol rnyol por 'dug pa ni nyol nyol po yin no //
analyzed: rnyol rnyol por 'dug pa ni nyol nyol po yin no //
translated: The fifth state is called praśākhā.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The sixth state is called major and minor parts.

original: shar gyur cing mnan bzod pa ni sha mkhrang ba yin no //
analyzed: shar gyur cing mnan bzod pa ni sha mkhrang ba yin no //
translated: The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The seventh state is called hair and body hair,🔽nails and skin.🔽The eighth state is called the sense faculties.🔽The ninth state is called the perfection of the sense faculties.🔽The tenth state is called the perfection of the body.

original: sha skyes pa dang ldan pas yan lag gi mtshan ma dod pa ni lugs dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sha skyes pa dang ldan pas yan lag gi mtshan ma dod pa ni lugs dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The eleventh state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The twelfth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The thirteenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The fourteenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,

original: de nas mngal na gnas pa de phyis mi'am /
analyzed: de nas mngal na gnas pa de phyis mi'am /
translated: or like a lump of dough.🔽The fifteenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The sixteenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The seventeenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,

original: dud 'gro la sogs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur ba'i sngon rol srid pa'i gzugs nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni rang bzhin dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro la sogs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur ba'i sngon rol srid pa'i gzugs nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni rang bzhin dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: or like a lump of dough.🔽The eighteenth state is called the embryo.

original: de nyid 'gyur zhing ldog pas 'gul ba ni las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'gyur zhing ldog pas 'gul ba ni las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The nineteenth state is called the embryo.🔽The embryo is like a lump of flesh,🔽or like a lump of dough.🔽The twentieth state is called the embryo.🔽The

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs ni rnam par phye ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs ni rnam par phye ba kho nar zad do //
translated: The state of the complete body is only the analysis.

original: chen po gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid de go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid de go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three greatnesses are cause, effect, and essence, respectively.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: O sons of the Victor, etc. What is the negation, “not seen,” in this passage?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag mi gsung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam zhes bya ba'i yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag mi gsung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam zhes bya ba'i yin no //
translated: It is the buddha-field of the buddhas who do not teach these ten bodhisattva stages.

original: rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad las byang ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad las byang ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: O sons of the Victor, etc. The Blessed Buddhas are those who have overcome all evil.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽'tshe byed nye bar 'gro ba la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis / 'tshe byed nye bar 'gro ba la //
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“Those who have gone to the place of harm

original: gang dag zag zad thob pa dag //
analyzed: gang dag zag zad thob pa dag //
translated: and have attained the destruction of the pollutants,

original: rgyal ba nga 'drar shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba nga 'drar shes par bya //
translated: they should be known as victors like me.

original: sdig pa'i chos las nga rgyal bas //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos las nga rgyal bas //
translated: I have overcome the evil dharmas.

original: de bas nyer 'gro nga rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de bas nyer 'gro nga rgyal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who goes to the lower realms is the one who is proud.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the one who goes to the end is the victor.

original: rgyas par byed pas na sras te /
analyzed: rgyas par byed pas na sras te /
translated: The one who expands is the son.🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / bu yis 'jig rten las rgyal byed //
analyzed: smras pa / bu yis 'jig rten las rgyal byed //
translated: The son conquers the world.

original: tsha bo yis ni kun dga' 'thob //🔽yang tsha yis ni mtho ris kyi //
analyzed: tsha bo yis ni kun dga' 'thob // yang tsha yis ni mtho ris kyi //
translated: The grandson obtains joy.🔽The great grandson

original: 'jig rten du ni mchod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten du ni mchod par 'gyur //
translated: is worshipped in the world of the gods.

original: 'di gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which is born from something is of its class.

original: 'di ltar rgyal ba rnams lam las skye bas lam ni rgyal ba rnams kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal ba rnams lam las skye bas lam ni rgyal ba rnams kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the victors are born from the path, the path is called the class of the victors.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pa lam de 'dod ba rnams kyis kyang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal nas sangs rgyas kyi rigs de @24a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pa lam de 'dod ba rnams kyis kyang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal nas sangs rgyas kyi rigs de @24a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who has begun striving conquers the path by means of his desire, and having conquered the adverse side, he expands the class of the victors.

original: rgyas par byed /
analyzed: rgyas par byed /
translated: He makes it grow and he makes it faultless.

original: skyon med par byed pas na rgyal ba rnams kyi chos las skyes pa'i sras dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: skyon med par byed pas na rgyal ba rnams kyi chos las skyes pa'i sras dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the sons who are born from the Dharma of the victors are called the sons of the victors.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The word “he” refers to the teaching.

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “Where?” means “in the explanation.”

original: de la zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la sogs pha ni 'di skad du ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la sogs pha ni 'di skad du ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The text of the verses spoken by the Buddha, etc., is presented as follows.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams la las 'di lta ma yin bar yang 'byung ba snang ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams la las 'di lta ma yin bar yang 'byung ba snang ste /
translated: It is seen that these verses appear in a form other than that in the sutra.

original: don dang tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa nyid nas gsungs pa ma yin bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dang tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa nyid nas gsungs pa ma yin bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they were not spoken because they are not perfect in meaning and phrasing.

original: bdag gis ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i gzhung ma nyams pa yid ches pa'i lung las 'ongs pa gang yin ba de'i don rnam par phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i gzhung ma nyams pa yid ches pa'i lung las 'ongs pa gang yin ba de'i don rnam par phye ba yin gyi /
translated: I have analyzed the meaning of those verses that were spoken by the Buddha, whose text is not corrupted, and which come from a reliable source.

original: de lta bas na la la las 'di lta ma yin par 'byung ba mthong nas ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du rnam par phye'o zhes de snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na la la las 'di lta ma yin par 'byung ba mthong nas ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du rnam par phye'o zhes de snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not think that when one sees that these verses appear in a form other than that in the sutra, the analysis is to be made according to that form.

original: gzhung de ni nyams pas yin gyi 'di kho na yang dag pa yin no zhes cha gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung de ni nyams pas yin gyi 'di kho na yang dag pa yin no zhes cha gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The text is corrupt, he says, but this is the correct reading.

original: zhal nas gsungs pa'i gzhung ma nyams pa gang gis shes pa zhal nas gsungs pa'i don dang tshig 'bru shes pa bdag gi bla ma rnams kyis don de dmigs pa de nyid gzhung yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa'i gzhung ma nyams pa gang gis shes pa zhal nas gsungs pa'i don dang tshig 'bru shes pa bdag gi bla ma rnams kyis don de dmigs pa de nyid gzhung yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The text of the scriptures is not corrupt, but the meaning and the words of the scriptures are known by my gurus, who say, That very object is the text.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi gzhi de las byung zhing skyes pa'i 'du shes kyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi gzhi de las byung zhing skyes pa'i 'du shes kyi gnyen po ste /
translated: The knowledge that has suchness as its object is the antidote to the discriminations that arise from the basis of the afflicted discriminations, because it is signless.

original: de ni dran pa dang ye shes ldan zhes bya ba 'di las ye shes smos pas ston to //
analyzed: de ni dran pa dang ye shes ldan zhes bya ba 'di las ye shes smos pas ston to //
translated: The phrase endowed with mindfulness and knowledge shows that knowledge is meant here.

original: 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid yin pa dang / lkog tu gyur la don du gnyer ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid yin pa dang / lkog tu gyur la don du gnyer ba nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase fearless shows that it is the ascertainment of realization and the pursuit of the hidden meaning.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: chos mthong ba dang lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba ni mi 'jigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu rtogs pa ston pas 'di dag gi rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid kyang bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: chos mthong ba dang lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba ni mi 'jigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu rtogs pa ston pas 'di dag gi rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid kyang bshad pa yin la /
translated: One who sees the Dharma and is not in the dark about it and is intent on it is fearless.🔽This shows that fearlessness is the cause of realization. Thus, it is also explained that their realization is certainty.

original: lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'jigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'jigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: And since being intent on something that is not in the dark is fearlessness, this very statement that they are fearless shows that they are intent on what is not in the dark.

original: de la rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid dang / lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba nyid gnyis la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid dang / lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba nyid gnyis la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between certainty in realization and being intent on what is not in the dark?

original: rtogs pa cung zad @24b tsam thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa cung zad @24b tsam thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have attained a little realization,

original: bden pa mthong ba ni rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni rtogs pa la rnam par nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: those who see the truth have certainty in realization.

original: rtogs pa thob pa dag gis kyang bstan par bya ba'i don mngon sum du ma byas shing de dag de la don du gnyer ba yin na bstan par bya ba'i don ma rtogs pa de lta bu dag la yang bshad pa 'bras bu med pa nyid pas de
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pa dag gis kyang bstan par bya ba'i don mngon sum du ma byas shing de dag de la don du gnyer ba yin na bstan par bya ba'i don ma rtogs pa de lta bu dag la yang bshad pa 'bras bu med pa nyid pas de
translated: Even those who have attained realization, if they have not directly perceived the meaning to be taught and are seeking that meaning, then for them the teaching would be fruitless, since they have not realized the meaning to be taught.

original: bstsal ba'i phyir 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bstsal ba'i phyir 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that, the phrase “without destruction” is stated.

original: lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba dag ni bstan pa 'di'i don mngon sum du byas pa rnams yin na /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur la don du gnyer ba dag ni bstan pa 'di'i don mngon sum du byas pa rnams yin na /
translated: If those who are not hidden and are seeking are those who have directly perceived the meaning of this teaching,

original: gzhan ci zhig gi phyir mi bshad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ci zhig gi phyir mi bshad ces bya'o //
translated: then why not teach it to others?

original: lhag ma rnams ni slob dpon nyid kyis rnam par phye bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni slob dpon nyid kyis rnam par phye bar zad do //
translated: The rest of the text is divided up by the Master himself.

original: spang bar bya min zhes bya ba'i gnod par mi byed pas spang bar bya min te zos na gnod par mi byed cing legs par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spang bar bya min zhes bya ba'i gnod par mi byed pas spang bar bya min te zos na gnod par mi byed cing legs par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Not to be rejected” means not to be rejected because it does not harm. It means that when eaten, it does not harm and is well digested.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dor bar bya ba ma yin bas na spang bar bya min te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dor bar bya ba ma yin bas na spang bar bya min te /
translated: In another way, it is not to be rejected because it is not to be discarded.

original: za ba na 'bad de mi dgos kyi shin tu 'jam pa'i phyir rang ltor 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: za ba na 'bad de mi dgos kyi shin tu 'jam pa'i phyir rang ltor 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When one eats it, one does not need to make an effort, because it is very smooth and goes down by itself.

original: 'dis na mi 'chi ba 'am 'di yod na mi 'chi bas na bdud rtsi yin la 'dis kyang dam pa'i chos kyi srog 'dor bar mi byed la 'di yod na yang dam pa'i chos kyi srog 'dor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: 'dis na mi 'chi ba 'am 'di yod na mi 'chi bas na bdud rtsi yin la 'dis kyang dam pa'i chos kyi srog 'dor bar mi byed la 'di yod na yang dam pa'i chos kyi srog 'dor bar mi byed de /
translated: It is an ambrosia because one does not die without it, or because one does not die if one has it. It is also an ambrosia because it does not destroy the life of the holy Dharma, and because the life of the holy Dharma is not destroyed if it exists.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pas chos kyis ku 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pas chos kyis ku 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one obtains the Dharma by means of the transmutation of the basis.

original: dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shin tu dka' ba nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shin tu dka' ba nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to understand by nature, and therefore it is very difficult.

original: ma 'dris pas dka' ba nyid ni zag pa med pa yin pas ma goms pa'i phyir te goms pa ni 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'dris pas dka' ba nyid ni zag pa med pa yin pas ma goms pa'i phyir te goms pa ni 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is difficult because it is not familiar, because it is not cultivated, since it is not defiled. Cultivation is called familiarity.

original: sa dag nyid rgyu yin te thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dag nyid rgyu yin te thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stages are the cause, because they are the sign of the bodhisattvas understanding, through the stages of hearing, etc.

original: de dag bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin ji ltar na rnam par dbye ba la de rnams bstan ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin ji ltar na rnam par dbye ba la de rnams bstan ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How are they called the teaching in the analysis?

original: tha dad par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are asserted to be different.

original: mdo ston pa zhes bya ba dang 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mdo ston pa zhes bya ba dang 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
translated: Since they are like the statement “the teaching of the sūtra,” there is no fault.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that the knowledge derived from meditation is the direct perception of a yogi and is nonconceptual,🔽how is it called the word of conceptual thought?

original: de ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i sgrar brjod ce na de'i phyir khams gsum ba'i zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i sgrar brjod ce na de'i phyir khams gsum ba'i zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “of the three realms.”

original: don dam pa'i dngos po mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa dag @25a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos po mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa dag @25a * //
translated: Since it does not manifest ultimate things, all that is contaminated is conceptual thought.

original: yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sems kyi bye brag gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung dum bstan pa yang yongs su ma spangs bar kun tu 'byung bas kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir phra bas
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sems kyi bye brag gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung dum bstan pa yang yongs su ma spangs bar kun tu 'byung bas kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir phra bas
translated: The phrase “any specific type of mind that arises from karmic maturation” means that it is difficult to understand because it arises from karmic maturation that is virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate, and has not been completely abandoned.

original: na / gang gi yang zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: na / gang gi yang zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus, the word “any” is used.

original: de ltar don zab pa de ji ltar kun rdzob tu brjod nus pa de bzhin du bshad kyang dka' zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar don zab pa de ji ltar kun rdzob tu brjod nus pa de bzhin du bshad kyang dka' zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In this way, it is difficult to explain how that profound meaning can be expressed in conventional terms.

original: ji ltar de bzhin du bshad kyang dka' zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin du bshad kyang dka' zhe na /
translated: How is it difficult to explain it in that way?

original: 'gro bas thos na der ni rmongs par 'gyur /🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro bas thos na der ni rmongs par 'gyur / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If beings hear it, they will be confused about it.

original: gzhung 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig 'di kho na la 'jug pa'i ched yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig 'di kho na la 'jug pa'i ched yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This passage should be understood as being for the purpose of introducing the very words of the verse.

original: brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis ba men ri mor bris pa bzhin du /
analyzed: brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis ba men ri mor bris pa bzhin du /
translated: Like a drawing of a cow in conventional terms,

original: don dam pa'i dngos por brjod par zad na byis pa rnams ni de kho na ma rtogs pa'i phyir sgra tsam la so sor 'brang zhing sgras brjod par bya ba kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas na don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin🔽pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por brjod par zad na byis pa rnams ni de kho na ma rtogs pa'i phyir sgra tsam la so sor 'brang zhing sgras brjod par bya ba kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas na don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is only said to be an ultimate entity, but because fools do not understand thatness, they are attached to the mere sound of words and to the imagined entity expressed by the words. Therefore, they are said to “grasp the meaning literally.”

original: gang du sems rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'bru skye ba'i gnas yin pa nyid kyi phyir nang gi phung po rnams ni sa yin te /
analyzed: gang du sems rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'bru skye ba'i gnas yin pa nyid kyi phyir nang gi phung po rnams ni sa yin te /
translated: The statement “where the mind is fully matured” means that the internal aggregates are the earth because they are the place where the seed of the mind is planted.

original: 'bru'i sa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bru'i sa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the earth of a seed.

original: gang du de rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni sems zin pa dang / ma zin pa dag la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med par rgyu bas chos thams cad sa yin te /
analyzed: gang du de rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni sems zin pa dang / ma zin pa dag la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med par rgyu bas chos thams cad sa yin te /
translated: The statement “where it moves” means that all phenomena are the earth because they are the place where the mind moves without obstruction, since they are the objects of both the mind that is focused and the mind that is not focused.

original: rgyal po'i sa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i sa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the earth of a king.

original: yang na 'dis ni sngar bshad pa bas mchog yin pa kho nar ston te /
analyzed: yang na 'dis ni sngar bshad pa bas mchog yin pa kho nar ston te /
translated: Or, this verse teaches that the earth is superior to what was previously explained.

original: 'di ltar shas rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pas spyod pa'i skabs nas skyes nas thob pas kyang rnam par 'phrul pa chen por 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar shas rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pas spyod pa'i skabs nas skyes nas thob pas kyang rnam par 'phrul pa chen por 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, even one who has attained the stage of generation by means of devotion to the perfection of wisdom will have a great magical creation.

original: lo ma ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshig zur gyis na lo ma la rlung snang ngo zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: lo ma ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshig zur gyis na lo ma la rlung snang ngo zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: As for the line, “like a leaf, etc.,” is it not explained that the wind appears in the leaf?

original: de ni mi rung ste rlung ni rtag tu rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi spyod yul ma yin pas g-yo ba'i las kyis zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste rlung ni rtag tu rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi spyod yul ma yin pas g-yo ba'i las kyis zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That is not correct, because the wind is always inferred, and since it is not an object of the eye, it is said that “the action of movement is seen.”

original: 'di skad du kho bo cag gis lo ma la mig gis dmigs par bshad pa ni ma yin gyi 'gul ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyis yang dag par ma thong ste yod par rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: 'di skad du kho bo cag gis lo ma la mig gis dmigs par bshad pa ni ma yin gyi 'gul ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyis yang dag par ma thong ste yod par rtogs par nus so //
translated: We do not explain that the leaf is observed by the eye, but it can be understood that it exists by means of the evidence of movement, etc.

original: nam mkha' 'ba' zhig la ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'ba' zhig la ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is not the case with mere space.

original: bshad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'i @25b phyir la /
analyzed: bshad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'i @25b phyir la /
translated: This is explained because it is included in the imagined nature.

original: brjod du med pa ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid dang glo bur ba nyid yin no //🔽gal te ji ltar yang mnyan par nus pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du ye mnyen par mi nus pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang sra ba rnam pa gnyis kyis sems brten por gzhag par byas shing chos ngo bo nyid
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid dang glo bur ba nyid yin no // gal te ji ltar yang mnyan par nus pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du ye mnyen par mi nus pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang sra ba rnam pa gnyis kyis sems brten por gzhag par byas shing chos ngo bo nyid
translated: Since the inexpressible is the perfected nature, it is not its intrinsic nature and is adventitious.

original: med par yang shes par byas nas mnyan par nus so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mnyan par srid do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: med par yang shes par byas nas mnyan par nus so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mnyan par srid do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: If it is possible to listen in any way, then it is possible to listen, since it is said that it is not impossible to listen, but rather one should listen after one has made ones mind stable through the two kinds of firmness and after one has understood that the nature of things is essenceless.

original: 'dun pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i lung thos pa thob par byed pa'i thabs gang yin pa de la kun tu rtogs pa ste rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dun pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i lung thos pa thob par byed pa'i thabs gang yin pa de la kun tu rtogs pa ste rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: The purity of aspiration and so on refers to the means of attaining the desired scriptural instruction. It is due to the aspiration for realization, i.e. the desire for realization,

original: thos pa mang po rnyed par 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas 'dun pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa mang po rnyed par 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas 'dun pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: but not due to the desire to obtain much hearing, hence the purity of aspiration.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: The sutra states:

original: kun du rtog pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: They are thoroughly purified in their imagination.🔽They have thoroughly purified the imagination that is the method for obtaining unmistaken learning, which is characterized by desire.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their search.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their practice.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their attainment.

original: 'di dag la kun du rtog pa phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa 'thob pa'i thabs 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag la kun du rtog pa phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa 'thob pa'i thabs 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa yod pas so //
translated: They are thoroughly purified in their teaching.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their patience.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from pride.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from deceit.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from hypocrisy.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from regret.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from laziness.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from distraction.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from obscurations.

original: de de ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa don du gnyer ba ni de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa mnyes par byed pas na kun du tshol ba yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa don du gnyer ba ni de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa mnyes par byed pas na kun du tshol ba yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from attachment.

original: de yang mdo las spyad par bya ba shin tu spyad pa zhes gsungs ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang mdo las spyad par bya ba shin tu spyad pa zhes gsungs ba yin te /
translated: They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from anger.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from ignorance.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from pride.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from deceit.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from hypocrisy.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from regret.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from laziness.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from distraction.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from obscurations.

original: 'di dag la spyad par bya ba ste de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa la sogs ba'i mtshan nyid shin tu spyad pa yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag la spyad par bya ba ste de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa la sogs ba'i mtshan nyid shin tu spyad pa yod pas so //
translated: They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from attachment.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from anger.🔽They are thoroughly purified in their freedom from ignorance.

original: de de ltar mnyes par byed pa lhur len pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag las thos pa phyin ci ma log cing ma nyams la de yang mang po yin gyi nyung du ma yin pa de yun ring por te lo 'ga' yang ma yin la tshe
analyzed: de de ltar mnyes par byed pa lhur len pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag las thos pa phyin ci ma log cing ma nyams la de yang mang po yin gyi nyung du ma yin pa de yun ring por te lo 'ga' yang ma yin la tshe
translated: When they are intent on pleasing them in that way, they retain the unmistaken and unimpaired learning from those spiritual masters, and that learning is extensive, not scanty, for a long time, not for a few years or a few lifetimes.

original: 'ga' yang ma yin par 'dzin pas na thos pa 'dzin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin par 'dzin pas na thos pa 'dzin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, their retention of learning is pure.

original: de yang 'ga' las ma yin gyi tshad med pa dag las 'ongs pas na mang po yin la yun ring por yang yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽des de ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa bzung nas smon lam gyi khyad par gyis skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'ga' las ma yin gyi tshad med pa dag las 'ongs pas na mang po yin la yun ring por yang yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // des de ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa bzung nas smon lam gyi khyad par gyis skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that it is extensive because it comes from immeasurable sources, not just a few, and it is long-lasting.🔽Having thus retained unmistaken learning, they attain a special memory that correctly retains all the learning, because they have attained a special rebirth through the power of their special prayers.

original: yang dag pa'i thos pa ma lus pa yang dag par gzung ba'i dran pa'i khyad par 'thob pas na skye bas @26a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thos pa ma lus pa yang dag par gzung ba'i dran pa'i khyad par 'thob pas na skye bas @26a * //
translated: Thus, their memory is special because it is born from that special cause.

original: 'thob pa yongs su dag pas kyang lung yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa yongs su dag pas kyang lung yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because his attainment is pure, his scriptural instruction is pure.

original: de yang mdo las tshogs shin tu bstsags pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang mdo las tshogs shin tu bstsags pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: And that is stated in the sutra as the extremely great accumulation of collections.

original: snga ma ni thos pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su bshad do //
analyzed: snga ma ni thos pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su bshad do //
translated: The former is explained as the accumulation of knowledge because it holds what is heard.

original: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: This is the accumulation of merit.

original: de de ltar thos pa yongs su rdzogs shing nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa ni lus dang sems dben pa'i phyir 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan du ma dang ldan pa yin zhing
analyzed: de de ltar thos pa yongs su rdzogs shing nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa ni lus dang sems dben pa'i phyir 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan du ma dang ldan pa yin zhing
translated: Thus, when he has completed his learning and is in the state of the factors conducive to penetration, he is in the path of application of realization and possesses many good qualities such as fewness of wishes, because his body and mind are isolated.

original: lung rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i phyir sbyor ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i phyir sbyor ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because his scriptural instruction is pure in every way, it is called the pure application.

original: de yang mdo las yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mdo las yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And that is stated in the sutra as possessing immeasurable good qualities.

original: de mthong ba'i lam la zhugs na the tshom spong ba'i phyir yid gnyis dang nim nur dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa yongs su dag pa brjod do //
analyzed: de mthong ba'i lam la zhugs na the tshom spong ba'i phyir yid gnyis dang nim nur dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa yongs su dag pa brjod do //
translated: If one enters the path of insight, one is free from doubt, and so one is said to be free from uncertainty and hesitation. This shows the purity of realization.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas rab tu mi rgyu ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu 'dis nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar byas nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas rab tu mi rgyu ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o // de'i 'og tu 'dis nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar byas nas /
translated: After that, on the path of cultivation, one is free from afflictions because one has abandoned all afflictions characterized as passions and secondary passions. Therefore, one is said to be pure in being unmoved by afflictions.

original: mya ngan las 'das par nus kyang snying rje dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir theg pa dman pa las 'das te byang chub sems dpa'i thob pa khyad par can 'dod pas na chog par 'dzin pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par nus kyang snying rje dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir theg pa dman pa las 'das te byang chub sems dpa'i thob pa khyad par can 'dod pas na chog par 'dzin pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, one is able to abandon all afflictions and attain nirvana. But because one possesses compassion and wisdom, one transcends the lesser vehicle and seeks the special attainment of the bodhisattva. Therefore, one is said to be pure in contentment.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: This is stated in a sutra:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa la rab tu gnas pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa la rab tu gnas pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that they are well-established in superior intention and in aspiration.

original: 'di la theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di la theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa yod pas so //
translated: They are well-established in the Great Vehicle in terms of both intention and aspiration.

original: de lta bu de dag rang gi shes pa'i stobs kho nas rang byung gi ye shes kyi phyir gdams ngag sbyin par byed pas na gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la gzhan la rag ma lus pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag rang gi shes pa'i stobs kho nas rang byung gi ye shes kyi phyir gdams ngag sbyin par byed pas na gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la gzhan la rag ma lus pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they give instruction in the knowledge of the self-arisen ones by the power of their own knowledge alone, they are said to be completely pure in the instruction and subsequent instruction that does not depend on others.

original: snod du mi 'gyur ba skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i rna lam du grag na gzhan la mi mdzes par spong ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ston to //
analyzed: snod du mi 'gyur ba skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i rna lam du grag na gzhan la mi mdzes par spong ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ston to //
translated: If it is heard by those who are not vessels, who are unfortunate, it is said that it is not beautiful for others, and so on, showing the faults of abandoning it.

original: rab mchog ces bya ba ni yan lag ste bod pa'i tshig logs shig yin no //
analyzed: rab mchog ces bya ba ni yan lag ste bod pa'i tshig logs shig yin no //
translated: The word excellent is a part, a separate Tibetan word.

original: dam pa dri ma med pa'i blo nyid ni slob dpon gyis rnam par dbye ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dam pa dri ma med pa'i blo nyid ni slob dpon gyis rnam par dbye ba mdzad de /
translated: The master himself analyzes the highest, stainless mind.

original: de la nyan thos @26b la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la nyan thos @26b la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the highest, superior to the śrāvakas and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa nyid de /🔽zag pa med pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa nyid de / zag pa med pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: It is uncontaminated because it is free from all the contaminations of action and the addictions.

original: brjod na legs brjod spobs pa mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: brjod na legs brjod spobs pa mtha' yas pa //
translated: When it is spoken, it is well-spoken, and its eloquence is inexhaustible.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni dris pa lung bstan pa la rigs pa'i spobs pa nyid zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni dris pa lung bstan pa la rigs pa'i spobs pa nyid zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on this verse is: “The very rational eloquence in answering questions is inexhaustible.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: legs brjod ni 'grel pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: legs brjod ni 'grel pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is rational because it is a commentary, that is, a good explanation.

original: mtha' yas pa ni zad mi shes pa ste mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni zad mi shes pa ste mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is endless, that is, it has no limit.

original: brjod na zhes bya ba ni bskyod na ste /
analyzed: brjod na zhes bya ba ni bskyod na ste /
translated: “When it is spoken” means when it is spoken by the Buddha.

original: gzhan dag gis glengs shing dris na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis glengs shing dris na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “When it is spoken by others” means when it is spoken by others, that is, when it is asked by others.

original: 'di yang dris pa lung bstan pa la zhes bya bas 'grel to //
analyzed: 'di yang dris pa lung bstan pa la zhes bya bas 'grel to //
translated: This is also commented on by “in answering questions.”

original: snyan zhing mchog tu byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis yi ge phun sum tshogs pa nyid ji ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: snyan zhing mchog tu byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis yi ge phun sum tshogs pa nyid ji ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: How does this verse show the excellence of the letter?

original: smras pa / snyan pa dang rgya che ba nyid gnyis te de la snyan pa nyid kyi phyir snyan pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / snyan pa dang rgya che ba nyid gnyis te de la snyan pa nyid kyi phyir snyan pa'o //
translated: He says: Two: pleasantness and vastness. Among them, it is pleasant because of pleasantness.

original: rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir mchog tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir mchog tu byung ba'o //
translated: It is supreme because of vastness.

original: dam pa'i don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin par go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: dam pa'i don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin par go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The phrase “endowed with the highest meaning” is easy to understand as the perfection of meaning, so it is not explained.

original: dran pa kho na la 'dir gnas kyi bye brag gis dran pa dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyis zhes rnam pa gnyis su bstan te stobs bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa kho na la 'dir gnas kyi bye brag gis dran pa dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyis zhes rnam pa gnyis su bstan te stobs bzhin no //
translated: Here, mindfulness is taught as two types, retention and recollection, due to the distinction of its state, just as faith is taught as two types, strength and confidence, due to the distinction of its state.

original: 'di ltar dad pa'i dbang po de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa'i dbang po de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal te /
translated: Thus, that very faculty of faith is called strength when it becomes supreme, having definitely conquered its opposing factors.

original: mchog gi gnas skabs su gyur pa la stobs zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang dran pa de nyid nyan pa'i gnas skabs na ni len pa yin la /
analyzed: mchog gi gnas skabs su gyur pa la stobs zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang dran pa de nyid nyan pa'i gnas skabs na ni len pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, here also, that very mindfulness is retention when it is in the state of listening.

original: dus phyis mchog tu gyur pa ni 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis mchog tu gyur pa ni 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Later, when it becomes supreme, it is recollection.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na yul gyi bye brag gis de skad bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na yul gyi bye brag gis de skad bshad de /
translated: Alternatively, this is explained due to the distinction of object.

original: sgra mi brjed pa ni len pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra mi brjed pa ni len pa yin la /
translated: The retention of the words is the reception.

original: don mi brjed pa ni 'dzin pa yin pas thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs dag dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: don mi brjed pa ni 'dzin pa yin pas thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs dag dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The retention of the meaning is the retention. Thus, they are in the order of the occasions of hearing and reflection.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs gang dag yin pa de dag 'thob pa ni rtogs pa dang rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs gang dag yin pa de dag 'thob pa ni rtogs pa dang rnyed pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of the powers of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who possess the ten powers, is the realization and acquisition of those powers.

original: bsam pa rnam dag pa zhes bya ba ni sa la 'jug pa ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam dag pa zhes bya ba ni sa la 'jug pa ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The purity of aspiration is the teaching of entry into the stages.

original: de nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the realization.🔽The expression of the meaning by these or in these is the analysis. The analysis is the nature of the teaching.🔽The explanation by the correct knowledges is what is meant by “one should explain.”🔽One should explain the meaning by these or in these.

original: 'di dag gis sam 'di dag tu don rnam par brjod pas ni rnam 'byed ni bstan pa'i bdag nyid dag kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis sam 'di dag tu don rnam par brjod pas ni rnam 'byed ni bstan pa'i bdag nyid dag kho na yin te /
translated: The expression of the meaning by these or in these is the analysis. The analysis is the nature of the teaching.

original: de so so yang dag par rig pas bshad pa mdzod ces bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rgyags pas na cho @27a * //
analyzed: de so so yang dag par rig pas bshad pa mdzod ces bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rgyags pas na cho @27a * //
translated: The explanation by the correct knowledges is what is meant by “one should explain.”

original: rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams kho na la sems kun du chags shing chos la nan tan mi byed pas na chos la gus par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams kho na la sems kun du chags shing chos la nan tan mi byed pas na chos la gus par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that pride causes one not to respect the Dharma, because one is attached to one's own qualities of caste, body, etc., and does not practice the Dharma.

original: nga rgyal gyis ni de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa'i phyir chos smra ba la gus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni de ston par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa'i phyir chos smra ba la gus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Egoism causes one not to respect the teacher of the Dharma, because one does not honor the spiritual teacher who teaches the Dharma.

original: lta bas ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs par log par rtog pas yang dag pa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta bas ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs par log par rtog pas yang dag pa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: View causes one to fall from the true path, because of false imagination of self, mine, etc.🔽Doubt causes one not to be interested in the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha, because one doubts, thinking, Is it so or not?

original: the tshom ni 'di ci lta yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za bas sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams la yon tan gyi sgo nas mi mos te tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni go rims bzhin du 'di dag gi gnyen po spyod pa
analyzed: the tshom ni 'di ci lta yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za bas sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams la yon tan gyi sgo nas mi mos te tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni go rims bzhin du 'di dag gi gnyen po spyod pa
translated: This verse shows their antidotes, respectively, as practice,

original: dang / spangs pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: dang / spangs pa dag bstan to //
translated: and abandonment.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bde gshegs rnams kyi bgrod pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: bde gshegs rnams kyi bgrod pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: The Sugatas' path is enlightenment.

original: 'gro bar bya ba'i don gyis bgrod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba'i don gyis bgrod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path because it is what is to be traversed, in the sense of being the goal to be reached.🔽Since the stages that are its causes are to be explained and taught, therefore,

original: de ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa rnams bshad pa dang bstan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa rnams bshad pa dang bstan par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that,🔽he says:

original: sa'i khyad par ma lus pa thams cad bshad par mdzod //🔽ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par ma lus pa thams cad bshad par mdzod // ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Please explain all the stages without exception.

original: de la byin rlabs mdzad ces bya ba ni yan lag go ;
analyzed: de la byin rlabs mdzad ces bya ba ni yan lag go ;
translated: The consecration is the branch.

original: / tshig gzhan dag gis byin gyi rlabs bye brag tu 'byed pas na nye ba'i yan lag go ;
analyzed: / tshig gzhan dag gis byin gyi rlabs bye brag tu 'byed pas na nye ba'i yan lag go ;
translated: The other words are the sub-branches, because they distinguish the consecration.

original: / sangs rgyas rnams kyis de la byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad pas na gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas rnams kyis de la byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad pas na gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: Since the Buddhas have consecrated it, it is the perfection of the basis.

original: 'bras bu chos smra ba yin pas na 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu chos smra ba yin pas na 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Since the Dharma preacher is the result, it is the perfection of the result.

original: lha dang mi'i nang na mchog rnams kyis //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i nang na mchog rnams kyis //
translated: The best of gods and humans

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir khyad par du bya bar smos pas nye ba'i yan lag kyang yin la mi mnyam mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi khyad par la ltos nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir khyad par du bya bar smos pas nye ba'i yan lag kyang yin la mi mnyam mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi khyad par la ltos nas /
translated: This is said to be the special basis, the special branch, and the special nature of the bodhisattva vow.🔽🔽The special basis is the special support.🔽

original: khyad par gyi gzhi nyid du gtso po yin pa'i phyir yan lag kyang yin no //🔽mi mnyam mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma ni de'i nye ba'i yan lag kho na yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi nyid du gtso po yin pa'i phyir yan lag kyang yin no // mi mnyam mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma ni de'i nye ba'i yan lag kho na yin te /
translated: The term “distinctive” is mentioned in order to indicate the excellence of the basis. Thus, it is a subsidiary component. And, since it is the primary basis of the distinctive attributes that are mentioned in the phrase “the equality of the unequaled,” etc., it is also a component.

original: tshig gzhan gyis bstan pa nyid kyis rtag tu khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gzhan gyis bstan pa nyid kyis rtag tu khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining attributes, beginning with the phrase “the equality of the unequaled,” etc., are only subsidiary components because they are always of the nature of distinctions, as indicated by the other terms.

original: tshogs rab mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni ris bdun zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tshogs rab mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni ris bdun zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase “the infinite collection” is explained by the term “seven types.”

original: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa ma gtogs so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa ma gtogs so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam pa bdun no //
translated: The seven types of prātimokṣa restraint are the seven types of restraint that are included in the class of the prātimokṣa vows, with the exception of the restraint of the one-day vow.

original: rgya mtsho'i chu nang gnas @27b gyur tam //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu nang gnas @27b gyur tam //
translated: The phrase “the ocean of beings” is explained by the term “the water of the ocean.”

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro'i mi khom par skyes pa de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro'i mi khom par skyes pa de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This shows that one is born in the unfavorable states of bad migrations.

original: bde 'gro'i mi khom par skyes pa ni 'od gsal ba la sogs pa rnams te mes 'jig pa'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i mi khom par skyes pa ni 'od gsal ba la sogs pa rnams te mes 'jig pa'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is born in the unfavorable states of good migrations, such as in the clear light, because it is the peak of the conflagration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽bsregs pa'i bskal tshe 'phos na yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / bsregs pa'i bskal tshe 'phos na yang /
translated: For this very reason,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: even if one is transferred to another world system at the time of the conflagration,🔽one is still not liberated.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The fifth verse is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: chos 'di thos pa las skyes pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams med pa'i phyir dang / spong ba'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa skye bas de dag gis 'di thos kyang ma thos pa kho na yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di thos pa las skyes pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams med pa'i phyir dang / spong ba'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa skye bas de dag gis 'di thos kyang ma thos pa kho na yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
