translated: Because they lack the merit of faith, etc., born from hearing this teaching, and because they reject it, they generate demerit. Therefore, even though they hear this teaching, it is as if they do not hear it at all.

original: phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas zhes bya ba la phyogs bcur rnam par blta bas ni phyogs thams cad na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dran par byas nas de dag gi mthus bshad par bya'i rang gi mthus ni ma yin no zhes nga rgyal med pa🔽nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas zhes bya ba la phyogs bcur rnam par blta bas ni phyogs thams cad na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dran par byas nas de dag gi mthus bshad par bya'i rang gi mthus ni ma yin no zhes nga rgyal med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Having looked in the ten directions means that by looking in the ten directions, one recollects the Buddhas dwelling in all directions, and by their power one teaches, not by one's own power. This shows one's lack of pride.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par blta bas ni nye 'khon med ba nyid du thams cad sems snyoms par bshad par bya'i gcig gi ngor bltas na ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par blta bas ni nye 'khon med ba nyid du thams cad sems snyoms par bshad par bya'i gcig gi ngor bltas na ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Looking at the entire circle of the assembly means that one teaches with an impartial mind toward all, not just with regard to one person. This shows one's lack of bias.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phra ba nyid rnam pa gnyis ni gong du shes dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i dus na phra ba nyid dang / thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phra ba nyid rnam pa gnyis ni gong du shes dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i dus na phra ba nyid dang / thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, in this verse, subtlety is twofold: the subtlety explained above in difficult to know, etc., and the subtlety explained in the section on attainment.

original: tshig gis brjod du med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gis brjod du med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is also called that because it is the object of the nondiscriminated.

original: 'di ltar de la dmigs pa de la yin la de yang brjod pa'i yul thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la dmigs pa de la yin la de yang brjod pa'i yul thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is the object of that nondiscriminated, and that is beyond all objects of expression.

original: ci de zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa la brten pa nyid gcig gam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci de zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa la brten pa nyid gcig gam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Is that one only in dependence on the engaged?

original: 'jug pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur bas 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur bas 'khor ba yin no //
translated: The engaged is the cycle of saṃsāra, and that is the cycle of saṃsāra.

original: smras pa ma yin te dus gsum rnams las grol ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te dus gsum rnams las grol ba yin no //
translated: No, it is not, because it is free from the three times.

original: ye shes 'dus byas skad cig ma ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ye shes 'dus byas skad cig ma ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t that wisdom momentary and conditioned, and not dependently arisen?

original: de ji ltar dus gsum rnams las grol zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dus gsum rnams las grol zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said to be free from the three times?

original: de'i phyir gnas gyur pa rtag pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te gnas gyur ba rtag pa de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de 'di'i gnas yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas gyur pa rtag pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te gnas gyur ba rtag pa de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de 'di'i gnas yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is because it is based on the permanence of the transformation of the support. The support is called that because it is the support of that permanence of the transformation, which is characterized by suchness.

original: de la don ni dus gsum las grol ba'i gnas can la dus gsum las grol ba zhes bya @28a * //
analyzed: de la don ni dus gsum las grol ba'i gnas can la dus gsum las grol ba zhes bya @28a * //
translated: The meaning of that is that the basis that is free from the three times is called “free from the three times.”🔽

original: ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows: The state of liberation from the three times is called “liberation from the three times.”

original: de ni bsam dang zhes bya ba ni bsam pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam dang zhes bya ba ni bsam pa las byung ba'o //
translated: “It is not thought” means that it is not a thought that arises from reflection.

original: sems kyi lam zhes smos pas ni skyes nas thob pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi lam zhes smos pas ni skyes nas thob pa ston par byed de /
translated: The phrase “the path of mind” indicates that it is obtained from birth.

original: de ni skye ba dang dus mnyam pa kho nar 'thob pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bas lam du gyur pa'i phyir de sems kyang yin la gzhan dag gi lam yang yin pas sems kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang dus mnyam pa kho nar 'thob pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bas lam du gyur pa'i phyir de sems kyang yin la gzhan dag gi lam yang yin pas sems kyi lam mo //
translated: It is the path of mind because it is the path of all other minds, since it is obtained only at the time of birth and precedes all that is obtained from practice.

original: yang na sems rnams kyi lam yin pas so //🔽sems kyis mi shes zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la yin pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sems rnams kyi lam yin pas so // sems kyis mi shes zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la yin pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the path of minds.🔽“It is not known by the mind” means that it is not the object of the ear consciousness.

original: yid kyi bsam pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi bsam pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: “It is not the intention of the mind” means that it is not the object of the mind consciousness.

original: nyes dmigs rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te chos thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes sgra ji bzhin kho nar bzung na de'i tshe theg pa chen po'i
analyzed: nyes dmigs rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te chos thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes sgra ji bzhin kho nar bzung na de'i tshe theg pa chen po'i
translated: If one takes literally that all phenomena are primordially peaceful, unproduced, and naturally liberated, then one will lack🔽faith in the Mahayana teachings and the great interest and devotion that one has at first will be lost.

original: chos la dad pa dang / dang po dang mos pa chen po gang yin pa de med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mos pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la dad pa dang / dang po dang mos pa chen po gang yin pa de med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mos pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no //
translated: This is the disadvantage of not being a fit vessel for devotion.

original: des na de thob par bya ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa rtsol ba gang yin pa de yang nyams par 'gyur bas rtsol ba nyams par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de thob par bya ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa rtsol ba gang yin pa de yang nyams par 'gyur bas rtsol ba nyams par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since one will also lose the effort one has begun to attain that, this is the disadvantage of losing effort.

original: de'i phyir sgra ji bzhin kho nar bzung na gzhan la yang bslus par 'gyur zhing ston pa la yang skur pa 'debs pa dang / chos kyang spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ji bzhin kho nar bzung na gzhan la yang bslus par 'gyur zhing ston pa la yang skur pa 'debs pa dang / chos kyang spong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, if one takes literally, one will deceive others, deprecate the Teacher, and abandon the Dharma.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dag ston par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dag ston par byed de /
translated: The term “sphere of mind” indicates the consciousnesses that arise from hearing and so on.

original: de dag ni sems kyang yin la gzhan gyi spyod yul yang yin pa'i phyir de dag gis rdzogs par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni sems kyang yin la gzhan gyi spyod yul yang yin pa'i phyir de dag gis rdzogs par mi byed kyi /
translated: They are not perfected by those consciousnesses, because they are also mind and also the sphere of others.🔽They are perfected by the wisdom of pure thought.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i ye shes kyis rdzogs par byed do zhes gdams ngag gis rdzogs par gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i ye shes kyis rdzogs par byed do zhes gdams ngag gis rdzogs par gsungs so //
translated: This is the instruction on perfection.

original: gdams ngag ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: gdams ngag ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The instruction is this very enumeration of dharmas.

original: de'i spyod yul ni yul te /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni yul te /
translated: Its sphere is the object.

original: des brjod par bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des brjod par bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that understands the meaning expressed by that.

original: de ni rang gis rig kyang brjod par mi nus pas dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gis rig kyang brjod par mi nus pas dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the object because it is not able to be expressed, even though it is self-cognizant.

original: tshogs bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid yi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir @28b tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid yi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir @28b tshogs pa yin te /
translated: In the line “having gathered the accumulations,” morality is the basis because it is the foundation of all good qualities.

original: tshul khrims kyang legs par byas tshogs kyang legs par byas pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang legs par byas tshogs kyang legs par byas pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Also, morality is well-practiced and the accumulation of virtue is well-practiced.

original: 'khor ni de nyid kyi yin bar bzung ste /
analyzed: 'khor ni de nyid kyi yin bar bzung ste /
translated: The retinue is taken to be the same as that.

original: de yang tshul khrims kyi rgyu yang dag ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du shes bzhin dang / gzhan yang de'i rgyu gang yin ba'o ;
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims kyi rgyu yang dag ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du shes bzhin dang / gzhan yang de'i rgyu gang yin ba'o ;
translated: Also, the cause of morality is correct thought and so on, and likewise, introspection and whatever else is its cause.

original: /'di skad du tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi 'khor legs bar byas shing dag pas na tshogs bstsags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: /'di skad du tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi 'khor legs bar byas shing dag pas na tshogs bstsags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained as follows: “Morality and the retinue of morality are well-practiced and pure, and thus the accumulation is gathered.”

original: mdo las ni tshogs shin tu bstsags pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las ni tshogs shin tu bstsags pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the sutra, it is taught that the accumulation is extremely well-gathered.

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang legs par byas 'khor kyang legs par byas pa zhes 'dir yang gong ma bzhin du tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang legs par byas 'khor kyang legs par byas pa zhes 'dir yang gong ma bzhin du tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Also, concentration is well-practiced and the retinue is well-practiced.

original: de'i 'khor ni lus dben pa dang sems dben pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / chog shes pa dang / 'tsho ba dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor na yan lag ji snyed kyis ting nge 'dzin skye ba des thams cad 'khor yin no ;
analyzed: de'i 'khor ni lus dben pa dang sems dben pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / chog shes pa dang / 'tsho ba dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor na yan lag ji snyed kyis ting nge 'dzin skye ba des thams cad 'khor yin no ;
translated: Its retinue is whatever factors, in brief, give rise to concentration, such as physical seclusion, mental seclusion, fewness of wishes, contentment, pure livelihood and so on.

original: / ting nge 'dzin la ji ltar spyod pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: / ting nge 'dzin la ji ltar spyod pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How does one engage in concentration?🔽The reason is indicated:

original: dmigs pa la spyod pa'i skabs yin pas zhes gtan tshigs ston par byed de /
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod pa'i skabs yin pas zhes gtan tshigs ston par byed de /
translated: because it is the occasion for engaging in the object.🔽Since one engages in and enters the object, the domain, it is the occasion for that.

original: dmigs pa yul la spyod cing rgyu la 'jug pas de'i skabs yin bas de la ltos nas de rgyu mtshan du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa yul la spyod cing rgyu la 'jug pas de'i skabs yin bas de la ltos nas de rgyu mtshan du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: In dependence on that, it is the reason for that.

original: 'di ltar de'i dbang gis na sems dmigs pa gzhan dag bor nas gcig kho na la spyod cing rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dbang gis na sems dmigs pa gzhan dag bor nas gcig kho na la spyod cing rgyu'o //
translated: In this way, by its power, the mind engages in and enters only one object, abandoning other objects.

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: In the sutras,

original: spyod pa shin tu spyad pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: spyod pa shin tu spyad pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: it is called “thoroughly engaging in engagement.”

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / gong ma tshogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'khor la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / gong ma tshogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'khor la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: The terms “conduct” and “assembly” should be understood as referring to the retinue,

original: grong gi nye 'khor la grong gi sgrar brjod pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grong gi nye 'khor la grong gi sgrar brjod pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: like the term “village” is used for the area around a village.

original: de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams la yun ring mo zhig nas chos kyi rnam grangs du ma mnyen pa'i phyir bsnyen bkur byas pa yin pas bstsags pa ste mdo las sangs rgyas byung ba rnams shin tu bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams la yun ring mo zhig nas chos kyi rnam grangs du ma mnyen pa'i phyir bsnyen bkur byas pa yin pas bstsags pa ste mdo las sangs rgyas byung ba rnams shin tu bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are called “accumulated” because they have served and venerated the buddhas for a long time, for many eons, as stated in the sutra, “They have served and venerated the buddhas who have appeared.”

original: des dag dag las thos nas /
analyzed: des dag dag las thos nas /
translated: Having heard from them,

original: bsam pa las byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams legs par rtog par byed dpyod par byed pas na yongs su bsdus pa bstsal ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa las byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams legs par rtog par byed dpyod par byed pas na yongs su bsdus pa bstsal ba yin te /
translated: they are called “collected” because they properly investigate and analyze the teachings such as the perfections that arise from reflection.

original: mdo las ni chos dkar po shin tu bsdus pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las ni chos dkar po shin tu bsdus pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sutra states that they have “collected virtuous qualities.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang da @29a * //
analyzed: gang da @29a * //
translated: Those who

original: gis bsam pa las byung ba shin tu mchog tu gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa la stsogs pa'i mtshan gyi chos dkar po shin tu yongs su bsdus pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gis bsam pa las byung ba shin tu mchog tu gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa la stsogs pa'i mtshan gyi chos dkar po shin tu yongs su bsdus pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the most excellent of all that arises from thought” is to be connected with the phrase “the most excellent of all virtuous qualities that are characterized by the perfections and so on.”

original: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin kyang yongs su dag /
analyzed: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin kyang yongs su dag /
translated: In this way, he has purified his morality and meditative absorption.

original: sangs rgyas rnams las chos kyi rnam grangs du ma yang thos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams las chos kyi rnam grangs du ma yang thos /
translated: He has also heard many Dharma teachings from the buddhas.🔽He has also gathered his own virtuous qualities and has understood that he is fit to attain realization.🔽He has also received unerring instructions from the buddhas and bodhisattvas in order to enter the levels.

original: rang gi chos dkar po yang bsdus te bdag nyid rtogs pa'i 'os su rung ba khong du chud pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las sa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag yongs su ma nos nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa sbyor ba'i sgom pa la sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba bstsags pa🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi chos dkar po yang bsdus te bdag nyid rtogs pa'i 'os su rung ba khong du chud pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las sa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag yongs su ma nos nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa sbyor ba'i sgom pa la sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba bstsags pa🔽zhes bya ste /
translated: He is said to “possess the accumulation that is embraced by the practice of meditation that is included in the factors that contribute to enlightenment and that is engaged in by one who is engaged in the preparatory stage.”

original: mdo las / dge ba'i bshes gnyen du bzung ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gang dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams shin tu bzung ba 'am /
analyzed: mdo las / dge ba'i bshes gnyen du bzung ba zhes gsungs pa yin no // gang dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams shin tu bzung ba 'am /
translated: “They are held by the spiritual teachers.”

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis shin tu bzung ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis shin tu bzung ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “held by the spiritual teachers”🔽can be analyzed as “held by the spiritual teachers”

original: de dag gi lung nan tan du bsgrubs pas de dag bzung ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi lung nan tan du bsgrubs pas de dag bzung ba yin la /
translated: because they are held by the spiritual teachers through their practice of the precepts.🔽And they are held by the spiritual teachers

original: de nyid kyis de dag gis kyang bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de dag gis kyang bzung ba yin no //
translated: because they are held by the spiritual teachers.

original: de de ltar de dag gis yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin te /
analyzed: de de ltar de dag gis yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin te /
translated: Thus, the spiritual teachers give them the right instruction.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las 'das nas sa dang po la 'jug pas na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las 'das nas sa dang po la 'jug pas na /
translated: Having passed beyond the aids to penetration, they enter the first stage.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstsags pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstsags pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they accumulate the pure thought.

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: The sutra says:

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “They have a pure thought.”

original: de ltar na dang po gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yongs su dag pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na dang po gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yongs su dag pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, the first two show the purity of the bodhisattvas' training in superior morality and superior mind.

original: 'og ma bzhis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su dag pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'og ma bzhis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su dag pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The last four show the purity of their training in superior wisdom.

original: gang gis na de'i gzhi ste /

translated: The phrase in accord with self-originated intuition should be explained as follows: Self-originated intuition is the self-realization of perfect enlightenment not taught by another. It is in accord with that, because it is the abode in accord with its origination.

original: no // sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba zhes bya ba 'di dgrol na /
analyzed: no // sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba zhes bya ba 'di dgrol na /
translated: The instruction in wisdom and knowledge of all the Buddha dharmas is called “seeking.”

original: shes rab dang ye shes dag gi khyad par ni bshad zin par zad do //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes dag gi khyad par ni bshad zin par zad do //
translated: The difference between wisdom and knowledge has already been explained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes gang dag yin pa de'i don du gdams ngag tshol ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes gang dag yin pa de'i don du gdams ngag tshol ba ste /
translated: The instruction in the wisdom and knowledge of all the Buddha dharmas is for the sake of that.

original: de nyid khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag lung tshol ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag lung tshol ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: It is explained as “seeking the instruction of the scriptures” in order to progress to that very [instruction].

original: 'di la dam pa'i chos kyi dbyings gyur pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la dam pa'i chos kyi dbyings gyur pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, it is because there is a transformation of the realm of the true Dharma.

original: de nyid yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: It is taught that this is because it is the principal possessor of good qualities.

original: chos kyi dbyings de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin par byed pas na gtso bo la dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin par byed pas na gtso bo la dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That dharma-dhātu is the cause of all the qualities of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and it is the cause of the arising of the qualities of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gnas pa dad mthar phyin pa'i chen po nyid ni tshig tha ma gnyis po ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rjod par byed pa dag gis bstan te sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dad mthar phyin pa'i chen po nyid ni tshig tha ma gnyis po ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rjod par byed pa dag gis bstan te sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The greatness of the ultimate is shown by the last two phrases, which refer to the perfection of knowledge and abandonment, as explained above.

original: de nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi yon tan yid du 'ong ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu yin skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid par zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi yon tan yid du 'ong ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu yin skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid par zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: This thought of enlightenment is the cause of the arising of the pleasant qualities that are of the nature of knowledge, and it is the producer of those qualities. Therefore, it does not come to an end, for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba la gnas nam mkha' bzhin pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba la gnas nam mkha' bzhin pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the perfection of knowledge, because it is the support for the arising of form, etc., like space.

original: phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The future end is nirvana.

original: der 'bab der gzhol de'i mur thug pa yin pas na spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por brjod pa yin no //🔽dper na bud med 'ga' zhig la /🔽dang por bu yan lag rdzogs pa skye ba'i @31b rgyu mtshan du gyur pa mngal du zhugs te bu chags pa de dang chos mthun par 'di la yang sangs rgyas kyi sku yon tan gyi yan lag rdzogs pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i
analyzed: der 'bab der gzhol de'i mur thug pa yin pas na spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por brjod pa yin no // dper na bud med 'ga' zhig la / dang por bu yan lag rdzogs pa skye ba'i @31b rgyu mtshan du gyur pa mngal du zhugs te bu chags pa de dang chos mthun par 'di la yang sangs rgyas kyi sku yon tan gyi yan lag rdzogs pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i
translated: Since it is the destination, the orientation, and the final goal, it is described as the cause of perfect abandonment.🔽For example, a certain woman is the cause of the birth of a child with perfect limbs, because she conceives and bears the child.

original: sems dang por skye'o //
analyzed: sems dang por skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the first supramundane mind is generated in order to give birth to the body of a buddha, with its limbs of qualities.🔽For example, that child, born into the great lineage of the king, surpasses those of other, lesser lineages.

original: dper na bu de nyid rgyal po'i rgyal rigs chen por skyes shing de las gzhan pa'i rigs dman pa rnams las 'da' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs
analyzed: dper na bu de nyid rgyal po'i rgyal rigs chen por skyes shing de las gzhan pa'i rigs dman pa rnams las 'da' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, born into the lineage of the Tathagata, surpasses🔽the lineages of all other beings.

original: rnams las 'da'o //
analyzed: rnams las 'da'o //
translated: and they transcend the stages.

original: dper na bu de rgyal pos bskyed kyang mi 'dra ba bran mo las skyes na gnad kyi skyon las ni mi 'da'i rigs kyi tha snyad ni pha las 'byung ba'i phyir de rigs las 'das pa zhes ni brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na bu de rgyal pos bskyed kyang mi 'dra ba bran mo las skyes na gnad kyi skyon las ni mi 'da'i rigs kyi tha snyad ni pha las 'byung ba'i phyir de rigs las 'das pa zhes ni brjod pa nyid do //
translated: For example, although a son is born from the king, if he is born from a slave woman, he does not transcend the faults of his mother’s class, but he does transcend the class of his father, because his social status comes from his father.

original: nam zhig 'di rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa thabs rir bab pa las bskyed pa de'i tshe gnad las gyur pa'i skyon smad pa'i ngo bo de las kyang 'da'o //
analyzed: nam zhig 'di rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa thabs rir bab pa las bskyed pa de'i tshe gnad las gyur pa'i skyon smad pa'i ngo bo de las kyang 'da'o //
translated: But when he is born from the king’s chief queen, at the right time, then he transcends even the faults of his mother’s class, which is the basis for contempt.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems de skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems de skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas, because they have given rise to that thought,

original: chos kyi rgyal po sangs rgyas kyis thabs rir bab pa'i btsun mo dam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa las bskyed kyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po sangs rgyas kyis thabs rir bab pa'i btsun mo dam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa las bskyed kyi /
translated: are born from the chief queen, the perfection of wisdom, who is the right method of the Dharma King, the Buddha.

original: theg pa dman pa'i bran mo las ma yin pas gnad kyi skyon thams cad las 'da'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i bran mo las ma yin pas gnad kyi skyon thams cad las 'da'o //
translated: They do not come from the slave woman of the Lesser Vehicle, so they transcend all the faults of their mother’s class.

original: dper na bu de 'gro ba gang du skyes pa des bsdus pa gang nas shi 'phos pa de las 'da' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa 'jig rten pa'i 'gro ba las ni 'das la /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro ba ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus so //
analyzed: dper na bu de 'gro ba gang du skyes pa des bsdus pa gang nas shi 'phos pa de las 'da' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa 'jig rten pa'i 'gro ba las ni 'das la / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro ba ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus so //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, having generated the ultimate thought of awakening, transcends the mundane realm and is included in the supramundane realm.

original: dper na bu de lus rdzogs pa rnyed pa de bzhin du ;
analyzed: dper na bu de lus rdzogs pa rnyed pa de bzhin du ;
translated: For example, a son, having attained a complete body, is able to do the work of a son.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid thob pa'i phyir snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi lus thob bo //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid thob pa'i phyir snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi lus thob bo //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, having attained the reality of a bodhisattva, attains a body that is the nature of compassion.

original: de ji lta zhe na /🔽gzhan gyi dgos pa bdag gi dgos pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na / gzhan gyi dgos pa bdag gi dgos pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How is that?🔽He says, because the purpose of others is his own purpose.

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dgos pa nyid de'i rang gi dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dgos pa nyid de'i rang gi dgos pa yin no //
translated: Because he has attained the equality of self and others, the purpose of others is his own purpose.

original: dper na bu de skyes na gdon mi za bar gnas 'ga' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mthong yang 'khor ba yongs su mi 'dor ba thabs mkhas pa gnas pa'i phyir de
analyzed: dper na bu de skyes na gdon mi za bar gnas 'ga' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mthong yang 'khor ba yongs su mi 'dor ba thabs mkhas pa gnas pa'i phyir de
translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva, because he has compassion, sees the path to nirvana but does not abandon samsara.

original: ni yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi @32a * //
analyzed: ni yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi @32a * //
translated: He does not become defiled again,🔽because he is skilled in means and lives.🔽For example, when that son is born, he is sustained by some means of livelihood.

original: 'gyur ro // dper na bu de btsas nas 'tsho ba 'ga' zhig gis 'tsho bar byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // dper na bu de btsas nas 'tsho ba 'ga' zhig gis 'tsho bar byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva, seeing the three times as equal, is sustained by the wisdom that is endowed with emptiness.

original: dper na bu skyes na rigs dang 'tsham pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'ga' zhig gdon mi za bar yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bu skyes na rigs dang 'tsham pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'ga' zhig gdon mi za bar yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when a son is born, he certainly has some excellence that is appropriate to his family.

original: 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges shing yongs su mi nyams pa la /
analyzed: 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges shing yongs su mi nyams pa la /
translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva’s excellence is that he is certain to be in the lineage of the buddhas and will not regress.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Nirvana is perfect enlightenment.

original: de la gzhol ba ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhol ba ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: To be intent on that is to be intent on just this.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus means

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi mi 'dra ba nyid du yang bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi mi 'dra ba nyid du yang bstan to //
translated: not only is it taught to be just as it was explained, but it is also taught to be unlike that.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, because of being common and uncommon.

original: ji skad du bshad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa yin zhe na /
translated: What was explained?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ma'i mngal du bu chags pa khu chu dang khrag 'dres pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yod pas thun mong ste spyi yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ma'i mngal du bu chags pa khu chu dang khrag 'dres pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yod pas thun mong ste spyi yin no //
translated: The common, general, state of ordinary beings is that the embryo, the mixture of semen and blood, is formed in the mother’s womb. That is also present in bodhisattvas.

original: 'di dag gi mngal du 'jug pa dang po kho nar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag la med pas thun mong ma yin te spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi mngal du 'jug pa dang po kho nar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag la med pas thun mong ma yin te spyi ma yin no //
translated: The uncommon, not general, state of these bodhisattvas is that the first entry into the womb is characterized by the generation of the supramundane mind.

original: de bzhin du rigs las 'das pa la sogs pa la yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs las 'das pa la sogs pa la yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand the common and uncommon in the case of the transcendences and so on.

original: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gnas skabs dang byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gnas skabs dang byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as ninefold, etc. The supreme joy itself is posited as ninefold by way of its intrinsic nature, its occasion, and its action.

original: de la bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs te /
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs te /
translated: Therein, one realizes the four noble truths.

original: dkon mchog gsum la shes nas dad pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ste /🔽dang ba'i mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la shes nas dad pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ste / dang ba'i mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Faith through knowledge of the Three Jewels is its intrinsic nature.🔽It is supreme joy, the highest delight.

original: dga' ba nyid mchog tu dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba nyid mchog tu dga' ba yin te /
translated: Joy itself is supreme joy.

original: dmigs pa chos kyi dbyings la dga' zhing de kho na la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa chos kyi dbyings la dga' zhing de kho na la gnas pa ste /
translated: It is joy in the objective support, the reality realm, and it is the supreme joy because it abides in just that.

original: des na dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supreme joy because it is the cause of that joy.

original: de 'phel bas dga' ba de nyid gong ma gong ma'i gnas skabs dang byed pa'i bye brag gis mchog tu dga' ba lhag ma rnams rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de 'phel bas dga' ba de nyid gong ma gong ma'i gnas skabs dang byed pa'i bye brag gis mchog tu dga' ba lhag ma rnams rig par bya ste /
translated: The remaining supreme joys should be understood by way of their respective occasions and actions, as the increase of that joy.

original: de ltar na bcu tshan 'dis mchog tu dga' ba ci 'dra ba de bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na bcu tshan 'dis mchog tu dga' ba ci 'dra ba de bshad do //
translated: Thus, this set of ten explains what supreme joy is like.

original: da ni de'i dmigs pa de bcu tshan gnyis kyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni de'i dmigs pa de bcu tshan gnyis kyis ston par byed de /
translated: Now, its object is taught by two sets of ten.

original: de la rjes su dran pa dang po dang @32b zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la rjes su dran pa dang po dang @32b zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Among them, the first recollection is of the Buddha, etc.

original: dang po sangs rgyas ni rten gzugs kyi sku dang brten pa yon tan rnams rjes su dran no //
analyzed: dang po sangs rgyas ni rten gzugs kyi sku dang brten pa yon tan rnams rjes su dran no //
translated: The first is the recollection of the Buddha as the support, the form body, and the qualities as the supported.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par phye ste brten pa yon tan rnams 'ba' zhig rjes su dran no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par phye ste brten pa yon tan rnams 'ba' zhig rjes su dran no //
translated: The second is the recollection of the qualities as the supported, distinguished individually.

original: gnyis pa ni de dag gi rigs la ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang de'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de dag gi rigs la ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang de'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The second is the recollection of their lineage, i.e., the bodhisattva and his practice.

original: de gnyis ci'i yul can zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis ci'i yul can zhe na /
translated: What is the object of these two?

original: de dag gi rigs la zhes de gnyis kyi yul ston par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi rigs la zhes de gnyis kyi yul ston par byed do //
translated: The object of these two is taught as “their lineage.”

original: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni skabs su bab pa sangs rgyas dang chos dag ston par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni skabs su bab pa sangs rgyas dang chos dag ston par byed do //
translated: The word “their” refers to the Buddha and Dharma that are the topic at hand.

original: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is in order,

original: 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rjes su dran pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rjes su dran pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the recollection of the Buddha family.

original: chos kyi rigs la rjes su dran pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rigs la rjes su dran pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the recollection of the Dharma family.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni de las skyes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas kyi rigs zhes bya ba de bzhin du chos kyi rigs kyang de dang 'dra ste sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni de las skyes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas kyi rigs zhes bya ba de bzhin du chos kyi rigs kyang de dang 'dra ste sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro
translated: Just as the Buddha family is so called because the Buddhas are born from it, so also the Dharma family is so called because the qualities of the Buddha are born from the bodhisattva practice.

original: // dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad pa brjod par bzhed pa brten dang brten pa tha dad par bstan te /
analyzed: // dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad pa brjod par bzhed pa brten dang brten pa tha dad par bstan te /
translated: Although not actually different, they are described as different, because it is intended to show the difference between the support and the supported.

original: dper na sangs rgyas dang chos rjes su dran pa dag bshad pa ltar 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas dang chos rjes su dran pa dag bshad pa ltar 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the recollections of the Buddha and Dharma were explained, so also are these two.

original: de la spyod pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid yan lag kyang yin te sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa spyir bshad pa dag bye brag gi ngo bor brten pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye ba'i yan lag kyang yin te /
analyzed: de la spyod pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid yan lag kyang yin te sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa spyir bshad pa dag bye brag gi ngo bor brten pa'i phyir ro // nye ba'i yan lag kyang yin te /
translated: Among those, the recollection of the Buddha is both a branch and a proximate branch of the bodhisattva’s way of life. It is a branch because the general explanation of the recollection of the Buddha is based on the specific nature of the bodhisattva’s way of life.

original: rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs pa rnam par dbye bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs pa rnam par dbye bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a proximate branch because the recollection of the Buddha, etc., in the context of purification is to be analyzed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de'i spyod pa la sogs pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid ni sangs rgyas kho na'i rgyu'i gnas skabs rjes su dran pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de'i spyod pa la sogs pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid ni sangs rgyas kho na'i rgyu'i gnas skabs rjes su dran pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha from the bodhisattva and his way of life, etc., should be understood from the recollection of the stage of the cause of the Buddha alone.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang de'i spyod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang de'i spyod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These bodhisattvas and their way of life, etc., should be understood as future.

original: de ni da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ni da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the present object,

original: so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod las phyir log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod las phyir log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because they turn away from the enjoyment of ordinary people.

original: spyad par bya ba yin pas na longs spyod ni yul yin te /
analyzed: spyad par bya ba yin pas na longs spyod ni yul yin te /
translated: Enjoyment is an object because it is to be enjoyed.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go //🔽de dag ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnams lhag par @33a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go // de dag ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnams lhag par @33a * //
translated: It is the five sense pleasures.🔽They are not enjoyed by bodhisattvas in the same way that they are by ordinary people, who are attached to them.

original: chags shing longs spyod pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de lta ma yin pas so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod las phyir log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags shing longs spyod pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de lta ma yin pas so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod las phyir log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to turn away from the enjoyment of ordinary people.🔽Since they are engaged in the buddha stage, they do not enjoy sense objects in the same way as ordinary people.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye ba la zhugs pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du yul rnams la mi spyod pa na longs spyod mi 'dra ba nyid do ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye ba la zhugs pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du yul rnams la mi spyod pa na longs spyod mi 'dra ba nyid do ;
translated: Thus, their enjoyment is different.

original: / byis pa'i sa dang ye shes kyi sa dang ring bar gyur pa dang nye ba dag gis skye bo thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lus 'thob pas na lus 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: / byis pa'i sa dang ye shes kyi sa dang ring bar gyur pa dang nye ba dag gis skye bo thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lus 'thob pas na lus 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The similarity of body is that, by being far from the stage of the foolish and near to the stage of wisdom, one obtains a body such as that of the lord of Jambudvipa, which is superior to all other people.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The dissimilarity of practice and so on is as follows:

original: sgrub pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa ste /
translated: Practice is the conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni phal che'i /
analyzed: de yang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni phal che'i /
translated: Moreover, for ordinary beings it is mostly

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi rang bzhin dag yin la /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi rang bzhin dag yin la /
translated: of the nature of the ten virtuous actions.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa'i ni de las bzlog pa yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin pas sgrub pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa'i ni de las bzlog pa yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin pas sgrub pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: For those who have given rise to the ultimate thought of awakening, it is the opposite, the correct practice. Thus, there is dissimilarity of practice.

original: 'di ltar bu'i grogs ni pha byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar bu'i grogs ni pha byed /
translated: For example, a father acts as a friend to his son,

original: pha'i grogs ni bu byed /🔽rgyal po ni 'bangs rnams kyi grogs byed /
analyzed: pha'i grogs ni bu byed / rgyal po ni 'bangs rnams kyi grogs byed /
translated: and a son acts as a friend to his father.🔽 A king acts as a friend to his subjects,

original: 'bangs rnams kyang rgyal po'i grogs byed kyi /
analyzed: 'bangs rnams kyang rgyal po'i grogs byed kyi /
translated: and the subjects act as friends to the king.

original: 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi grogs byed kyang /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi grogs byed kyang /
translated: He is a friend to all beings,

original: de dag ni de bzhin grogs mi byed pas grogs su gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin grogs mi byed pas grogs su gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: but they are not his friends, so he is unlike them in being a friend.

original: de dag ni sred pa'i bran du gyur ba'i phyir nor bdag gi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni sred pa'i bran du gyur ba'i phyir nor bdag gi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: They are the slaves of craving, so they are under the control of others,

original: 'di ni chos kyi rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: but he is under the control of the Dharma King, so he is unlike them in being under the control of others.

original: de dag ni sdong dum tsher ma la sogs pas yongs su ma dag pa'i yul du skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni sdong dum tsher ma la sogs pas yongs su ma dag pa'i yul du skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: They are born in impure lands, with their stumps and thorns,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bas na yul mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bas na yul mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: but he is born in a pure buddha-field, so he is unlike them in his land.

original: de dag ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: They delight in wrong livelihood,

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'i 'tsho ba la dga' ba yin pas 'tsho ba mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'i 'tsho ba la dga' ba yin pas 'tsho ba mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: but he delights in right livelihood, so he is unlike them in his livelihood.

original: de dag ni phun sum tshogs pa dang 'byor ba ni 'tshe ba mang po dang 'brel ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni phun sum tshogs pa dang 'byor ba ni 'tshe ba mang po dang 'brel ba yin gyi /
translated: These perfections and resources are associated with many dangers.

original: 'di'i 'byor ba ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral zhing rgya che ba yin pas phun sum tshogs pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i 'byor ba ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral zhing rgya che ba yin pas phun sum tshogs pa mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: But the resources of the bodhisattva are free from all dangers and are vast. Thus, they are not the same as the perfections.

original: 'jig pa 'di dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsum zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba med pas 'jig pa dang tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'khor gyi @33b nang du bag tshab ste go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang sems kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'di dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsum zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba med pas 'jig pa dang tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'khor gyi @33b nang du bag tshab ste go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang sems kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
translated: The verse states that the bodhisattva is not afraid of the three dangers. The three dangers are danger of livelihood, danger of verse, and danger of assembly.

original: de la dang po ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang / stan la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir lus kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang / stan la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir lus kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
translated: The first danger is based on the experience of the body, because it comes through the bodily means of clothing, alms, bedding, seats, and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni pha rol po rnams kyi tshig gis log par sun 'byin pa'i phyir dang / mi snyan pa brjod cing kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ngag gis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni pha rol po rnams kyi tshig gis log par sun 'byin pa'i phyir dang / mi snyan pa brjod cing kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ngag gis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
translated: The second is verbal experience, because it is verbal abuse of others and because it is verbal expression of what is unpleasant.

original: gsum pa ni nang gi kun du rmongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir sems kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nang gi kun du rmongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir sems kyis myong ba'i rten can yin no //
translated: The third is mental experience, because it is motivated by internal delusion.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dag ste /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dag ste /
translated: The third and fourth are fear of death and fear of miserable realms.

original: lus kyi rten can yin no //🔽lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus te /
analyzed: lus kyi rten can yin no // lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus te /
translated: They are bodily experience.🔽The body is the body with its sense faculties.

original: rten dang brten pa tha dad pa'i ngo bor lus thams cad lus yin no //🔽de yang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i bye brag gis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa tha dad pa'i ngo bor lus thams cad lus yin no // de yang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i bye brag gis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The body is the support and the supported.🔽They are desirable or undesirable, respectively, because of the distinction between happy and miserable realms.

original: de dag dang 'bral ba dang phrad pa la ltos nas bsod nams ma byas pa las 'jigs pa 'di gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang 'bral ba dang phrad pa la ltos nas bsod nams ma byas pa las 'jigs pa 'di gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: These two fears arise in relation to the fear of not obtaining what one wants and the fear of obtaining what one does not want.

original: log pa'i shes bya zhes bya ba ni shes bya log pa bdag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i shes bya zhes bya ba ni shes bya log pa bdag la sogs pa ste /
translated: The so-called false objects of knowledge are the false objects of knowledge, such as the self, etc.

original: der 'du shes pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the latter is the adherence to the notion of self, etc.

original: de la 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'i gzhi yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'i gzhi yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The basis of fear of lack of livelihood is the notion of self, etc.

original: 'chi bas 'jigs pa'i gzhi yang kyi hud bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bas 'jigs pa'i gzhi yang kyi hud bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: The basis of fear of death is the thought, “Alas! I will cease to exist!”

original: de bzhin du tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa kho na yin te /
translated: In the same way, the basis of fear of disrepute is the notion of self, etc.

original: 'di gsum 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gsum 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa ni /
translated: The reason for these three is just that.

original: mdo nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the sutra itself.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid ni ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa dag gi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid ni ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa dag gi gzhi yin te /
translated: The basis of fear of bad destinies and fear of embarrassment in the assembly is the weakness of the roots of virtue.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as stated in the sutra.

original: lus 'gyur ba'i bye brag can zhes bya ba ni spu zing zhes byed pa lus 'gyur ba yin par bstan to zhes bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba'i bye brag can zhes bya ba ni spu zing zhes byed pa lus 'gyur ba yin par bstan to zhes bstod par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “with a particular bodily transformation” means that the body hair stands on end.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsnyen bkur byed na yang dag pa'i lam thos pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' @34a * //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsnyen bkur byed na yang dag pa'i lam thos pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' @34a * //
translated: When one serves spiritual teachers, etc., and serves spiritual teachers, one hears the true path and does not fall into the two extremes of imputation and negation.

original: gnyis su mi ltung bas na chud mi za ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis su mi ltung bas na chud mi za ba zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one’s service is not wasted,

original: mthar ltung ba ni chud zos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar ltung ba ni chud zos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because falling into an extreme is a waste.

original: gnas pa med pa ni 'dir bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ni 'dir bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa yin te /
translated: Absence of attachment here means not relishing the taste of the meditative absorptions.

original: 'jig rten na yang gnas pa dang / zhen pa dang thogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gnas pa dang / zhen pa dang thogs pa ni /
translated: In the world, attachment, clinging, and obstruction

original: chags pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: chags pa kho na yin la /
translated: are synonyms for passion.

original: thogs pa med par spyod pa ni gnas pa med par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par spyod pa ni gnas pa med par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is free of obstruction is said to be free of attachment.

original: chags pa med pa stsogs pa dang mngon par dga' ba med pa stsogs pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa zhes bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: chags pa med pa stsogs pa dang mngon par dga' ba med pa stsogs pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa zhes bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: The absence of attachment and so on and the absence of delight and so on correspond respectively to what is obtained and what is not obtained.

original: mdo las ni tshig gnyis kyis rnyed pa la sogs pa da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba med pas gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las ni tshig gnyis kyis rnyed pa la sogs pa da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba med pas gsungs so //
translated: In the sutra, the absence of attachment to present acquisition and so on and the absence of delight in future acquisition and so on are taught by two phrases.

original: gang mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for what is desired and so on,

original: gang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: what is desired is the state of omniscience.

original: tshig dang pos bstan to //
analyzed: tshig dang pos bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the first phrase.

original: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa nyid du rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa nyid du rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: What kind of state is taught by the second phrase, which refers to the nature of the ten powers and so on.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: How it is desired is by means of the method whose nature is the purification of the transcendences, by which one obtains that state of omniscience.

original: 'thob pa ste tshig gsum pas ston to //
analyzed: 'thob pa ste tshig gsum pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by the third phrase.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chags pa med pa tshol ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chags pa med pa tshol ba ste /
translated: The perfections are sought without attachment.

original: chags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis non pa'i phyir ma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis non pa'i phyir ma dag pa yin no //
translated: Attachment is impure because it is overcome by adverse elements.

original: gang dang ci 'dra ba dang / ji ltar zhes bya ba de dag la brten nas go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa 'dod pa la sogs pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: gang dang ci 'dra ba dang / ji ltar zhes bya ba de dag la brten nas go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa 'dod pa la sogs pa gsum yin no //
translated: The three, i.e., the desire for the stage of omniscience, etc., are respectively based on what, what kind, and how.

original: gsum pa ste /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa ste / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The third, i.e.,

original: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis rnam par 'byed do //
translated: the desire for omniscience through the purification of the perfections, is described as the avoidance of adverse elements by the remaining phrases.

original: gnyen po kun du spyod pa ni don gyis go bar zad do //
analyzed: gnyen po kun du spyod pa ni don gyis go bar zad do //
translated: The practice of the antidote is self-evident.

original: des ni zlog par byed cing zhes bya ba ni rgyu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des ni zlog par byed cing zhes bya ba ni rgyu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: By that, one turns away indicates the cause.

original: khas mi len zhes bya ba ni g-yo yin te /
analyzed: khas mi len zhes bya ba ni g-yo yin te /
translated: Not accepting is deceit.

original: 'di gnyis ni dri ma gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni dri ma gcig yin no //
translated: These two are one defilement.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin mi byed pa ni dri ma gnyis te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin mi byed pa ni dri ma gnyis te /
translated: There are two stains: not doing what one has said, and not being skilled in means.

original: dri ma 'di gnyis ni mdo'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan te //
analyzed: dri ma 'di gnyis ni mdo'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan te //
translated: These two stains are indicated by two phrases of the sutra.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu dag ni brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin par gnas pa dang / @34b 'du 'dzi la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu dag ni brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin par gnas pa dang / @34b 'du 'dzi la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The causes of distraction of mind should be understood as such things as forgetfulness, lack of vigilance, and delight in worldly activities.🔽This is called the station of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the methods of the stages.

original: 'di ni sa bshad pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sa bshad pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the excellence of aspiration, application, and dedication.

original: sngar ni dang po don dam pa pa'i sems skyes pa tsam gyis gnas pa bshad do //
analyzed: sngar ni dang po don dam pa pa'i sems skyes pa tsam gyis gnas pa bshad do //
translated: Previously, the station was explained as merely the arising of the first ultimate thought of enlightenment.

original: da ni bsgom pa'i lam na gnas skabs mchog tu gyur pas /
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i lam na gnas skabs mchog tu gyur pas /
translated: Now, on the path of meditation, it is the supreme station.

original: mthong ba'i lam na phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu zhugs pas na rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu zhugs pas na rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the path of seeing, it is called “well-established” because it is well-engaged, due to possessing the three perfections.

original: yang dag par tshol bas rim gro bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams tshol ba gus par smra ba la sogs pa 'dud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par tshol bas rim gro bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams tshol ba gus par smra ba la sogs pa 'dud par byed pa yin te /
translated: Service through correct seeking is respectfully addressing and bowing to spiritual friends, seeking them.

original: bsnyen bkur bya bas rim gro bya ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya bas rim gro bya ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: Service through attendance is the sign of service through attendance.

original: sgrub pas rim gro bya ba ni sdom pa blangs pa'i yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pas rim gro bya ba ni sdom pa blangs pa'i yin te /
translated: Service through practice is for those who have taken vows,

original: de bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they protect them.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni dad pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa sdom pa kho na yin pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni dad pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa sdom pa kho na yin pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The worship of practice is just the vow of faith, refuge, etc., so it is distinct.

original: de la gnas pa nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abiding in that is the object of all buddhas.

original: dngos po chen po nyid ni sna tshogs mang zhing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po chen po nyid ni sna tshogs mang zhing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatness of entity is due to the variety, abundance, and vastness.

original: bsam pa chen po nyid ni rgya che zhing rnam par dag pa la mos pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa chen po nyid ni rgya che zhing rnam par dag pa la mos pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of intention is the intention of faith in the vast and pure.

original: bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid ni chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid ni chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of the possession of merit is that it is as vast as the dharma-dhātu.

original: rgyu'i dngos po chen po nyid ni 'khor ba ji srid pa dang 'bras bu rtag pa'i rgyun yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po chen po nyid ni 'khor ba ji srid pa dang 'bras bu rtag pa'i rgyun yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of the causal entity is that it is the cause of the eternal stream of the effect for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: tshig gnyis kyis ni dus chen po nyid bstan te /
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis ni dus chen po nyid bstan te /
translated: The greatness of time is indicated by the next two phrases.

original: bskal pa dang sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa dang sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is uninterrupted for all kalpas and for all the appearances of Buddhas.

original: smon lam chen po gsum pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽zad par khyab pas zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam chen po gsum pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / zad par khyab pas zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The third great vow is the vow to be born in the buddha-field.🔽The phrase “pervading all” shows the meaning of the word “all” in “all buddha-fields.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “all” qualifies the infinite world-realms.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'jig rten gyi khams su zhes bya ba 'di tsam du go bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'jig rten gyi khams su zhes bya ba 'di tsam du go bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were to say only “world-realms,” it would be understood as just “world-realms,”

original: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //🔽zad par khyab pa ma lus pa smos pas ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang 'dzam @35a * //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du zhes bya bar ni ma yin no // zad par khyab pa ma lus pa smos pas ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang 'dzam @35a * //
translated: but not as “all Jambudvīpas.”

original: bu'i gling ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad du yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bu'i gling ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad du yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: By saying “pervading all without exception,” it is explained that it is in all the Jambudvīpas that exist in a single world-realm.

original: smon lam gsum pa 'dis ni rten cing 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de bstan te /
analyzed: smon lam gsum pa 'dis ni rten cing 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de bstan te /
translated: This third vow shows the ripening of sentient beings through dependent origination,

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa la sogs pas rten sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa la sogs pas rten sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it mentions the support, the emanation body of the Buddha, such as when he descends from the Tuṣita heaven and so on.

original: sngon du btang bas zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs stsogs par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes de snyam du dang por sems la bzhag nas phyis dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad
analyzed: sngon du btang bas zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs stsogs par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes de snyam du dang por sems la bzhag nas phyis dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad
translated: Having previously sent forth means that, thinking, I will act so that the collection of merit and knowledge of sentient beings will be accumulated, having first set that thought in the mind, he later demonstrates the departure from the Tuṣita realm and so on.

original: do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The fourth, etc.

original: da ni sems can 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de ston to //
analyzed: da ni sems can 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de ston to //
translated: Now, having shown the similarity of sentient beings, he shows the maturation of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa brtan pa'i sems kyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa brtan pa'i sems kyis te /
translated: The firm mind is the firm mind of the bodhisattva.

original: tshig dang po dang / tha ma gnyis dang / tshig bar ma rnams kyis spyod pa de nyid kyi rnam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / las dang / thabs tha dad pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: tshig dang po dang / tha ma gnyis dang / tshig bar ma rnams kyis spyod pa de nyid kyi rnam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / las dang / thabs tha dad pa ston par byed do //
translated: The first and last words and the middle words show the different aspects, natures, actions, and methods of that conduct.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa bshad pa nyid las legs par rnam par phye bar zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa bshad pa nyid las legs par rnam par phye bar zad do //
translated: The distinctions of the aspects, etc. are well explained in the same text.

original: sa dag las 'jig rten pa ji ltar yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sa dag las 'jig rten pa ji ltar yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: How is it that the mundane perfections do not exist on the spiritual levels?

original: de'i rjes la thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa yin gyi /
translated: They are subsequent to the supramundane perfections;🔽but they are not included in the spiritual levels.

original: sas bsdus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sas bsdus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽It is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽It is like a path, because it is similar to a path.🔽The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.

original: thabs bstan pa las spyod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: thabs bstan pa las spyod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid la bya ste /
translated: The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.

original: pha lta bu zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pha lta bu zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.

original: sa'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa yang 'di nyid yin no //🔽lnga pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni sems can gang dag yongs su smin par bya ba de dag yongs su ston te /
analyzed: sa'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa yang 'di nyid yin no // lnga pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni sems can gang dag yongs su smin par bya ba de dag yongs su ston te /
translated: The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa drug tu tha dad pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa drug tu tha dad pa rnams so //
translated: The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag kyang bshad pa nyid las bshad par zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag kyang bshad pa nyid las bshad par zad do //
translated: The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.🔽The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.🔽The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.🔽The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.🔽The spiritual level is like a guide, because it is similar to a guide.🔽The spiritual level is like a father, because it is similar to a father.🔽The spiritual level is like a path, because it is similar to a path.

original: drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni sems can de dag gang na gnas pa de brjod de /
analyzed: drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni sems can de dag gang na gnas pa de brjod de /
translated: The sixth verse and so on. Now, he states the location of those sentient beings.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yin no //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yin no //
translated: It is the world system of the environment.

original: de la shin tu rgya che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par dbye ba mig 'phrul lta bu ni dper na sgyu ma'i gsang sngags kyi mthus mig 'phrul glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i mtshan @35b nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ngo bo
analyzed: de la shin tu rgya che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par dbye ba mig 'phrul lta bu ni dper na sgyu ma'i gsang sngags kyi mthus mig 'phrul glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i mtshan @35b nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ngo bo
