translated: There, the extremely vast and so on. The classification of magical displays is like the classification of the characteristics of magical displays of elephants, horses and so on through the power of the mantra of illusion.

original: sna tshogs brdzun yang snang ba de bzhin du las sgyu ma'i mthus 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa du mar tha dad pas tha dad pa 'di dag kyang brdzun bzhin du snang ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs brdzun yang snang ba de bzhin du las sgyu ma'i mthus 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa du mar tha dad pas tha dad pa 'di dag kyang brdzun bzhin du snang ste /
translated: Although false, they appear. Likewise, through the power of the illusion of karma, these different worlds are different in many ways, and they appear as if false.

original: bdag nyid kyis de ltar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes kyis khong du chud par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis de ltar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes kyis khong du chud par byas nas /
translated: Having understood that in that way through the wisdom of the ultimate nature,

original: sems can rnams kyang khong du chud par bya'o zhes smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang khong du chud par bya'o zhes smon lam 'debs so //
translated: he makes the aspiration to cause sentient beings to understand it in that way.

original: 'di snyed du yongs su chud pa ni tshad do //
analyzed: 'di snyed du yongs su chud pa ni tshad do //
translated: This much is the measure.

original: de med pa'i phyir tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir tshad med pa ste /
translated: Since it does not exist, it is immeasurable.

original: de ltar tshad med pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rnam pa du ma gang yin pa de la 'jug pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: de ltar tshad med pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rnam pa du ma gang yin pa de la 'jug pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs so //
translated: Thus, he formulates his vow in order to directly experience the many kinds of distinctions of those immeasurables.

original: bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni gang la gnas te yongs su smin par bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni gang la gnas te yongs su smin par bya ba de ston te /
translated: The seventh, etc., now he shows what is to be matured by abiding in what.

original: de la zhing thams cad zhing gcig dang zhes bya ba ni zhing thams cad rang gi zhing dang 'dra ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la zhing thams cad zhing gcig dang zhes bya ba ni zhing thams cad rang gi zhing dang 'dra ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therein, all fields as one field means that all fields are to be accomplished as being like one's own field.

original: zhing thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir mnyam par rgyu ba ste des yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: zhing thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir mnyam par rgyu ba ste des yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the even movement because it moves equally everywhere without obstruction.

original: 'od kyi rgyan gyis ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: 'od kyi rgyan gyis ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: By the adornment of light, he shows the perfection of color,

original: rin po che mchog tu 'bar bas brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che mchog tu 'bar bas brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is adorned with the blazing of the supreme jewels.

original: rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: The ornament of array shows the perfection of shape,

original: dbyibs sna tshogs pa du ma bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs sna tshogs pa du ma bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is arrayed with many different shapes.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i lam 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam de dang ldan pas zag pa med pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la yongs su longs spyod cing de la gnas pa rnams nye bar brtan par 'gyur bar smon🔽lam 'debs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i lam 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam de dang ldan pas zag pa med pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la yongs su longs spyod cing de la gnas pa rnams nye bar brtan par 'gyur bar smon lam 'debs so //
translated: He prays that those who are established in that supramundane path of complete purification, which is free from all afflictions, may enjoy and abide in untainted joy and bliss.

original: ye shes tshad med pa'i 'byung gnas ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te gnas pa po de dag gis gang ba nyid don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes tshad med pa'i 'byung gnas ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te gnas pa po de dag gis gang ba nyid don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: He prays that the field be filled with the abiders, that is, with the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, who are the source of immeasurable intuition.

original: zhing de lta bu de 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba yin te /
analyzed: zhing de lta bu de 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba yin te /
translated: The cause for achieving such a field is the correct orientation to the vast domain of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: The vast domain of the Buddha is all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de dag la yang dag par gzhol ba ni mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang dag par gzhol ba ni mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: And the full engagement in those is the full accomplishment.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos pa dang 'tsham par ye shes kyis zhing de lta bu dag ston cing yang dag par bstan nas kyang mthus tshim par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos pa dang 'tsham par ye shes kyis zhing de lta bu dag ston cing yang dag par bstan nas kyang mthus tshim par byed do //
translated: By means of wisdom, he manifests such fields in accordance with the aspirations of beings, in accordance with their inclinations. And having manifested them, he satisfies them by his power.

original: brgyad pa'o @36a * //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brgyad pa'o @36a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eighth.

original: da ni smon lam lhag ma gsum ni bdag nyid kyi sa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug pa rtogs par bya ba dang thams cad kyi mthar thug pa rtogs par bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: da ni smon lam lhag ma gsum ni bdag nyid kyi sa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug pa rtogs par bya ba dang thams cad kyi mthar thug pa rtogs par bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: Now, the remaining three vows are to be understood as the realization of the distinctions of one's own stage, the realization of the distinctions of the Bodhisattva stage, the realization of the culmination of the Bodhisattva stage, and the realization of the culmination of all, respectively.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang bdag tu bsam pa sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang sbyor ba lus dang ngag gi las gcig par 'dra bar mtshungs par 'gyur bar smon lam 'debs pa /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang bdag tu bsam pa sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang sbyor ba lus dang ngag gi las gcig par 'dra bar mtshungs par 'gyur bar smon lam 'debs pa /
translated: The bodhisattva makes the aspiration that his attitude and application will be the same as those of all bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sems shing theg pa dman pa las shin tu rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sems shing theg pa dman pa las shin tu rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin la /
translated: The attitude of the bodhisattvas is to think of omniscience and to turn away completely from the Individual Vehicle.

original: sbyor ba yang 'di nyid la sbyor ba yin pas bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar theg pa chen po kho na la 'jug cing theg pa dman pa la dga' bar yang mi 'gyur bar de dag dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yang 'di nyid la sbyor ba yin pas bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar theg pa chen po kho na la 'jug cing theg pa dman pa la dga' bar yang mi 'gyur bar de dag dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: And their application is to apply themselves to that. So he aspires to have the same attitude and application as they do, to enter only the Great Vehicle and not to delight in the Individual Vehicle.🔽And that is distinguished by ten kinds of practice.

original: de yang spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba ni de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi 'gran zla ni dgra ste /
analyzed: de yang spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba ni de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi 'gran zla ni dgra ste /
translated: The rivals of the roots of virtue such as the perfection of generosity are enemies.

original: ser sna la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The adverse side is stinginess, etc.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir zil gyis mi non pas na /
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir zil gyis mi non pas na /
translated: Because of the elimination of those, there is no intimidation.

original: 'gran zla med pa dag go //
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa dag go //
translated: There is no rival.

original: de dag sogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag sogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of those is complete.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i tshogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i tshogs yin no //
translated: This is the accumulation for entering the universal vehicle.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog pa ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog pa ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: Correct mental attention is the cultivation of internal serenity.

original: des chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam pa kho na dmigs pa'i phyir mthun par dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: des chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam pa kho na dmigs pa'i phyir mthun par dmigs pa ste /
translated: Because of that, there is the proper object, since all things are apprehended just in the aspect of selflessness.

original: des rnam pa gnyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des rnam pa gnyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The proper object is the differentiation of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs pas 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs pas 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are always in the company of the buddhas, and so they have the proper conversation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The differentiation of the tathāgatas is the dharma-dhātu.

original: de ye shes kyis khong du chud pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ye shes kyis khong du chud pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The understanding of that by means of intuition is recollection.

original: ma nyams pa ni yongs su ma nyams pa ste de las nam yang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nyams pa ni yongs su ma nyams pa ste de las nam yang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncorrupted is the uncorrupted, because it never degenerates from that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the following,

original: rtag tu kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir nam yang rjes su mi 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir nam yang rjes su mi 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: because it always occurs. It is never the non-following.

original: de nyid gtan du ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pas so zhes bya bas @36b bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid gtan du ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pas so zhes bya bas @36b bstan to //
translated: That very thing is taught by the attainment of permanent superknowledge.

original: dgu pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: In the ninth stage and so on, effort is the undertaking of effort.

original: de'i don yod pa ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i don yod pa ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Its non-futility is the non-absence of result.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las don yod pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni mdo nyid las tshig gzhan gsum gyis bshad de /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las don yod pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni mdo nyid las tshig gzhan gsum gyis bshad de /
translated: The meaning of the sutra statement futile bodily, verbal, and mental actions is explained in the sutra itself by three other statements.

original: de la sems can rnams kyis bdag mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi sa bon du btab pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la nges par 'gyur bar smon lam 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems can rnams kyis bdag mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi sa bon du btab pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la nges par 'gyur bar smon lam 'debs pa ni /
translated: Among them, the bodhisattva makes the aspiration prayer: As soon as sentient beings see me, may they be established in the qualities of the Buddha, having planted the seed of Buddhahood.

original: lus kyi las don yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: lus kyi las don yod pa nyid do //
translated: The physical action of the bodhisattva is not wasted.

original: tshig brjod ma thag tu ye shes khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ngag gi las don yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshig brjod ma thag tu ye shes khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ngag gi las don yod pa nyid do //
translated: The verbal action of the bodhisattva is not wasted, because his speech is immediately understood as gnosis.

original: de'i yid kyi dbang gis sems can rnams dad pa skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa rnams ldog pa ni yid kyi las don yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yid kyi dbang gis sems can rnams dad pa skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa rnams ldog pa ni yid kyi las don yod pa nyid do //
translated: The mental action of the bodhisattva is not wasted, because the afflictions of beings are immediately removed by his mental power.

original: don sgrub pa ni don byed pa don bya ba yin te des don yod pa nyid de /🔽de la sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu'i lus yang dag par bstan pas ni sems can rnams kyis sha zos pa la sogs pas rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal nad sel bar byed de 'di ltar srog chags kyi rigs des pa zhes bya ba'i sha zos pas
analyzed: don sgrub pa ni don byed pa don bya ba yin te des don yod pa nyid de / de la sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu'i lus yang dag par bstan pas ni sems can rnams kyis sha zos pa la sogs pas rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal nad sel bar byed de 'di ltar srog chags kyi rigs des pa zhes bya ba'i sha zos pas
translated: The bodhisattva’s action is effective, because it is meaningful, it does what is to be done.🔽By displaying a body like the king of medicines, the bodhisattva removes the natural suffering of disease of those who eat his flesh, and so on.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i nad kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i nad kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi'o zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that by eating the flesh of the bodhisattva who was the deer, a great multitude of beings was cured of the suffering of disease.

original: phongs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni /
analyzed: phongs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni /
translated: The suffering that arises from want is

original: dbul ba la sogs pa de'i gnyen por yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu'i lus thob pa'o //
analyzed: dbul ba la sogs pa de'i gnyen por yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu'i lus thob pa'o //
translated: The body is obtained like a wish-fulfilling jewel as the antidote to poverty, etc.

original: bcu pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la las lnga pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan nas yang sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye ba la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub pa'i phyir spyod pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no🔽// drug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis las yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag tu chos kyi tshul nub na mdo la sogs pa'i
analyzed: bcu pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la las lnga pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan nas yang sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye ba la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub pa'i phyir spyod pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no // drug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis las yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag tu chos kyi tshul nub na mdo la sogs pa'i
translated: The fifth action is the uninterrupted power of practice, because, after demonstrating nirvana, the bodhisattva again takes birth in samsara for the sake of sentient beings and accomplishes the bodhisattva practices.🔽The sixth action is the uninterrupted power of the Dharma, because, after attaining omniscience, the bodhisattva again and again teaches the Dharma, such as the sutras, in other buddha-fields when the way of the Dharma is declining.

original: chos rnams rab tu ston par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu ston par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “again and again” and so on means that, after attaining omniscience, the bodhisattva, based on the buddha stage, teaches the Dharma such as the sutras in other buddha-fields when the way of the Dharma is declining.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: Therefore, the word “again” is mentioned.

original: nub pa la yang 'byin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nub pa la yang 'byin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that even when it is obscured, it is still present.

original: las bdun pa ni zhes bya ba la chos rnams shes pa ni /🔽chos shes pa ste me long lta bu'i @37a * //
analyzed: las bdun pa ni zhes bya ba la chos rnams shes pa ni / chos shes pa ste me long lta bu'i @37a * //
translated: The seventh action is the knowledge of phenomena.

original: ye shes la sogs pa'o //🔽de nyid mngon par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: ye shes la sogs pa'o // de nyid mngon par shes pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of phenomena is the mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: 'dis mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the superknowledge, because it is the intuition of that.

original: des stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad snang ba med par byed do //
analyzed: des stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad snang ba med par byed do //
translated: By that, all phenomena are made to appear as empty, because they are realized as empty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it does not abide in cyclic life.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas ni sems can gyi mos pa'i dbang gis brgya byin la sogs pa'i lus kyis bdag nyid len cing de bzhin du tshe zad na yang ci dgar 'dug la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas ni sems can gyi mos pa'i dbang gis brgya byin la sogs pa'i lus kyis bdag nyid len cing de bzhin du tshe zad na yang ci dgar 'dug la /
translated: By the superknowledge of magical power, he assumes a body as Indra, etc., according to the inclinations of beings, and likewise, when his life is exhausted, he remains as he wishes.

original: yod na yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: yod na yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: And even when he is present, he passes into final Nirvana.

original: de la 'dod pa'i don sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa la sems mngon par 'du byed cing 'du mngon par byed pa ni smon lam mo //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i don sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa la sems mngon par 'du byed cing 'du mngon par byed pa ni smon lam mo //
translated: In that, the mental orientation is the vow, because it is the mental orientation toward the desired aim, such as the worship of the Buddha, etc.

original: smon lam de 'grub par bya ba'i thabs gang yin pa brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid de ni brtson pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam de 'grub par bya ba'i thabs gang yin pa brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid de ni brtson pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of striving is the means for accomplishing that vow, and that is striving.

original: brtson 'grus kyi thabs de sgrub pa shas che ba ni mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi thabs de sgrub pa shas che ba ni mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The great accomplishment of that means of striving is the accomplishment.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra smon lam dang 'brel ba yin pa dang de 'grub pa ni smon lam 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra smon lam dang 'brel ba yin pa dang de 'grub pa ni smon lam 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “that” is connected with the vow, and the accomplishment of that is the accomplishment of the vow. This is the meaning here.

original: de 'grub pa yang smon pa'i don 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de 'grub pa yang smon pa'i don 'grub pa yin la /
translated: The accomplishment of that is the accomplishment of the meaning of the vow.

original: 'dod pa'i don yang sems can gyi mthar thug pa'i bar yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don yang sems can gyi mthar thug pa'i bar yin pas /
translated: And the meaning of the vow is the ultimate of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'di gsum rim gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhung 'di mi 'gal lo ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'di gsum rim gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhung 'di mi 'gal lo ;
translated: Therefore, since these three are accomplished in order, there is no contradiction in this treatise.

original: / de la sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa ni yan lag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / de la sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa ni yan lag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The ultimate of the realm of sentient beings is the branch, etc.

original: sems can gyi khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The ultimate of the realm of sentient beings is the ultimate of the realm of sentient beings.

original: gang du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Where they abide means in the ultimate world-realms.

original: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How many means as many as there are, in the ultimate realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams bzhin du tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams bzhin du tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They are immeasurable, like the realm of space.

original: gang gis gdul bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gdul bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Those to be guided means in the ultimate realm of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro //🔽gdams ngag gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro // gdams ngag gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: because they are guided by the Buddha's emanations and so forth.🔽The instructions they rely on means in the ultimate realm of the Tathagata's gnosis,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la brten nas gdams ngag spyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la brten nas gdams ngag spyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they give instructions in reliance on the Tathagata's gnosis.🔽The objects they focus on means in the ultimate realm of the mind's focus,

original: dmigs pa @37b gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi dmigs pa'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa @37b gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi dmigs pa'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: because they focus on the mind's focus.

original: bdag med pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they focus on the two kinds of no-self.

original: mngon par rtogs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: By what realization? It is the final accomplishment of the gnosis of buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the realization of the gnosis of buddhahood.

original: 'di dag rgyun gyi mthar thug pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag rgyun gyi mthar thug pa yin pa ni /
translated: These nine culminations are taught by the finality of the continuum.

original: 'khor ba ji srid par yongs su mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par yongs su mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The finality of the continuum is taught because they are not exhausted for as long as saṃsāra lasts.

original: mthar thug pa dgu po 'di dag nyid rgyud kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa dgu po 'di dag nyid rgyud kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyis bstan te /
translated: These very nine culminations are taught by the finality of the continuum.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyis ni dang po gsum mo //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyis ni dang po gsum mo //
translated: In that regard, the first three are by the continuum of the world.

original: chos kyi rgyud kyis ni bar ma rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyud kyis ni bar ma rnams so //
translated: The middle ones are by the continuum of Dharma.

original: ye shes kyi rgyud kyis ni tha ma rnams so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyud kyis ni tha ma rnams so //
translated: The last ones are by the continuum of gnosis.

original: rgyud ni rgyun chags pa ste rgyun dang lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun chags pa ste rgyun dang lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A continuum is a continuity, a synonym for a stream and a path.

original: sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba ni dang pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i don bcu dag gis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba ni dang pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i don bcu dag gis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it superior by the distinctive practice? It is so because of the ten kinds of practice that will be mentioned below, beginning with faith.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang 'di dag shas 'ga' zhig yod mod kyi /🔽'on kyang 'di las 'og nas 'byung ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu dag ni /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang 'di dag shas 'ga' zhig yod mod kyi / 'on kyang 'di las 'og nas 'byung ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu dag ni /
translated: Although these are found in some measure in the disciples and so on,🔽nevertheless, they are not like those of the bodhisattvas as they will be described below.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam kho na'i yin pas khyad par dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam kho na'i yin pas khyad par dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called distinctive.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la zhes bya ba ni smon lam chen pos kun nas bslang ba dag la'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la zhes bya ba ni smon lam chen pos kun nas bslang ba dag la'o //
translated: In those roots of virtue means in those roots of virtue that are motivated by the great vow.

original: dbang gi khyad par thob pa ni ji srid 'dod par yang dang yang du mngon sum du bya ba la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang gi khyad par thob pa ni ji srid 'dod par yang dang yang du mngon sum du bya ba la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive attainment of power is because of the absence of obstruction to the repeated realization of the roots of virtue whenever one wishes.

original: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dga' bas lus dang sems dag shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pas gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dga' bas lus dang sems dag shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pas gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having attained the excellence of ease means that the bodhisattva's body and mind are filled with the delight of Dharma, and thus are fit for the practice of the antidotes.

original: da ni yul gyi bye brag rab tu brjod pa'i sgo nas dang pa la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: da ni yul gyi bye brag rab tu brjod pa'i sgo nas dang pa la sogs pa ston to //
translated: Now, faith and so on are taught by way of their special objects.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The beginning is the stage of the bodhisattva,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because omniscience is the future limit.

original: der spyod pa ni sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: der spyod pa ni sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice there is the beginning practice.

original: de nyid 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the entry,

original: 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one enters the city of omniscience.

original: de ltar na khyad par bsdus pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyid sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par bsdus pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyid sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva practice, which is included in the excellence, is the entry into the beginning practice.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di @38a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di @38a * //
translated: Or else,

original: la 'jug pa 'di yod pas sam 'di la 'dis 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: la 'jug pa 'di yod pas sam 'di la 'dis 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it exists, or because it exists in this, it is an entry.

original: tshig gnyis kyis ni 'bru mang po dag la yang de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis ni 'bru mang po dag la yang de nyid la bya'o //
translated: The same is to be understood for the many words of the second verse.

original: ji lta zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na bshad pa /
translated: How so?

original: de ni sa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la tshig gnyis ka la yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa snga ma ni sa phyi ma'i 'jug pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ni sa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro // de la tshig gnyis ka la yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa snga ma ni sa phyi ma'i 'jug pa yin pa'am /
translated: Because it is included in the ten stages.🔽In the first verse, the bodhisattva's former practice is the entry to the later stages, or the later stages are entered by the former.

original: snga mas phyi ma la 'jug pa yin pas rnam pa 'dis de nyid sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa yin par yang ma zad kyi /🔽snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bye brag tu ma phyi bar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa de thams cad yod pa'am /
analyzed: snga mas phyi ma la 'jug pa yin pas rnam pa 'dis de nyid sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa yin par yang ma zad kyi / snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bye brag tu ma phyi bar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa de thams cad yod pa'am /
translated: By this aspect, not only is that the entry to the former practice,🔽but also the entry to omniscience, without distinction of former and later.

original: 'di la des 'jug pa yod pas zhes tshig tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'di la des 'jug pa yod pas zhes tshig tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: That is omniscience, because it exists, or because it exists in this, by the inclusion of the many words of the second verse, with different words.

original: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa ni ngo bo gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa ni ngo bo gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the engagement in the conduct of the past is twofold in nature.

original: spyod pa dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of conduct and enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi spyod pa nas bzung ste byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar du'o zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi spyod pa nas bzung ste byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar du'o zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained that from the conduct itself up to the complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: de la dang po ni rnam pa nyid kyis mngon par yid ches so //
analyzed: de la dang po ni rnam pa nyid kyis mngon par yid ches so //
translated: Among those, the first is fully trusted by way of the aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is that bodhisattva conduct?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan /
translated: It is taught by the term “perfect accomplishment of the perfections.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa ni yongs su 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa ni yongs su 'grub pa ste /
translated: The perfect accomplishment of the perfections is the complete accomplishment.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas yongs su dag pa yin pas de'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas yongs su dag pa yin pas de'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Since it is pure by abandoning the discordant class, it is the nature of the bodhisattva conduct.

original: rim pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By what stages?

original: sa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: sa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The word “ground” is taught.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa yongs su dag pa'i rim gyis de dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa yongs su dag pa'i rim gyis de dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are accomplished by the process of purifying the first ground and so on.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po la ni spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po la ni spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Thus, on the first ground, the perfection of generosity is accomplished.

original: gong ma dag la ni gzhan dag 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma dag la ni gzhan dag 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the others are accomplished on the higher grounds.

original: byang chub kyis bsdus pa'i khyad par rnam pa drug gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyis bsdus pa'i khyad par rnam pa drug gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Having taken up the six kinds of distinctions subsumed under enlightenment, he said:

original: mu stegs can phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par dang / bdud phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par te mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang stobs dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @38b 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa nyid ces bya ba la mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par dang / bdud phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par te mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang stobs dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @38b 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa nyid ces bya ba la mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: The distinction of the perfection of fearlessness, the distinction of the perfection of the powers, and the distinction of the perfection of the unshared qualities of the Buddha, which is called “invincibility.”

original: stobs la sogs pas rim bzhin du mu stegs can dang / bdud dag las rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pas rim bzhin du mu stegs can dang / bdud dag las rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfections of fearlessness and so on are respectively the victory over tīrthikas and opponents, the victory over māras and opponents, and the victory over tīrthikas and māras.

original: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa rgya che ba ni /
analyzed: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa rgya che ba ni /
translated: The vastness of inconceivable power

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha is called

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul las kyang 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul las kyang 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends the domain of thought of sravakas and so on.🔽The distinctive profundity of the nondifferentiation of intuition is called

original: ye shes tha mi dad cing zab pa nyid kyi khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul mtha' dbus med par mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ye shes tha mi dad cing zab pa nyid kyi khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul mtha' dbus med par mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the accomplishment of the object of the Tathagata without end or middle.

original: ji lta zhe na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ni dang po dang dbus dang mtha' dag yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ni dang po dang dbus dang mtha' dag yin no //
translated: How is that? Birth, continuance, and destruction are the beginning, the middle, and the end.

original: mtha' smos pas ni 'dir mtha' ma yang brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' smos pas ni 'dir mtha' ma yang brjod pa yin te /
translated: By mentioning the end, here the end and the beginning are also mentioned,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the end and the beginning.

original: de rnams med pa'i phyir mtha' dang dbus med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams med pa'i phyir mtha' dang dbus med pa ste /
translated: Since they do not exist, there is no end or middle,

original: chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: that is, the realm of the Dharma.

original: de'i yul can gyi ye shes kyang yul gyi sgo nas mtha' dang dbus med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi ye shes kyang yul gyi sgo nas mtha' dang dbus med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intuition that has that as its object is also called without end or middle from the point of view of its object.

original: de nyid ye shes tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ye shes tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the nondifferentiation of intuition.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pas tha dad du mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pas tha dad du mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of one taste in emptiness, it is not differentiated by a different objective support.

original: de nyid rang rig pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rang rig pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yin te /
translated: That itself is the object of the Tathāgata through self-awareness.

original: de mngon par sgrub pa ni yang dang yang mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon par sgrub pa ni yang dang yang mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Its realization is the repeated actualization of that.

original: de'i zag pa nyid kyi khyad par ni shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su yang zhugs la de'i rnam pa snang bas bsgyur ba yang ma yin zhing yang dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir shes pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir shes bya
analyzed: de'i zag pa nyid kyi khyad par ni shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su yang zhugs la de'i rnam pa snang bas bsgyur ba yang ma yin zhing yang dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir shes pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir shes bya
translated: The distinction of its defilement is that it engages all objects of knowledge, but it is not transformed by the appearance of their aspects, and it is knowledge because it is the true nature.

original: dang 'brel pa can ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang 'brel pa can ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be not related to objects of knowledge because it is not established as knowledge.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The distinction of its aspects is that it engages the immeasurable domain of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa ni chos thams cad de de'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa ni chos thams cad de de'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The immeasurable domain of the tathāgatas is all things, because they are directly perceived.

original: de la 'jug pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ste /
translated: Entry into that is mirror-wisdom, etc.

original: 'dis shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la 'jug par byed rab tu shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis shes pa'i dngos po thams cad la 'jug par byed rab tu shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it causes entry into, and knowledge of, all things that are objects of consciousness.

original: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the knowledge of all modes.

original: 'bras bu yongs su grub pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi 'bras bu ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i @39a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su grub pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi 'bras bu ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i @39a * //
translated: The result is the perfected, because the result of the path of the buddhas is the freedom from all obscurations.

original: phyir bral ba'i khyad par ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: phyir bral ba'i khyad par ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The distinction of freedom is the result.

original: de la snga ma rnams kyis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la snga ma rnams kyis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, the former verses teach the perfection of knowledge.

original: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This verse teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: da ni rdo rje'i snying po nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa spyod pa dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis po de mdor bsdus nas tshig tha ma gnyis kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: da ni rdo rje'i snying po nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa spyod pa dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis po de mdor bsdus nas tshig tha ma gnyis kyis ston par byed do //
translated: Now, the essence of the vajra itself teaches in brief the two kinds of conduct and enlightenment, which are the conduct in the beginning, by means of the last two verses.

original: de la dben pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dben pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, “isolation” and so on. “Superimposition” is due to the superimposition of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, which are not real.

original: sgro 'dogs par byed pas na sgro 'dogs pa ste rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs par byed pas na sgro 'dogs pa ste rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That which superimposes is superimposition, which is conceptualization.

original: sgro btags pa ni de nyid kyis sgro btags pa ste rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag dang chos rnams so //
analyzed: sgro btags pa ni de nyid kyis sgro btags pa ste rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag dang chos rnams so //
translated: That which is superimposed is the self and phenomena, which are to be conceptually imagined by that.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni de gnyi gas dben te rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir de dag kyang rtog par mi byed pa la brtag par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni de gnyi gas dben te rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir de dag kyang rtog par mi byed pa la brtag par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya
translated: Those dharmas of the Buddha, which are characterized by the purity of the dharmadhātu, are devoid of both of those, because they are free from conceptualization and the conceptualized. They are also not conceptualized, because they are not the conceptualized.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: zhi ba ni don gyi chos nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don rnams kyi chos nyid ni stong pa nyid de rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhi ba dag go //
analyzed: zhi ba ni don gyi chos nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don rnams kyi chos nyid ni stong pa nyid de rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhi ba dag go //
translated: Tranquil by the reality of the object means that the reality of objects is emptiness, because they are naturally in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum yongs su bstan te sgro 'dogs pa'i don zhes bya bas ni rnam par rtog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba brjod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum yongs su bstan te sgro 'dogs pa'i don zhes bya bas ni rnam par rtog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba brjod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
translated: Thus, this passage teaches the three natures. The phrase “the object of superimposition” refers to the other-dependent nature, because it is the mind and mental factors that superimpose.

original: sgro btags pa'i don zhes byas ni sgro btags pa rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir kun brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don zhes byas ni sgro btags pa rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir kun brtags pa yin no //
translated: The imagined object is imagined because it is described as an entity to be imagined.

original: don gyi chos nyid kyis ni yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi chos nyid kyis ni yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfected is taught by the reality of the object.

original: de la rnam par rtog par byed pas na rnam par rtog pa ste gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog par byed pas na rnam par rtog pa ste gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Imagination is the relative reality, because it imagines.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: It is the resistance to the liberation gate of emptiness.

original: gnyis su rnam par rtog pa yod na de mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su rnam par rtog pa yod na de mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the duality of the imagined is present, it does not arise.

original: mtshan ma ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa sgro btags pa kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa sgro btags pa kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The sign is the imagined reality, which is the imputation of male and female, etc.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: It is the resistance to the signless.

original: ldan pa dang bral ba ni theg pa dang dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste khams gsum @39b pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa dang bral ba ni theg pa dang dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste khams gsum @39b pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.

original: de la smon pa ni smon pa med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la smon pa ni smon pa med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the path that is cultivated in order to eliminate the remaining passions.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the path that is cultivated in order to eliminate the remaining passions.

original: de'i dmigs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir gos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir gos pa med pa ste /
translated: The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.

original: de dag la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the path that is cultivated in order to eliminate the remaining passions.🔽The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.

original: grangs med pa dang brtag mi nus pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya ba'i dmigs pa nyid yin pas tshad med pa dag go //
analyzed: grangs med pa dang brtag mi nus pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya ba'i dmigs pa nyid yin pas tshad med pa dag go //
translated: The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.

original: yang na 'dis skye bar byed pas na skye ba'i lam kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'dis skye bar byed pas na skye ba'i lam kho na yin te /
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the path that is cultivated in order to eliminate the remaining passions.🔽The path of no more learning is the path of no more learning because there is no longer any learning to do.

original: de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of seeing is the path of seeing because it is the first vision of the truths that one has never seen before.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the path that is cultivated in order to eliminate the remaining passions.🔽The path of no more learning is the path

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam ste de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rgya che ba dag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam ste de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rgya che ba dag go //
translated: The wisdom that accomplishes the aims of others is the path of the bodhisattva, and its object is vast.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub dka' ba dag ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub dka' ba dag ste /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha, which is attained through three incalculable eons, is difficult to accomplish, because it is its object.

original: sgrub par dka' thob par dka' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub par dka' thob par dka' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is difficult to accomplish, difficult to attain, is what is meant.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum las brtsams nas lta ba ngan pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum las brtsams nas lta ba ngan pa gsum ste /
translated: Three bad views arise from the three natures.

original: de lam rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa'i mig can gyi lta ba dang po ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lam rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa'i mig can gyi lta ba dang po ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: The first view is that of those who have eyes obscured by the darkness of the path of knowing, and it arises from the emptiness of the perfected nature.

original: gnyis pa ni bdag ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par rtog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bdag ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par rtog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la'o //
translated: The second is that of those who imagine the self to be like this and so on, and it arises from the dependent nature.

original: gsum pa ni phyi'i dngos po gser la sogs pa sgro btags pa las te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni phyi'i dngos po gser la sogs pa sgro btags pa las te /
translated: The third is from the superimposition of external things, such as gold, etc.

original: lta ba gsum pa ni sred pa rnam pa dum 'byung ba las yin no //
analyzed: lta ba gsum pa ni sred pa rnam pa dum 'byung ba las yin no //
translated: The third view arises from the arising of craving.

original: gnyis ni yongs su tshol ba'i dus na zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni yongs su tshol ba'i dus na zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba ste /
translated: Two are at the time of thorough search, i.e., of complete search.

original: sgrub pa'i dus so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of practice.

original: de la dang po ni bsam pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni bsam pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: Among them, the first is the fault of intention.

original: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa dag gis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa dag gis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one practices with the intention of deceit and fraud.

original: gnyis pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The second is the fault of application.

original: phrag dog dang ser sna dag kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir bsam pa'i nyes pa kho na yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bye brag tu bshad de /
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna dag kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir bsam pa'i nyes pa kho na yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bye brag tu bshad de /
translated: Since envy and avarice are also mental factors, one might wonder whether they are only faults of intention.

original: 'gro ba gzhan dag tu lus dang longs spyod ngan pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir don gyis na 'di gnyis kyis lus dang @40a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan dag tu lus dang longs spyod ngan pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir don gyis na 'di gnyis kyis lus dang @40a * //
translated: In order to anticipate this, the Abhidharmakośa states, “They are faults of body and speech because they are the basis of envy and avarice.”

original: longs spyod dag la log par sbyar ba yin pas 'di gnyis sbyor ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dag la log par sbyar ba yin pas 'di gnyis sbyor ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These two are to be known as the application of the two.

original: lta ba drug pa ni yul sdug pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi sdug pa la zhe sdang ba dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa la gti mug pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba drug pa ni yul sdug pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi sdug pa la zhe sdang ba dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa la gti mug pa'o //
translated: The sixth view is the attachment to the attractive object, the aversion to the unattractive object, and the delusion regarding both.

original: bdun pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus na ni khro ba'o //🔽mdud par 'dzin pa'i dus na ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus na ni khro ba'o // mdud par 'dzin pa'i dus na ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The seventh is anger at the time of mutual harm.

original: brgyad pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus nyid na ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus nyid na ste /
translated: The eighth is enmity at the time of mutual grasping.🔽The ninth is violence at the time of mutual harm.

original: phyin ci log bzhi la mngon par zhen pa kho na gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi la mngon par zhen pa kho na gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the adherence to the four inversions, there is harm.

original: dgu pa ni spyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: dgu pa ni spyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i dus na ste /
translated: The tenth is hypocrisy at the time of giving, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the arising of the defilements of desire, etc.

original: 'dir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms kho na don dam par rnam par smin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms kho na don dam par rnam par smin par 'dod kyi /
translated: Here, the foundation consciousness and the feeling of equanimity alone, which is associated with it, are asserted to be the ultimate result of evolution.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams dang / tsher ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar brtags nas rnam par smin pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams dang / tsher ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar brtags nas rnam par smin pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: The other collections of consciousness and feelings, etc., are called results of evolution by designation because they are born from the result of evolution.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la byung ba gcig pa kho na la ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la byung ba gcig pa kho na la ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that the foundation consciousness alone, which occurs in the very first moment of conception, is called the simultaneous support of name-and-form?

original: smras pa / ming dang gzugs de lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba ston te /
analyzed: smras pa / ming dang gzugs de lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba ston te /
translated: We reply, because name-and-form occur simultaneously with it. This shows that the word simultaneous in the verse is a summary term.

original: lhan cig cig car byung ba'i gzhan dang lhan cig 'brel ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa ming dang gzugs la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig cig car byung ba'i gzhan dang lhan cig 'brel ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa ming dang gzugs la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: The association with something else that occurs simultaneously is not its intrinsic nature, but rather depends on name-and-form.

original: da ni rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par brjod de /
analyzed: da ni rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par brjod de /
translated: Now, the characteristic of being the cause of the consciousness that is the result of maturation is stated.

original: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kho na na /
analyzed: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kho na na /
translated: At the time of conception,

original: de dang dus mnyam pa'i ming dang gzugs 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bsdus pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dang dus mnyam pa'i ming dang gzugs 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bsdus pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin no //
translated: it is the cause because it generates the consciousness that is the result of maturation and the name-and-form that is simultaneous with it.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ming dang gzugs dang de mi 'bral bar gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang de mi 'bral bar gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is said, “because of the non-separation of name-and-form.”

original: de lta ma yin na go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na go //
translated: If that were not so,

original: 'dir ni mi 'bral bar gyur ba ming dang gzugs yin par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni mi 'bral bar gyur ba ming dang gzugs yin par bshad pa /
translated: here, name-and-form would be explained as the non-separation of name-and-form.

original: mdo las ni ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur pa zhes bya ba tshig gnyi gas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na yin par bshad pa ma @40b yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ni ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur pa zhes bya ba tshig gnyi gas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na yin par bshad pa ma @40b yin nam zhe na /
translated: But don’t the sūtras explain that the storehouse consciousness is the one that arises together with and is not separated from name-and-form?

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: mi 'bral bar gyur pa ni gnyi ga la bstan pa'i phyir gnyig yang mi 'bral bar gyur pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi 'bral bar gyur pa ni gnyi ga la bstan pa'i phyir gnyig yang mi 'bral bar gyur pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The phrase “not separated” is stated in the sūtra as “not separated from either,” because it is taught in relation to both.

original: gso ba nyid kyis ni gsog nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: gso ba nyid kyis ni gsog nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The word “heap” shows that it is a collection.

original: g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis ni rang gis bdag ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis ni rang gis bdag ma yin pa ste /
translated: The word “unmoving” shows that it is not a self.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag ni byed pa po dang ; bya ba dang bcas pa dang / rtag par 'dod la /
analyzed: bdag ni byed pa po dang ; bya ba dang bcas pa dang / rtag par 'dod la /
translated: A self is asserted to be an agent that is permanent and endowed with activity.

original: phung po rnams ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni /
translated: But the aggregates

original: skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'i phyir bya ba'i dus su mi gnas pas de lta bu ma yin pa dag tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'i phyir bya ba'i dus su mi gnas pas de lta bu ma yin pa dag tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not like that, because they are said to be momentary and not to endure beyond that moment.

original: 'di ltar khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba ni sems can dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dag dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bde ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba ni sems can dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dag dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bde ba dag ste /
translated: Thus, they do not understand.

original: de gnyi ga las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyi ga las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are mistaken about both of those, i.e., about sentient beings and insentient things, about the suffering of birth, etc., and about the happiness of nirvana.

original: des sems can rnams sdug bsngal gyi phung po las mthar ba de lta bu dag mthong nas de'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po rgyas par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des sems can rnams sdug bsngal gyi phung po las mthar ba de lta bu dag mthong nas de'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po rgyas par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing that sentient beings are in such a mass of suffering, therefore, his great compassion expands.

original: zong du bya ba zhes bya ba ni sna sprad pa'i dong rtse dang / dngul gyi dong rtse la sogs pa'i nor dag go //
analyzed: zong du bya ba zhes bya ba ni sna sprad pa'i dong rtse dang / dngul gyi dong rtse la sogs pa'i nor dag go //
translated: Goods are wealth such as gold, silver, etc.🔽Enjoyments are food, drink, etc.

original: yongs su spyad par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba zas dang skom la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //🔽gzhag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su spyad par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba zas dang skom la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //🔽gzhag par bya ba ni /
translated: that are to be enjoyed.

original: btsong bar mi bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: btsong bar mi bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: What should not be given is

original: gser la sogs pa ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa ma nyams pa'o //
translated: gold, etc.

original: 'di gsum car yang tshig dang po gcig kho nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gsum car yang tshig dang po gcig kho nas bstan to //
translated: These three are taught by the first word alone.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang yin pa dang / nang gi ni tshig lhag ma dgus bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang yin pa dang / nang gi ni tshig lhag ma dgus bshad do //
translated: The internal is explained by the remaining nine words.

original: gtong ba'i spyi ni rtogs par sla ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtong ba'i spyi ni rtogs par sla ba'i phyir /
translated: The general rule for giving is easy to understand,

original: thams cad la ltos nas yan lag yin no zhes de skad du ma bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad la ltos nas yan lag yin no zhes de skad du ma bshad do //
translated: so it is not stated in the verse.

original: phyi'i dngos po gtong ba rnam pa brgyad kyi yan lag ni gtong ba dang po yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po gtong ba rnam pa brgyad kyi yan lag ni gtong ba dang po yin te /
translated: The first giving is the branch of the eight kinds of giving of external things.

original: gtong ba rnam pa brgyad ni de'i dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtong ba rnam pa brgyad ni de'i dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eight kinds of giving are the nature of its divisions.

original: gzhi yongs su 'dzin pas dga' ba ni bde ba'i rgyud yongs su 'dzin pas dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhi yongs su 'dzin pas dga' ba ni bde ba'i rgyud yongs su 'dzin pas dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Joy in fully taking up the basis means joy in fully taking up the continuum of happiness.

original: gzhi ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa ste /
translated: The basis is gold, silver, etc.

original: de ni phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the cause of benefit.

original: phan 'dogs pas dga' ba ni rnam pa brgyad du shes par bya'o //🔽de dag kyang mdzes pa'i phan 'dogs pas dga' ba la @41a * //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas dga' ba ni rnam pa brgyad du shes par bya'o // de dag kyang mdzes pa'i phan 'dogs pas dga' ba la @41a * //
translated: The joy of benefit is to be known as eightfold.

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: And these are the joy of the beautiful, the joy of benefit, and so on.

original: rin po che'i rgyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bshad do //
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bshad do //
translated: They are explained by the words: “the ornament of jewels,” and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog la ji ltar gang la gang rigs pa de ltar de bzhin sgrub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog la ji ltar gang la gang rigs pa de ltar de bzhin sgrub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ In reality” means that one accomplishes in that way, according to the way and the place, whether it be the least, middling, or best.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub ce na /
translated: How does the Bodhisattva accomplish?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan bshad pa las /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan bshad pa las /
translated: In the explanation of the Treatise Ornament of the Discourses,

original: 'jig rten shes pa nyid rnam par dbye ba'i nang nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa nyid rnam par dbye ba'i nang nas /
translated: in the section on the analysis of the knowledge of the world,

original: dpa' bo rtag tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dpa' bo rtag tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: it is as stated in the passage beginning with “the hero always has a smiling face.”

original: ci nus su zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ldan pa nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: ci nus su zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ldan pa nyid ston par byed de /
translated: “ To the best of one’s ability” means “by myself.” This shows that one is endowed with the self.

original: rang gi zho sha la ltos nas nus pa la ni 'jug gi /
analyzed: rang gi zho sha la ltos nas nus pa la ni 'jug gi /
translated: In relation to one’s own strength, one engages in what is possible,

original: mi nus pa la ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa la ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: not in what is impossible.

original: ci rigs su zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag ji ltar gang gis skal ba dang ldan pa de dag ni de kho na bzhin du de la brten to zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par byas nas de nyid la
analyzed: ci rigs su zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag ji ltar gang gis skal ba dang ldan pa de dag ni de kho na bzhin du de la brten to zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par byas nas de nyid la
translated: “ As is appropriate” means in relation to others. “ At the appropriate time” means that, having understood that those who are worthy of being helped in a certain way are to be helped in just that way,

original: 'dzud par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dzud par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one engages in that very thing, not in something else. This is the meaning.

original: yid la bya ba ni rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: yid la bya ba ni rnal 'byor te /
translated: “ Mental attention” is yoga.

original: de dang mthun pa'i dus su ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rtogs nas /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i dus su ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rtogs nas /
translated: Having understood that this is the appropriate time for that,

original: bdag nyid kyang rnal 'byor la 'jug la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang rnal 'byor la 'jug la /
translated: one engages in yoga oneself,

original: gzhan rnal 'byor dang ldan pas yang de'i dus su slong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan rnal 'byor dang ldan pas yang de'i dus su slong bar mi byed do //
translated: and one does not request help from others at that time.

original: de bzhin du nyin par dang mtshan mo yang gang gi tshe gang la 'jug par bya ba de yang shes dus gang gi tshe bya ba 'bras bu yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba de yang shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin par dang mtshan mo yang gang gi tshe gang la 'jug par bya ba de yang shes dus gang gi tshe bya ba 'bras bu yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba de yang shes so //
translated: Likewise, he knows the time for engaging in activities during the day and night, and he knows the time for engaging in activities that are fruitful and not fruitless.

original: mngon par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Renunciation is the going forth from home to homelessness.

original: dge ba'i sbyor ba snga ma de las ma nyams par khyad par phyi ma thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus mchog byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i sbyor ba snga ma de las ma nyams par khyad par phyi ma thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus mchog byed pa'o //
translated: He makes supreme effort to attain the next higher stage without losing the previous stage of wholesome practice.

original: de nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the two types of non-regression.

original: 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa las yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa las yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
translated: Non-regression from what has been attained means not losing what has been attained.

original: rgyun mi gcod pa zhes bya ba ni ma thob pas yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa zhes bya ba ni ma thob pas yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
translated: Non-regression from what has not been attained means not losing what has not been attained.

original: sgrub pa bcu pa kho na la mchod pa gnyis smos pa'i phyir tshig gnyis kyis bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa bcu pa kho na la mchod pa gnyis smos pa'i phyir tshig gnyis kyis bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the two types of worship are mentioned only in the tenth stage, it should be understood that they are explained by the two phrases.

original: yod pa nyid du ni yid ches la nus pa nyid du ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du ni yid ches la nus pa nyid du ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: One has confidence in their existence, but one does not accept their capability.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la so sor 'di gnyi ga sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la so sor 'di gnyi ga sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply both of these to the bodhisattva practices and to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: lhag ma gsum ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas @41b la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas @41b la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa ste /
translated: The other three are: the generation of the power of shame and embarrassment, worship and service to the Buddhas, and the generation of the power of effort.

original: de la dang pos ni dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang du mi len te bdag gir mi byed cing de dag gis ngo tsha bar byed do //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang du mi len te bdag gir mi byed cing de dag gis ngo tsha bar byed do //
translated: By the first, one does not accept and appropriate the resistances to faith, etc., and one is ashamed of them.

original: gnyis pas ni gang gis na de dag las mu stegs can la sogs pa phyir rgol ba rnams kyis bskyod par mi nus te mi g-yos shing mi bzlogs so //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni gang gis na de dag las mu stegs can la sogs pa phyir rgol ba rnams kyis bskyod par mi nus te mi g-yos shing mi bzlogs so //
translated: By the second, one is not moved, does not turn back, and cannot be swayed by any opponents, such as the heterodox, etc.

original: gsum pas ni tshe phyi ma la dad pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa ba zhes bya ba skye ba dang mthun pa'i gnas lus yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni tshe phyi ma la dad pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa ba zhes bya ba skye ba dang mthun pa'i gnas lus yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: By the third, he takes up a body and life that is favorable to the arising of those roots of virtue, faith, etc.
