original: de nyid sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa rgya chen pos zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa rgya chen pos zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That very thing is shown by the phrase “with vast worship and service to the Buddhas.”

original: de'i rnam par smin par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin par gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the evolutionary development of that.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pas ni sems las su rung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pas ni sems las su rung ba yin te /
translated: By the worship of spiritual practice, he has a serviceable mind.

original: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i bya ba kho na la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i bya ba kho na la 'jug go //
translated: It is the natural outcome of that, for by the power of previous practice he engages only in virtuous activities.

original: sum cu lnga po snga ma ni rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sum cu lnga po snga ma ni rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first thirty-five verses have been an extensive explanation.

original: 'di dag ni mdor bsdus nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mdor bsdus nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is a summary of them.

original: yon tan gyi zhing la dgod pa ni sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la mchod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi zhing la dgod pa ni sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la mchod par byed pa ste /
translated: The field of virtues is the worship of the Buddhas and the Sangha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'di la gnas pa de la zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'di la gnas pa de la zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: “When he is established in this Joyful stage of the bodhisattva” means from the beginning.

original: dge 'dun la yang tshogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ri mo byed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang tshogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ri mo byed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: He also draws the Saṅgha, the assembly of the noble ones.

original: bla na med pa'i 'bras bur dgod pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i 'bras bur dgod pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He dedicates those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: snying rje'i zhing du dgod pa ni de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba kun du skyes pa yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i zhing du dgod pa ni de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba kun du skyes pa yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: He matures sentient beings by making offerings to those Buddha Bhagavāns.

original: las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin te //
analyzed: las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin te //
translated: He becomes fit for the work.

original: 'di ni dgod pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dgod pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: This is the threefold dedication.

original: mang po zhes bya ba'i grangs smos pa ni de rtogs nas dad pa rab yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba'i grangs smos pa ni de rtogs nas dad pa rab yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of “many” is for the purpose of generating supreme faith after understanding that.

original: gzugs kyi sku ni sha'i mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni sha'i mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: The form body is seen with the fleshly eye.

original: chos kyi sku ni shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: The Dharma body is seen with the eye of wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rgya chen pos zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rgya chen pos zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: With a vast superior attitude means with a superior attitude to protect all sentient beings.

original: bsti stang byed ces bya ba 'di nyid tshig gsum gyis rnam par 'byed de /🔽bstod pas @42a * //
analyzed: bsti stang byed ces bya ba 'di nyid tshig gsum gyis rnam par 'byed de / bstod pas @42a * //
translated: With respect means with three things:

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas tshigs bcad du bsdebs pas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas tshigs bcad du bsdebs pas te /
translated: With praise means with verses, with a combination of verses.

original: rdul med rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul med rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Without dust, free from dust, etc.

original: bsngags pas zhes bya ba ni rkyang bar bsdebs pa ste /
analyzed: bsngags pas zhes bya ba ni rkyang bar bsdebs pa ste /
translated: With eulogy means with a combination of prose.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rgyu mthun ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rgyu mthun ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That Tathagata is the cause, etc.

original: na bza' dang zhal zas dang gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos sman dang yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing zhes bya ba ni des nye bar ston pas bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshogs bstsags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na bza' dang zhal zas dang gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos sman dang yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing zhes bya ba ni des nye bar ston pas bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshogs bstsags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And with offerings of robes, alms-food, bedding, seat, remedies for exhaustion, and medicinal appliances, means that he teaches with that, in order to accumulate the equipment of wisdom for himself.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said:

original: nye bar ston pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: nye bar ston pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of teaching are

original: ye shes kyi tshogs stsogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs stsogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: the accumulation of the aggregate of wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos smra ba rnams la zang zing gis nye bar ston pa dang / ye shes kyis nye bar ston pa dang / chos kyis nye bar ston pa dang / shes rab kyis nye bar ston pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la zang zing gis nye bar ston pa dang / ye shes kyis nye bar ston pa dang / chos kyis nye bar ston pa dang / shes rab kyis nye bar ston pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Teaching through material things, teaching through wisdom, teaching through the Dharma, and teaching through wisdom.

original: /'god pa ni 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: /'god pa ni 'jog pa ste /
translated: Placing is setting.

original: zhing gnyis la ni de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing gnyis la ni de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two fields are the objects of that teaching.

original: bla na med pa la ni 'bras bur yongs su bsngo bas so //🔽tshogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ri mo byed ces bya ba ni gtso bo ji lta ba gdams nas gang zag rnams la ri mo byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bla na med pa la ni 'bras bur yongs su bsngo bas so // tshogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ri mo byed ces bya ba ni gtso bo ji lta ba gdams nas gang zag rnams la ri mo byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The highest is the highest object.🔽One makes a true image of the assembly means that one does not make an image of persons by merely following the principal person.

original: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor does one make an image of the assembly as a whole.

original: 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i ngo bor dge 'dun ma lus pa la bya ba byed do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i ngo bor dge 'dun ma lus pa la bya ba byed do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: He acts in the nature of an assembly, for all the members of the Saṅgha, because he is endowed with great wealth.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba kun tu skyes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de yongs su smin pa'i mthu rnyed pas so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba kun tu skyes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de yongs su smin pa'i mthu rnyed pas so //
translated: He is born for the full development of living beings, because he has attained the power of their full development.

original: ma lus par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma lus par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But he does not fully realize it,

original: ji ltar sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dag kun tu skyes pa ltar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dag kun tu skyes pa ltar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: just as he is born for generosity and agreeable speech.🔽He does not fail to practice the remaining perfections as much as possible,

original: lhag ma rnams ni ci nus ci 'os su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la lhag ma rnams kyi sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ci nus ci 'os su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la lhag ma rnams kyi sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is possible for him to apply himself to the remaining perfections.

original: sa bdun pa las de'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag yang dag par 'grub pa /
analyzed: sa bdun pa las de'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag yang dag par 'grub pa /
translated: On the seventh stage, his thought and the thought of enlightenment are fully matured, and the ten perfections of the bodhisattva are fully accomplished in his thought.

original: yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that one will attain perfect success.

original: ci nus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci nus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To the best of one's ability means

original: rang gi zho sha dang @42b 'tsham pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zho sha dang @42b 'tsham pa'o //
translated: in accordance with one's own strength.

original: ci 'os su zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rten dang 'tsham pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'os su zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rten dang 'tsham pa'o //
translated: To the best of one's power means in accordance with the strength of others.

original: lhag ma ni sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as it was previously explained.

original: shas cher yongs su byang ba dang zhes bya ba ni spyor ba brling po shas che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shas cher yongs su byang ba dang zhes bya ba ni spyor ba brling po shas che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is predominantly purified means that the intense practice is predominant.

original: yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is completely purified means

original: le lo la sogs pa'i dri ma spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa'i dri ma spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that the stains of laziness, etc., are abandoned.

original: las su rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i mthu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las su rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i mthu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes serviceable means that one obtains the power to benefit sentient beings.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so zhes bya ba de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so zhes bya ba de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa yang yin la /
translated: The knowledge that is subsequent to that is mundane and supramundane knowledge.

original: de gzhan dag la med pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la med pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also supramundane because it is not found in others.

original: yang na 'di ni sa gnyis pa yin pas 'jig rten par bshad de /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni sa gnyis pa yin pas 'jig rten par bshad de /
translated: Or else, it is mundane because it is the second stage,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: and supramundane because it is the nature of the second stage, etc.

original: de la brtag pa la mkhas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po 'jig pa dang 'grub pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la brtag pa la mkhas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po 'jig pa dang 'grub pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: Among them, skill in investigation is skill in the destruction of adverse elements and the realization of antidotes.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: des mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la mkhas par bya ste /
analyzed: des mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la mkhas par bya ste /
translated: He should be skilled in the adverse elements and the antidotes.

original: sa'i 'jig pa dang 'grub pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i 'jig pa dang 'grub pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, “skill in the destruction and realization of the stages.”

original: 'thob pa la mkhas pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs la zhugs pa dang / de'i khyad par la mkhas pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa la mkhas pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs la zhugs pa dang / de'i khyad par la mkhas pa dag ste /
translated: Skill in attainment is skill in the means of entry and skill in its distinctions.

original: sa'i rnam pa dang rgyu mthun pa la mkhas pa dang / sa thob pa rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i yan lag yongs su sbyangs ba la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sa'i rnam pa dang rgyu mthun pa la mkhas pa dang / sa thob pa rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i yan lag yongs su sbyangs ba la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: Skill in the aspects and concordant causes of the stages, skill in the analysis of the attainment of the stages, and skill in the purification of the branches of the stages.

original: 'phel ba la mkhas pa ni sa gzhan du 'pho ba dang ; gnas pa dang 'phel ba la mkhas pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba la mkhas pa ni sa gzhan du 'pho ba dang ; gnas pa dang 'phel ba la mkhas pa dag ste /
translated: Skill in increase is skill in the transference, abiding, and increase of other stages.🔽Because it is said, respectively:

original: sa nas sar 'phar ba la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa'i khyad par shes pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sa nas sar 'phar ba la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa'i khyad par shes pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: Skill in ascending from stage to stage, skill in abiding in the stages, and skill in knowing the differences between the stages.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa la mkhas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa la mkhas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skill in nondegeneration is skill in irreversibility.

original: sa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said: Skill in attaining the stages and not degenerating.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar phyin nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar phyin nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skill in going to the ultimate is skill in entering the tathagata stage after completing the bodhisattva stage.

original: byang chub sems @43a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems @43a * //
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi says:

original: dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sa mnan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sa mnan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva should be skilled in entering the tathagata stage of gnosis after purifying all the bodhisattva stages.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas sngar rnam pa dang bcas pa bshad pa rnams kyis sa sgrub pa dang / mkhas pa rnam pa lnga po bshad ma thag pas dad pa la sogs pas yan lag rnams sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas sngar rnam pa dang bcas pa bshad pa rnams kyis sa sgrub pa dang / mkhas pa rnam pa lnga po bshad ma thag pas dad pa la sogs pas yan lag rnams sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, skill in accomplishing the aspects of the bodhisattva stages is the skill in accomplishing the stages by the previously explained aspects in the manner explained and the skill in accomplishing the branches such as faith by the five just explained.

original: lhag ma dpes bstan pa ni mdo nyid las rnam par 'chad de /
analyzed: lhag ma dpes bstan pa ni mdo nyid las rnam par 'chad de /
translated: The remaining similes are explained in the sutra itself.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this.

original: dper na zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From for example up to

original: lam gyi bar gnas dang po nas gyen du ma bskyod par zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni mi nor ba'i mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi bar gnas dang po nas gyen du ma bskyod par zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni mi nor ba'i mkhas pa yin no //
translated: without moving from the first stage of the path is the skill in not erring.

original: de de ltar shes par rnam par brtags pa'i blo dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de de ltar shes par rnam par brtags pa'i blo dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From with a mind that investigates in this way up to

original: grong khyer chen por phyin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer chen por phyin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: arrives at the great city is the skill in teaching.

original: 'brog dgon pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis bdag dang 'dron pa rnams la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mkhas pa gnyi ga'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'brog dgon pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis bdag dang 'dron pa rnams la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mkhas pa gnyi ga'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of both skills is neither I nor the caravan will be harmed by the dangers of the wilderness.

original: thog ma nyid nas sa'i lam gyi yon tan zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid nas sa'i lam gyi yon tan zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From the qualities of the path of the land from the very beginning up to

original: de lam gyi bar gnas dang po nas ma bskyod par zhes bya ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi nor ba'i mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lam gyi bar gnas dang po nas ma bskyod par zhes bya ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi nor ba'i mkhas pa yin no //
translated: without moving from the first stage of the path is the skill in not erring of the bodhisattva.

original: de de ltar ye shes kyis rnam par brtags pa'i blo dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de de ltar ye shes kyis rnam par brtags pa'i blo dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, the text continues, “the mind that is thoroughly investigated by pristine awareness” and so on.

original: bsgral te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen po'i bar du phyin par byed ces bya ba'i bar 'di ni nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgral te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen po'i bar du phyin par byed ces bya ba'i bar 'di ni nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: From Having thus examined with wisdom up to having crossed over and having gone to the great city of omniscience, this is the skill in teaching.

original: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa rnams kyi nyes pas sems can gyi 'dron pa 'am bdag la gnod par 'gyur bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di na mkhas pa de gnyi ga'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa rnams kyi nyes pas sems can gyi 'dron pa 'am bdag la gnod par 'gyur bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di na mkhas pa de gnyi ga'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The phrase he does not allow the caravan of sentient beings or himself to be harmed by the faults of the wilderness of cyclic existence is the result of both of those skills.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas yongs su mi skyo bar sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i khyad par la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras bu de'i rgyu la sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas yongs su mi skyo bar sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i khyad par la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras bu de'i rgyu la sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: O sons of the victors, therefore, bodhisattvas should strive in the distinctive training in the purification of the levels without becoming weary. This should be understood as the application to the cause of that result.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rim pa ni pha rol tu phyin @43b pa rnams yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rim pa ni pha rol tu phyin @43b pa rnams yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The stages of the bodhisattva's practice together with their natures should be known as the perfections,

original: de dag tu mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the means of accomplishing them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim gyis sa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir de yid la byed pa ni 'dod pa'i don yid la byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim gyis sa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir de yid la byed pa ni 'dod pa'i don yid la byed pa dag yin no //
translated: The mental attentions to the perfections are the mental attentions to the desired aims, because they are the means of attaining the stages, etc.

original: chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Reality is thusness,

original: de la bdag gis sbyin no snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bdag gis sbyin no snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspects of I give, etc. do not exist in it.

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam zhes bya ba ni dus thung du shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam zhes bya ba ni dus thung du shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moment, minute, and period are stated in three ways in order to understand short periods of time.

original: yang na nyan pa po rnams kyi dbang du dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul pos go bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa po rnams kyi dbang du dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul pos go bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, they are for the sake of those who listen, in order to be understood by those of sharp, middling, and low acumen.

original: sdig pa dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase in terms of being free from evil means in order to be free from evil.

original: spyan lnga ni /
analyzed: spyan lnga ni /
translated: The five eyes are

original: de na 'phags dang shes rab spyan //
analyzed: de na 'phags dang shes rab spyan //
translated: the eye of noble wisdom,

original: lha dang de bzhin sha yi spyan //
analyzed: lha dang de bzhin sha yi spyan //
translated: the eye of gods, and likewise the eye of flesh,🔽and the eye of Dharma, and the eye of Buddha.

original: byang chub kyang ni 'thob 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: byang chub kyang ni 'thob 'gyur zhing //
translated: One will attain enlightenment

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: and will be equal to the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ste 'di'i don ni sa bcu pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste 'di'i don ni sa bcu pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of this will be explained in the Ten Stages.

original: rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase the body of causes and the characteristics of results means the nature of causes and results.

original: lus dang mtshan nyid dag ni rang bzhin brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang mtshan nyid dag ni rang bzhin brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a body and characteristics are expressions of a nature.

original: ji ltar mos pas spyod pa'i sa ba'i 'bras bu sa dang po yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pas spyod pa'i sa ba'i 'bras bu sa dang po yin la /
translated: Just as the first stage is the result of the stage of action out of faith,

original: sa dang po'i 'bras bu sa gnyis pa yin pa de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyis yin te /
analyzed: sa dang po'i 'bras bu sa gnyis pa yin pa de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyis yin te /
translated: and the second stage is the result of the first stage, in the same way, the stage of Buddha is the result of the tenth stage.

original: rgyu de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established from that cause.🔽Ārya Mañjuśrī also says in the Peak of the Mountain Scripture:

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang mgo ri'i rtse mo'i mdo las sems dang po bskyed pa ni spyod pa dang 'brel ba'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang mgo ri'i rtse mo'i mdo las sems dang po bskyed pa ni spyod pa dang 'brel ba'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first generation of the mind should be seen as the cause connected with conduct.

original: spyod pa dang 'brel ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dang 'brel ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is connected with conduct should be known as the cause of irreversibility.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Irreversibility should be seen as the cause of being obstructed by one birth.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is obstructed by one birth should be seen as the cause of omniscience.

original: yang na rgyu'i lus ni 'bras bus rtogs pas na rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i lus ni 'bras bus rtogs pas na rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Again, the body of the cause is understood by the result, so the body of the cause and the characteristic of the result are called

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bus shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bus shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the nature of the cause is known by the result.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'bras bu kho na yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'bras bu kho na yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is only the result, not the cause.

original: de las lhag pa'i sa gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la gong nas gong du mchog tu @44a * //
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i sa gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la gong nas gong du mchog tu @44a * //
translated: There is no other level higher than that.🔽

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other stage higher than that, and because there is no higher stage than the Buddha stage.

original: dang po'i sa la sbyang byas nas //
analyzed: dang po'i sa la sbyang byas nas //
translated: Having trained on the first stage,

original: rnam par dag pa mthong ba ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa mthong ba ni //
translated: the pure vision

original: sa gnyis don du gnyer byed de //
analyzed: sa gnyis don du gnyer byed de //
translated: strives for the second stage,

original: de thob bya phyir rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: de thob bya phyir rab tu sbyor //
translated: and applies itself to attain it.

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam dag pa //
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam dag pa //
translated: With a completely pure intention,

original: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba na //🔽de tshe 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi ;
analyzed: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba na // de tshe 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi ;
translated: thus applying itself,🔽at that time it attains the vast,

original: / dri spangs pa ni rgya chen 'thob //
analyzed: / dri spangs pa ni rgya chen 'thob //
translated: free of the stain of immorality.

original: dri ma med pa'i bsam pa yis //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i bsam pa yis //
translated: With a stainless intention,

original: sa gnyis rgya chen 'thob pa ni //
analyzed: sa gnyis rgya chen 'thob pa ni //
translated: it attains the vast second stage,

original: yon tan rnam pa bzhi brten nas //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhi brten nas //
translated: based on four kinds of virtues,

original: rang bzhin tshul khrims 'thob par 'gyur //🔽tshul khrims yongs su dag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin tshul khrims 'thob par 'gyur // tshul khrims yongs su dag bya'i phyir //
translated: it attains natural morality.

original: yon tan dag ni bzhir 'dod de //
analyzed: yon tan dag ni bzhir 'dod de //
translated: Four virtues are considered🔽for the sake of completely pure morality.

original: gzhan las yang dag gnod pa dang // bsam pa rnam par dag nyid dang // 'das nas sor chud byed pa dang // ma 'das pa la gus pa'o //🔽mkhas pas yon tan 'di rnams kyi //🔽bya ba dag ni bzhir bshad de //🔽gzhan la ltos nas khrel yod dang // bdag la ltos nas ngo tshar 'dod //🔽sems la 'gyod pa med pa dang // tshul khrims gsum ni mi 'dra ba'o //🔽sa dang po'i gleng gzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / byin gyi rlabs dang / ldang ba dang / bstan pa dang / bskul ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sa gnyis pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi yang yin par shes par bya ste /🔽'di ltar gleng gzhi ni gnas dang gdul ba rnams yin la /
analyzed: gzhan las yang dag gnod pa dang // bsam pa rnam par dag nyid dang // 'das nas sor chud byed pa dang // ma 'das pa la gus pa'o // mkhas pas yon tan 'di rnams kyi // bya ba dag ni bzhir bshad de // gzhan la ltos nas khrel yod dang // bdag la ltos nas ngo tshar 'dod // sems la 'gyod pa med pa dang // tshul khrims gsum ni mi 'dra ba'o // sa dang po'i gleng gzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / byin gyi rlabs dang / ldang ba dang / bstan pa dang / bskul ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sa gnyis pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi yang yin par shes par bya ste / 'di ltar gleng gzhi ni gnas dang gdul ba rnams yin la /
translated: 1. not being harmed by others, 2. purity of intention, 3. restoration of transgressions, and 4. respect for the precepts.🔽These are the four duties🔽of the wise with regard to these virtues.🔽🔽Shame is considered to be dependent on others,🔽embarrassment is considered to be dependent on oneself.🔽🔽There is no regret in the mind, and the three moralities are not violated.🔽The introduction to the first stage, the meditative concentration, the consecration, the rising, the teaching, and the exhortation are to be understood as the same for the second and subsequent stages.🔽Thus, the introduction is the place and the disciples.🔽

original: 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir gnas gzhan dang / gdul ba gzhan dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir gnas gzhan dang / gdul ba gzhan dag kyang ma yin no //

original: 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir rdo rje'i snying po snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir rdo rje'i snying po snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In order to explain these, Vajragarbha does not enter into any other meditative absorption.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang byin gyis rlob par mdzad ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang byin gyis rlob par mdzad ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not bless him.

original: snyoms par ma zhugs pas ldang ba yang ga la yod /
analyzed: snyoms par ma zhugs pas ldang ba yang ga la yod /
translated: How can he arise without entering meditative absorption?

original: 'di dag gi bstan pa yang ming tsam gyis don bshad pa byas pa nyid de //
analyzed: 'di dag gi bstan pa yang ming tsam gyis don bshad pa byas pa nyid de //
translated: Their teaching is also explained by the mere name.

original: sa 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i zla ba la sogs pas yang skul bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sa 'di dag bshad pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i zla ba la sogs pas yang skul bar yang mi byed do //
translated: In order to explain these stages, Vajragarbha does not urge on the likes of Vimukti candra.

original: sa gnyis pa'i bshad pa dang khyad par zhes bya ba 'di gnyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa'i bshad pa dang khyad par zhes bya ba 'di gnyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the second stage and the distinction should be stated.

original: bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of explanation,

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said to possess realization and so on.

original: de la 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni rgyu rnam par @44b dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni rgyu rnam par @44b dag pa ste /
translated: Therein, the purity of origination is the purity of cause.

original: de dag kyang sems kyi bsam pa bcu po dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems kyi bsam pa bcu po dag go //
translated: These are the ten mental contemplations.

original: so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “without the activity of discernment” means that, just as one should go and just as one should practice with regard to morality, etc., one goes and practices in just that way.🔽In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa de sgrub na /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa de sgrub na /
translated: “When one practices morality, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas gnod pa na so sor brtags pa shes rab kyi stobs kyis de dag zil gyis mnan nas bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas gnod pa na so sor brtags pa shes rab kyi stobs kyis de dag zil gyis mnan nas bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: without the activity of discernment, because one does not practice them by the power of discernment, having overcome desire, etc.,

original: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims la rang gi tshul khrims 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims la rang gi tshul khrims 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one goes by the power of one’s nature, as one’s morality, etc., go.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa gsum zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa gsum zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the moralities of the bodhisattvas said to be threefold?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims khyad zhugs par shes par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po 'di mdor bsdus nas bshad de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims khyad zhugs par shes par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po 'di mdor bsdus nas bshad de /
translated: These three kinds of morality are explained in brief in order to show that the morality of the bodhisattva is superior to the morality of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of morality

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje yis //
translated: is the cause of the bodhisattva’s compassion,

original: byang chub lam ni khyad par byed //
analyzed: byang chub lam ni khyad par byed //
translated: which makes the path to enlightenment special.

original: dang po spong ba'i tshul khrims te //
analyzed: dang po spong ba'i tshul khrims te //
translated: The first is the morality of restraint,

original: gnyis pa dge ba sdud pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa dge ba sdud pa yin //
translated: the second is the morality of gathering virtue,

original: gsum pa sems can bya ba'i ste //
analyzed: gsum pa sems can bya ba'i ste //
translated: the third is the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: don rnam gsum ni bsgrub pa yin /
analyzed: don rnam gsum ni bsgrub pa yin /
translated: These three are accomplished for the sake of three goals.

original: 'di la / dang po yang dag len pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'di la / dang po yang dag len pa'i rgyu //
translated: The first is the cause of taking up the path,

original: gnyis pa dge ba'i pha rol byed //🔽gsum pa sems can rnams kyi rgyud //
analyzed: gnyis pa dge ba'i pha rol byed // gsum pa sems can rnams kyi rgyud //
translated: the second is the cause of perfecting virtue,🔽the third is the cause of perfecting

original: pha rol byed par yang dag bshad //
analyzed: pha rol byed par yang dag bshad //
translated: the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽Because of the perfection of application and intention

original: sbyor dang bsam pa phun tshogs dang // mi mthun phyogs rnams nyams pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyor dang bsam pa phun tshogs dang // mi mthun phyogs rnams nyams pa'i phyir //
translated: and the decrease of counteragents.

original: rang bzhin tshul khrims gang yin pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin tshul khrims gang yin pa //
translated: What is natural morality?

original: da ni las lam mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: da ni las lam mtshan nyid yin //
translated: Now, the characteristics of the path of action.

original: de la dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gis mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gnyis shig bstan te /
analyzed: de la dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gis mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gnyis shig bstan te /
translated: In brief, the ten paths of virtuous action teach two kinds of excellence, which are endowed with four aspects.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Excellence of application and excellence of intention.

original: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Excellence of application is twofold:

original: bde bar sbyor ba dang / phan par sbyor ba'o //🔽de la srog gcod pa spong ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bde bar sbyor ba dang / phan par sbyor ba'o // de la srog gcod pa spong ba nas bzung ste /
translated: application to happiness and application to benefit.

original: tshig rtsub po spong ba'i bar ni /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po spong ba'i bar ni /
translated: Among these, from the avoidance of taking life up to the avoidance of harsh speech,🔽one should understand

original: bde bar sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: application to happiness.

original: tshig 'khyal pa spong ba ni phan par sbyor @45a * //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa spong ba ni phan par sbyor @45a * //
translated: The avoidance of idle speech is application to benefit.

original: ba'o // bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ba'o // bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Excellence of intention is also twofold:

original: bde ba'i bsam pa dang phan pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i bsam pa dang phan pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: the intention of happiness and the intention of benefit.

original: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dag ni bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dag ni bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The absence of covetousness and the absence of malice are the intention to bring happiness.
